Profile: Mojahedul Islam Nayyer. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Mojahedul Islam Nayyer is an assistant professor at the School of Civil Engineering at KIIT University. Mr. Nayyer works to improve the management of infrastructure projects in India and abroad. He has global exposure in the planning and execution of mega projects. He has done collaborative research with professors at Harvard University, IIT Madras, and IIT Guwahati. His work on infrastructure projects was recognized as the best paper at the World Building Congress, held at RMIT University Australia in 2022.
Mr. Nayyer completed his B.Tech in Civil Engineering from BIT Sindri. Thereafter, he was involved in the construction of a 2000 MW thermal power plant project in Jharkhand. While implementing this project, Mr. Nayyer developed an interest in understanding the planning and execution of infrastructure projects in India. Hence, he joined the M.Tech - Infrastructure Engineering and Management program at the IIT Guwahati. After that, he joined KIIT Deemed to be University to teach B.Tech and M.Tech students. Since then, he has dedicated more than ten years to upskilling the youth entering the construction industry. He has guided more than ten M.Tech students in their dissertations. During his stay at KIIT, he started a new program, "Construction Management and Infrastructure Development (CMID)", designed specially to meet the challenges of the construction industry in the country. 
Moreover, Mr. Nayyer realized that corruption is a common phenomenon associated with infrastructure projects in many countries of the world. It hurts the performance of infrastructure projects and endangers accountability. Mr. Nayyer's unending curiosity motivated him to explore this aspect of infrastructure projects in an academic setting. He joined the PhD program at IIT Madras and focused his research on the impact of transparency and accountability on the performance of infrastructure projects. In his research, he analyzed the data from 997 completed highway projects implemented in India during the last 20 years. He found that the Indian Right to Information (RTI) Act 2005 significantly impacted the cost and schedule performance of highway projects. Projects implemented after the enactment of the RTI Act had lower time and cost overruns. His finding gives new hope that infrastructure projects can be completed efficiently in a transparent and accountable environment. Nayyer's research has been covered by Emerald, Springer, Edward Elgar, Earth and Environment Science, Swarajya, etc. He is a frequent writer and commentator on infrastructure projects. Details: Email: mojahedul.nayyerfce@kiit.ac.in. Additional Info: Educational Qualification: Ph.D. - Indian Institute of Technology MadrasM.Tech. - Indian Institute of Technology GuwahatiB.Tech. – BIT Sindri Jharkhand. Research Interests: Project Management in ConstructionProcurement of Infrastructure ProjectsFinancing Mega ProjectsPublic-Private Partnership in InfrastructureRisk Management of Infrastructure Projects. Profile: Nazia Tazin Imran. Role: Assistant professor. Bio: Nazia Tazin Imran is an assistant professor at the School of Civil Engineering- KIIT Deemed to be University. She obtained her B.Tech. in Civil Engineering from state government college Indira Gandhi Institute of Technology (IGIT) Sarang, Odisha. Thereafter, she pursued her M.Tech in Transportation Engineering at the National Institute of Technology (NIT), Warangal. During her stay in Warangal, her M.Tech dissertation was focused on the signal coordination of the major arterial network in the city. Thereafter, she went on to pursue a Ph.D. from the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Madras. She is currently working on developing a bus signal priority system at a signalized intersection using vehicle-to-infrastructure (V2I) communication. The objective is to make transit services more appealing by reducing their schedule deviation and thus boosting their reliability to encourage more sustainable modes of transportation. Details: Email: nazia.imranfce@kiit.ac.in. Additional Info: Educational Qualification: Ph.D. - IIT Madras, Tamil Nadu

Profile: Paromita Chakraborty. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Dr. Paromita Chakraborty is an Associate Professor in School of Civil Engineering at KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, India. She joined KIIT-DU in 2012 and has been involved in various teaching and research activity. She earned her M.Tech in Hydraulics and Water Resource Enginnering from Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur, and Ph.D. from Indian Institute of Technology Bhubaneswar, Odisha. She is having 14 years of teaching and research experience besides 2 years of Industrial experience. Previously she has a worked in multinational company (Lons Lang Lasalle Megraj), and also worked in the educational institute ICFAI University Tripura. She has published many research articles in reputed international journals and conferences. Her Research domains are on the field of Flow Hydraulics in Open Channel, experimental analysis and modeling of Vegetated Flow, Multiphase Non-Newtonian Flow, Reservoir Sedimentation, and Rainfall-runoff modeling and hydrodynamic flow simulation. Profile: Prasanna Kumar Acharya. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Dr. Prasanna Kumar Acharya has been serving as an Associate Professor in the School of Civil Engineering at KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, since January 2020. Before his academic tenure, he amassed over 30 years of extensive professional experience in the Public Works Department (PWD), Government of Odisha. During his distinguished career in PWD, he successfully led and executed numerous large-scale infrastructure projects, including highways, bridges, road over bridges (ROBs), and high-rise buildings. He also holds specialized expertise in the rehabilitation and retrofitting of civil engineering structures. Dr. Acharya’s research interests encompass sustainable construction materials, circular economy in construction, green concrete technology, geopolymer concrete, functionally graded concrete, and structural rehabilitation techniques. He has published several research papers in reputed international journals, contributing significantly to advancements in sustainable and innovative construction technologies. He is actively involved in various professional bodies and holds memberships and fellowships in prestigious organizations. He is a Life Member of the Indian Science Congress Association (ISCA), Indian Concrete Institute (ICI), Indian Roads Congress (IRC), and Indian Building Congress (IBC). Additionally, he is a Fellow (FIE) and Chartered Engineer of the Institution of Engineers (India). Details: Email: prasanna.acharyafce@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 56725221300. Additional Info:

As Team Leader, completed a project of ₹ 1.03 Crore in 2022 on Fecal Sludge Management and Research for the Housing and Urban Development Department, Government of Odisha, through Ernst & Young LLP.
Working as a Project Formulation Team Member for NHAI Projects“ Improvement to Road Infrastructure Ecosystem in the Country under Institutional Social Responsibility (ISR) for two stretches of highway- Stretch 1- Chandikhole to Bhadrak (NH-16)-74.5 KM, Stretch 2- Panokoili to Remuli (NH-20)-166 KM.
Working with the National Council for Cement and Building Materials (NCCBM) in a Research and Development Project titled “Stress-strain behaviour of high-performance Geo- polymer self-compacting concrete mix and its performance evaluation”.
Received URR Pattnaik Memorial Award (2025) from the Institution of Engineers
(India), for the research paper “Concrete making with sintered fly ash aggregates:
Turning trash into treasure”.

and microstructural analysis”.

ash and fly ash as source materials”
Received Best Paper Award (2023) at the 2 nd International Conference SMPBE 2023

Profile: Purnachandra Saha. Role: Professor. Bio: Dr. Purnachandra Saha is a Professor in School of Civil Engineering at KIIT DU, Bhubaneswar, India. He joined KIIT-DU in 2013 and has been involved in various teaching, and research activities. He received his PhD from IIT Bombay and teaching in Universities since 2009. He has worked in a multinational company (mainly design of industrial structure before completing his doctoral degree) for seven and half years. He has written more than 120 research articles (Journal & Conference Papers) among which 35 are with B. Tech students till date. He is Faculty Advisor of ASCE KIIT University Student Chapter. He Guided B. Tech students to won National Level Steel Design Competition organized by INSDAG, Ministry of Steel for 4 times (2016-17, 2019-20 and 2020-21, 2021-22). He is Member of ASCE, IE (I), EERI, ACI and Council of Vibration Specialists. Profile: Rakesh Ranjan Thakur. Role: Assistant Professor (II). Bio: Dr. Thakur has done his Ph.D. in Remote Sensing & Geoinformatics from Maharshi Dayanand Saraswati University, Ajmer, India, with more than 15 years of working experience in serving national and state-level scientific organizations. His research widely covers the fields of remote sensing, geospatial science, disaster management, natural resources management, mangrove and wetland studies, urban planning, water resources management, coastal vulnerability and applications, biodiversity studies, environmental studies, AI/ML-based applications in the geospatial domain, etc. With a strong research focus on harnessing geospatial technologies for sustainable development, he has made significant contributions to understanding and mitigating the impacts of natural disasters, managing natural resources, and monitoring environmental changes, informing policy and practice at local, national, and international levels. Details: Email: rakesh.thakurfce@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 58398139500, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?hl=en&user=C54zKFsAAAAJ&view_op=list_works&authuser=1&gmla=AH8HC4wazJWDXiSL_3wnuY6i3Sk-SqqTT2QhbsK0uSA_8Wgh-XtqeCqurnCxqfulGpIjjQPjtWnjLblgQ-5uMRhD. Profile: Satyajeet Nanda. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Dr. Satyajeet Nanda is working as an Associate Professor in the School of Civil Engineering, KIIT deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. He obtained Ph.D. in 2013 from the Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur. He completed his M.Tech from IIT BHU and B.Tech. from CET, OUAT Bhubaneswar. He has worked as postdoctoral research fellow in School of Natural and Built Environment, Queen’s University Belfast, United Kingdom between Dec. 2013 and Dec. 2016. 
Since the last eight years, Dr. Satyajeet Nanda is working on offshore Geotechnical engineering. He has been successfully completed a number of research assignment on various subjects related to offshore Geotechnical engineering. His research includes; load-settlement behavior of long piles, behavior of monopile in offshore loading condition, crushing properties of offshore sand, deep water anchor system and strain rate effect of soft soil using T-bar. Profile: Prof Sanjib Moulick. Role: Professor/Dean. Bio: Dr. Sanjib Moulick received his Ph.D. from IIT Kharagpur in 2002. He subsequently worked as a Research Associate at IIT Kharagpur from 2002 to 2003, and then took on the role of Design Engineer for the Kerala Water Supply Project in Thiruvananthapuram. He served as a faculty at SASTRA University, Thanjavur from 2004 to 2007, and at IIT Kharagpur from 2007 to 2011. Since 2012, he has been with KIIT University, starting as an Associate Professor (II) and advancing to the rank of Professor in 2016. He served as Associate Dean of the School of Civil Engineering from July 2017 to October 2020, before becoming the Dean from October 2020 to June 2024. He currently holds the position of Dean at KIIT eXtension School, overseeing the university's online programs.
During his tenure as Dean, the School of Civil Engineering achieved successful accreditation by both ABET, USA, and the NBA. He played a key role in establishing a partnership with L&T EduTech to introduce industry-focused specialization courses for B.Tech students, offering opportunities for industrial immersion, placement support, and internships. Additionally, he helped launch a Graduate Talent Development Program in Building Information Modeling (BIM) in collaboration with InteliBIM, aimed at final-year B.Tech students to equip them with vital skills for careers in construction technology and BIM. In partnership with UltraTech, Campus to Corporate program was launched for the final year BTech students, aiming to prepare them for corporate roles by combining academic coursework with internships. These collaborations with industry leaders provided students with exceptional access to real-world expertise, advanced technology, and a curriculum aligned with industry needs, ushering in a new era of growth and opportunity.
Dr. Moulick specializes in Environmental Engineering, with a focus on water and wastewater treatment, water reuse system design, and water quality management. He has guided seven Ph.D. scholars and eleven M.Tech students. His research has led to the publication of 35 Scopus-indexed peer-reviewed journal and conference papers, along with two patents. He has been involved in six sponsored research projects, funded by agencies such as SERB, DST, MOES, NABARD, ISIRD, as well as an industry-funded project on the "Performance Evaluation of Basuaghai Faecal Sludge Treatment Plant," conducted by Ernst & Young LLP under the "Swachha Odisha Sustha Odisha" initiative.
Over his 20-year academic career, Dr. Moulick has taught a variety of BTech and MTech courses, including Engineering Mechanics, Solid Mechanics, Engineering Drawing, Environmental Studies, Environmental Science, Structural Analysis, Environmental Engineering I & II, Transport of Water and Wastewater, Solid and Hazardous Waste Management, and Water Quality Modelling and Management. Details: Email: smoulickfce@kiit.ac.in. Additional Info: Educational Qualification: Ph.D. from IIT Kharagpur in 2002. Research Interests: Environmental Engineering

Profile: Abhaya Kumar Sahoo. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Dr. Abhaya Kumar Sahoo is currently working as an Associate Professor in School of Computer Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University, Odisha. He has completed his B. Tech, M. Tech and Ph.D. from KIIT Deemed to be University in 2010, 2012 and 2021 respectively.
He has received Founder’s Gold Medal and Chancellor’s Gold Medal in M. Tech. He has 8 years teaching experience and 1 year industry experience. His favourite teaching subjects include big data, operating system, web technology, computer organization and database. His area of research includes data analytics, recommender system, data security and data mining. He has published more than 20 research papers in national and international conferences and journals. He guides undergraduate and post graduate students in different project. He has also published more than five book chapters in different reputed books. He is involved in different academic activities such as organizing committee member in international conferences, reviewers in international journals, keynote speaker in workshop and different accreditation activities. He has attended more than thirty different programs such as a faculty development program, seminar and workshop in national and international level. He was Odisha State Student Coordinator in Computer Society of India during 2019-20. He has achieved CSI Young IT Professional award in 2013 and Best Faculty award for good academic performance in 2013 and 2014. He is the life member of CSI, IAENG, CSTA and IET. Profile: Abhishek Raj. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: I am an accomplished assistant professor specializing in the field of Computer Science and Engineering (CSE) with a focus on Machine Learning , Hardware Security and Computer Architecture. With a strong academic background and expertise in cutting-edge technologies, I have made significant contributions to the field. I completed my Master of Technology (MTech) degree in CSE from the prestigious Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Kharagpur. During my graduate studies, I developed a keen interest in the intricate interplay between hardware security and architectural design, ML exploring ways to enhance the resilience of computer systems against potential vulnerabilities and attacks. 
Having excelled in my academic pursuits, I embarked on a teaching career as an assistant professor, leveraging my expertise to inspire and educate the next generation of engineers. I have a natural aptitude for explaining complex concepts in a clear and engaging manner, making the subject matter accessible to students with diverse backgrounds. Alongside my teaching responsibilities, I am actively involved in research activities, striving to advance knowledge in the field of Digital VLSI Design , RF antenna design , IoT devices,  hardware security and architecture. Furthermore, I actively collaborate with industry professionals and engage in consultancy work, bridging the gap between academia and real-world applications. This allows me to stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in the field and incorporate practical insights into my teaching and research endeavors. As an assistant professor, I am known for my dedication to fostering a dynamic and inclusive learning environment. I prioritize individual student growth, offering guidance and mentorship to help students explore their passions and develop their skills. My approachable nature and commitment to excellence have earned me the respect and admiration of both colleagues and students.In summary, I am a highly accomplished assistant professor specializing in CSE with a specialization in ML ,  Hardware Security and Computer Architecture. Profile: Abhishek Ray. Role: Professor and Dean (Industry Engagements). Bio: Prof. (Dr.) Abhishek Ray
Professor & Dean (Industry Engagements)
With the quality of Novelty and Transparency a teacher who is a self motivated and loves of life as a teacher is to engage deeply with students to enhance their professional career. Over 25 years of experience in teaching, research & academic administration, out of which a successful 16+ years devoted specifically in the career augmentation, training and placement activities of a massive academic institution. 
During his 19+ years of association with KIIT, he had held various administrative positions in School of Computer Engineering from 2005 to 2020 in KIIT. He is currently serving as Dean (Industry Engagements) since 2020 at KIIT deemed to be University. 
Aim to consistently strive to create a challenging and engaging learning environment in which students become life-long scholars and learners. Dr. Abhishek Ray completed his Ph.D. (Computer Science & Engineering) from KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, M.E. (Computer Science & Engineering) from REC, Rourkela (currently renamed as NIT, Rourkela), Odisha, B.E. (Computer Science & Engineering) from Utkal University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. 
His teaching & research areas of interest are Compiler Design, Automata Theory, Software Engineering, SOA, Software Testing, AI, Data Analytics, Cloud Computing, Machine Learning, BlockChain, Image Processing, IoT, etc. He had guided 4 Ph.D scholars and 20+ Master’s Dissertation and had published / presented more than 30 research articles in the international & national journals, conferences and seminars. 
He has been a member of various professional bodies like IET, ISTE, ISC. He has been awarded as Dynamic Professor of the year 2021 by Global Teaching Excellence Awards 2021. Profile: Aleena Swetapadma. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Aleena Swetapadma started her career as assistant professor in School of Computer Engineering, Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT) University, Bhubaneswar, India from 2016. She did her school education (6th to 12th) with scholarship from Govt. of India in JNV, Cuttack, India. She did her B. Tech from CET, Bhubaneswar, India and M. Tech in computer technology from NIT, Raipur, India. She obtained her Ph. D from NIT, Raipur, India in the area of application of artificial intelligence in power system protection. She has been awarded with POSOCO Power System Award for her work of M.Tech thesis by power grid of India (PGCIL) INDIA in partnership with FITT, IIT, Delhi 2nd rank in India, with Rs. 30,000/- and Citation in 2014. She did her Ph.D from NIT, Raipur (2013-2016). She has been awarded with POSOCO Power System Award for her work of Ph.D thesis by power grid of India (PGCIL) INDIA, 9th rank in India, with Rs. 60,000/- and Citation in 2017. She has completed one research project funded by science and engineering board (SERB), India of 16.5Lakhs entitled “Intelligent Fault Distance Estimation Scheme for High Voltage AC and High Voltage DC Transmission Lines: A Comparative Study of Various Artificial Intelligent Techniques to Explore a Suitable Scheme”. She has published 30 SCI indexed research papers under publishers like IEEE transactions, Elsevier, Springer, IET, Taylor and Francis etc. She has filed 3 patents of her work on transmission line fault location under IPR, India. She has also published 35 conference papers, 6 book chapters and one book. She is also serving as reviewer of various IEEE transactions, Elsevier, Springer, IET, Taylor and Francis journals. Her field of interest includes power system protection, HVDC, FACTS, biomedical signal and image processing, data mining and artificial intelligence application. Profile: Ambika Prasad Mishra. Role: Associate Professor. Profile: Amiya Ranjan Panda. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Amiya Ranjan Panda  has seven years of research experience in DRDO and one year of teaching experience.
He received the B.Tech. degree in information technology from Biju Patnaik University of Technology, Rourkela, India, in 2009, and the M.Tech. degree in computer science and engineering from the Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT), Bhubaneshwar, India, in 2012.  He received Ph.D. degree from Siksha “O” Anusandhan University, Bhubaneshwar in the year 2017 working in a real-time project “Design, development and implementation of Software Defined Radio based Flight Termination System” of DRDO, ITR, chandipur.
He has worked as JRF, SRF and RA in DRDO, ITR, Chandipur for more than 7 years. Then he has worked as Assistant Professor in Siksha ‘O’ Anusandhan University for 4 months and currently he is working as Assistant Professor in KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar. 
His research interest is Machine learning, IOT, data acquisition system and Software Defined Radio. He has published 15 international journals. Two of the journals are published in IEEE Transaction of Industrial Informatics. One edited book has been accepted for publication in 2019.
He is expert in teaching Data Structure and algorithm, Database Management System (DBMS), Artificial Intelligence, Operating System, Compiler Design, Computer Network, Machine Learning etc. Details: Email: amiya.pandafcs@kiit.ac.in, Website: sites.google.com. Profile: Anjan Bandyopadhyay. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Anjan Bandyopadhyay is an Associate Professor at the Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT), Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. He earned his Ph.D. from NIT Durgapur, West Bengal, India, under the Visvesvaraya Ph.D. Fellowship scheme of the Ministry of Human Resource Development (MHRD), Government of India. He also holds an M.Tech in Information Security from the Department of Information Technology, NIT Durgapur. Dr. Bandyopadhyay’s broad research interests encompass Algorithmic Game Theory (Mechanism Design), Quantum Computing, Cloud and Fog Computing, Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning (AI/ML), and Healthcare Informatics. He has published over 133 research papers in reputed Scopus- and SCIE-indexed journals and conferences and Published 5 authored books, and has received several Best Paper Awards in many conferences. He is currently supervising PhD and M.Tech Scholars in emerging areas of computer science. 
His current research focuses primarily on Algorithmic Game Theory and Quantum Computing and its interdisciplinary applications. Dr. Bandyopadhyay also actively serves as a reviewer for numerous international journals and conferences, further demonstrating his expertise and commitment to academic excellence. Details: Email: anjan.bandyopadhyayfcs@kiit.ac.in. Additional Info:

Profile: Asif Uddin Khan. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Received Ph.D. degree in Computer Science from Utkal University, Bhubaneswar. Completed Ph.D. coursework from National Central University Taiwan, M.Tech in Computer Science & Engg from IIIT Bhubaneswar and B.Tech in Computer Science & Engg. from CV Raman College of Engineering Bhubaneswar. Presently working as a senior Asst Professor in the School of Computer Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University Bhubaneswar. My research interest includes designing improved models, frameworks and protocols for the modern networks and network based services to achieve guaranteed quality of service, improved quality of user experience and overall cost minimization. I am interested in emerging network technologies like vehicular ad-hoc networks, software defined networks, cloud computing, fog computing and edge computing. My current research focuses on Vehicular Fog Computing, Mobile Edge Computing and cloud-edge-fog (CEF) federation and IoT. Details: Email: asif.khanfcs@kiit.ac.in. Additional Info:

Profile: Bhabani Shankar Prasad Mishra. Role: Professor. Bio: Bhabani Shankar Prasad Mishra was born in Talcher, Odisha, India in 1981. He received the B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering from Biju Pattanaik Technical University, Odisha in 2003,  M.Tech. degree in Computer Science and Engineering from the KIIT University, in 2003,  Ph.D. degree in Computer Science from F.M.University, Balasore,Odisha, India, in 2011 and Post Doc in 2013 from Soft Computing Laboratory, Yansei University, South Korea  .
Currently he is working as an Associate Professor at School of Computer Engineering, KIIT University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. His research interest includes Pattern Reorganisation, Remote Sensing, Data Mining, Soft Computing, Big Data and Machine Learning. He has published more than 80 research articles in reputed Journal and Conferences, one patent and has edited more than five books of current importance. Under his guidance, 20 M.Tech and 2 PhD scholars are already been awarded. His h-index is 12.
Dr. Mishra was the recipient of the Gold Medal and Silver Medal during his M.Tech for the best Post Graduate in the University. Details: Email: bsmishrafcs@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 37048783800, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=DPZ_ekgAAAAJ&hl=en. Profile: Bhaswati Sahoo. Role: Assistant Professor II. Bio: Dr. Bhaswati Sahoo is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Engineering, Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT), Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha. With a decade of academic experience at KIIT, she has been instrumental in teaching core subjects such as Programming in C, Multimedia Applications, Compiler Design, Computer Networking and Database Management Systems. Dr. Sahoo holds a Doctrate Degree (Ph.D) in Computer science from Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT), Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha Master’s degree (M.Tech) in Computer Science and Engineering from Birla Institute of Technology, Mesra, and a Bachelor’s degree (B.Tech) from Veer Surendra Sai University of Technology, Burla. Her scholarly contributions include several publications in peer-reviewed international journals and conferences. Notably, she co-edited the book Strategies for E-Service, E-Governance, and Cybersecurity: Challenges and Solutions for Efficiency and Sustainability, published by Apple Academic Press and has published a good number of research paper in the field of computer science. Dr. Sahoo is an active member of professional bodies such as the Institution of Engineering and Technology (IET) and the National Science Congress. At KIIT, she has also undertaken administrative responsibilities, including serving as the Faculty-in-Charge (FIC) for Examinations and previously for Projects. Her dedication to teaching and research continues to contribute significantly to the academic community at KIIT and beyond. Details: Email: bhaswati.sahoofcs@kiit.ac.in, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=b-6vjXcAAAAJ&hl=en. Additional Info: Research Interests: Machine learning. Administrative Responsibility: FIC ExaminationPreviously FIC Project. Memberships: IET, National Science Congress

Profile: Bindu Agarwalla. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Bindu Agarwalla has 15 years of teaching experience in University like Manipal, KIIT. Graduated in Computer Science and Engineering from State Govt College, (Jorhat Engineering College), M.Tech in Computer Science from IIT Guwahati and currently undergoing Ph,D from IIIT Guwahati is highly energetic and enthusiastic individual specialized in Computer Architecture, Compiler Design, Microprocessor, C and C++ Programming and dedicated to provide best in class education. Self-motivated,  profound  technical knowledge, strong planning, organizational and leadership skills and trilled to associated with KIIT university for more than 7 years. Profile: Biraja Prasad Nayak. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Biraja Prasad Nayak is currently working as an Assistant Professor in the School of Computer Engineering at KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. He completed his Ph.D. from the National Institute of Technology Rourkela in 2025 and has contributed to the field of VANETs and Intelligent Transportation Systems. Profile: Biswajeet Sethi. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Biswajeet Sethi is currently serving as an Assistant Professor–II and Faculty-in- Charge of Website and Social Media Management in the School of Computer Engineering at KIIT Deemed to be University. He earned his PhD from the Department of Computer Science and Engineering at IIT Kharagpur. His primary research interests lie in Cloud Computing and Data Analytics, with a sustained secondary interest in Machine Learning. He brings over three years of industry experience from Infosys Ltd., where he served as a Senior Systems Engineer (SSE), and is a GBFS-certified Star Infosyon. During his doctoral tenure, he served as an NPTEL teaching assistant for the Cloud Computing course at IIT Kharagpur across six consecutive sessions and mentored NPTEL interns. In recognition of his student engagement, he was awarded the title “Faculty with Best Student Relation” and received a letter of appreciation for being among the top five faculty members with the best student feedback during his previous academic tenure. He is currently mentoring multiple interns in collaboration with professors from IIT Kharagpur, IIT Roorkee, IIT Bhubaneswar, and NIT Rourkela. Details: Email: biswajeet.sethifcs@kiit.ac.in. Additional Info: Research Interests: Serverless Computing (Cloud Computing)

Profile: Chittaranjan Pradhan. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Dr. Chittaranjan Pradhan has obtained his Doctorate, Masters and Bachelor degrees in Computer Science & Engineering discipline. Currently, he is working as Associate Professor at School of Computer Engineering, Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT) Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. Dr. Pradhan has got a total of 16 years of Academic Teaching experience with more than 80 publications in reputed & peer reviewed Journals, Edited Books and Conferences of National and International repute. His research area includes Information Security, Image Processing, Deep Learning, Machine Learning, Multimedia Systems etc. He also contributed as the Conference organizing committees, Journal/Conference Technical reviewer committee of many conferences and Journals. Dr. Pradhan has published few books published by publishers like Elsevier, IGI Global, LAP Lambert etc. He is also a member of various National and International Professional Societies in the field of Engineering & Research such as: IET, IACSIT, CSI, ISCA, IAENG, ISTE. Profile: Dayal Kumar Behera. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr Dayal Kumar Behera, is working as an Asst. Professor (II) in the School of Computer Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha. He is an enthusiastic, proactive faculty member and researcher with more than fifteen years of experience teaching courses at the undergraduate and postgraduate levels. Supervised many IEDC-funded projects, MTech theses, and BTech projects. He has two patents and published more than 20 research papers in various reputed, peer-reviewed refereed journals and international conferences. He earned a Ph.D. from KIIT University and an M.Tech. from Odisha University of Technology and Research (formerly the College of Engineering and Technology). He obtained a B.E. degree with honours in Information Technology from the National Institute of Science and Technology, Berhampur, Odisha. He coached his team to victory at the 2017 Cisco IoT Hackathon. Mentored the "Trithon 2019" programming hackathon, and his team finished second. His research interest includes Recommender System, Time Series Analysis, Remote Sensing, Internet of Things, and Computer Vision. He is a lifetime member of the ISTE, OITS and IAENG societies. Details: Email: dayal.beherafcs@kiit.ac.in. Additional Info: Research Interests: Recommender System, Computer Vision, Time Series Forecasting, Remote Sensing, IoT. Awards & Honours: Certified Trainer for the role of "Telecom Terminal Equipment Application Developer (Android) QP No: TEL/Q2300" by TSSC, India.

SUN Certified JAVA Programmer for the JAVA 2 Platform 1.5 (SCJP 5.0) candidate ID-SR3086566.

Worked as a faculty coordinator and took classes at the Data Science Club, Trident Academy of Technology, Bhubaneswar. 

Completed CISCO Instructor Training and taught Introduction to IoT, Essentials of Python Programming, NDG Linux Essentials Courses at the CISCO Networking Support Center.

Participated in CISCO IoT Hackathon 2017 as a Mentor and the team grabbed the winner position.

Participated in the Programming Hackathon "Trithon 2019" as a mentor and the team earned runner-up position.. Memberships: ISTE (LM 78438), IAENG (127057), OITS (L21/480). Outreach Activity: Real Time Crop Recommendation Framework Based on Soil Quality and Environmental Condition Using Machine Learning, Indian Patent, Application Number: 202231056814 (Published)

I-Vision-based human-robot interaction and navigation system, Indian Patent, Application Number: 202331008501(Published).

Profile: Himadri Sekhar Roy. Role: Assistant professor (II). Bio: Dr Himadri Sekhar Roy is an Assistant Professor (II) in the School of Computer Engineering at Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT), a Deemed-to-be University in Bhubaneswar, Odisha. He earned his PhD in Computer Science & Engineering from Jadavpur University, Kolkata, in 2025, with a focus on Big Data storage and retrieval in distributed environments. His research interests include Big Data, Distributed Storage and Processing, Cloud Computing, High-Speed Mobile Adhoc Networks (MANETs), IoT, and Open-Source Hardware. He has published multiple journal articles, conference papers, and book chapters. Dr Roy received fellowships from DRDO, Govt. of India, for a project on high-speed MANET development, and from UGC under the UPE Phase-II scheme for work on Big Data management in cloud environments. He holds an M.E. from Jadavpur University (2015) and a B.Tech from MAKAUT (2009). With extensive industry experience from 2009, he has worked in progressive web development, mobile apps, cloud platforms (AWS), microservices, e-commerce systems, and open-source technologies using PHP, Dot Net, JavaScript, jQuery, Ajax, Node.js, AngularJS, etc. Details: Email: himadri.royfcs@kiit.ac.in, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=ESa42pIAAAAJ&hl=en. Additional Info: Research Interests: Big DataDistributed storage and processingCloud computingHigh speed Mobile Adhoc networkIoTOpen source HardwareDistributed Computing

Profile: Himanshu Ranjan. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: I am currently working as an Assistant Professor (Grade-I) at the School of Computer Engineering, Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT), Bhubaneswar. I obtained my M.Tech  degree from the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Patna. I have qualified the Graduate Aptitude Test in Engineering (GATE) twice with a 99 percentile score. My areas of expertise include Natural Language Processing (NLP), Deep Learning, and Data Structures and Algorithms. My M.Tech thesis focused on developing a Maithili-to-English translation system for low-resource languages. I have also worked on the design and implementation of a Learning Management System (LMS). My research interests primarily lie in the fields of artificial intelligence, machine learning, and language technology. Furthermore, I actively collaborate with industry professionals and engage in consultancy work, bridging the gap between academia and real-world applications. This allows me to stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in the field and incorporate practical insights into my teaching and research endeavours. As an assistant professor, I am known for my dedication to fostering a dynamic and inclusive learning environment. I prioritize individual student growth, offering guidance and mentorship to help students explore their passions and develop their skills. My approachable nature and commitment to excellence have earned me the respect and admiration of both colleagues and students. In summary, I am a highly accomplished assistant professor specializing in CSE with a specialization in ML  and field of nlp. My academic achievements, teaching prowess, and research contributions make me an invaluable asset to my institution and the broader academic community. Details: Email: himanshu.ranjanfcs@kiit.ac.in. Additional Info: Research Interests: NATURAL LANGUAGE PROCESSING

Profile: Himansu Das. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Dr. Himansu Das, works as Associate Professor in the School of Computer Engineering, Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT), Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, India. He has received Ph.D. in Engineering degree from Veer Surendra Sai University of Technology (VSSUT), Odisha. He has received M.Tech degree in Computer Science and Engineering from the National Institute of Science and Technology, Odisha. He has also received B.Tech degree from the Institute of Technical Education and Research, Odisha, India. He has published several research papers in various international journals and has presented at conferences. He has also edited several books published by IGI Global, Springer, CRC press, and Elsevier. He has also served on many journals and conferences as editorial or reviewer board member. He is proficient in the field of Computer Science Engineering and served as an organizing chair, a publicity chair and acted as a member of the technical program committees of many national and international conferences. His research interests include the field of Data Mining, Soft Computing, and Machine Learning. He has also more than seventeen years of teaching and research experience in various engineering colleges and universities. Profile: Hitesh Mohapatra. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Dr.Hitesh Mohapatra is an Associate Professor at the School of Computer Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University, in Odisha, India. He holds a Ph.D. in Computer Science & Engineering from Veer Surendra Sai University of Technology, with a focus on designing fault-tolerant models for wireless sensor networks integrated with smart city applications. His academic journey includes a Bachelor's degree in Information Technology from Biju Patnaik University of Technology and a Master's degree in Computer Science & Engineering from Odisha University of Technology and Research. Dr. Mohapatra has over 15 years of experience in both academia and industry, contributing significantly to research in areas such as IoT, wireless sensor networks, fault tolerance, and smart city applications. His research has been published in various high-impact journals and conferences, with citations noted in the thousands. He has authored and co-authored over 50 research articles indexed by SCI and Scopus databases, along with several books on topics including software engineering, IoT in smart cities, and programming. He has also contributed to the academic community by serving in roles such as session chair, technical chair, and keynote speaker at numerous international and national conferences. His work extends into practical applications, including innovative solutions for smart agriculture, smart tourism, and smart water management systems. Additionally, Dr. Mohapatra is involved in editorial activities and has been a guest editor for special issues on topics like fault-tolerant approaches for IoT integrated smart cities. Profile: Indu. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Ms. Indu is currently working as an Assistant Professor (I) in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering at Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT), Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha. She has qualified the GATE and UGC-NET(JRF) examinations, reflecting her strong academic foundation and research aptitude.
She received the UGC-JRF (Government of India) Scholarship for her Ph.D. and has recently submitted her doctoral thesis at Guru Jambheshwar University of Science and Technology (GJUS&T), Hisar, Haryana, with research focused on unmanned aerial vehicles in wireless communication. She has published her research papers in SCI and Scopus-indexed journals and has presented her work at various international conferences.
She has over two years of teaching experience in the field of Computer Science and Engineering. She completed her M.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering with Distinction from Banasthali Vidyapeeth, Rajasthan in 2014 and her B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering with Distinction from Vaish College of Engineering, Rohtak, Haryana in 2012.
Her areas of interest include wireless communication, ad-hoc networks, unmanned aerial vehicle communication, and emerging communication technologies. She is passionate about teaching, mentoring students, and pursuing research that bridges theoretical advancements with real-world applications in next-generation communication systems. Currently, he is working as Associate Professor in the School of Computer Engineering, KIIT Deemed-to-be University, Bhubaneswar, India. Profile: Jay Sarraf. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Jay Sarraf currently works as an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Engineering, KIIT University. With more than 7 years of experience supporting marketing and development to enhance internal processes for small firms, he is a multifaceted, self-starter, and trustworthy IT specialist. His research areas focus on the brain-computer interface and signal and image processing. Dr. Sarraf is also a passionate public speaker and motivator. Dr. Jay Sarraf has a strong commitment to social work. He thinks that working with the underprivileged population through socialist practises can bring about change. He adheres to the teachings of Dr. Achyuta Samanta, who seeks to end hunger and poverty by ensuring that everyone has access to education. In order to preserve, preach, and teach the philosophy of Art of Giving for the underprivileged community through technical, mental, and physical processes, Dr. Sarraf has organized social events involving his students and served as an influential activist for the social welfare of people. He also served as a Kickstarter for various welfare programmes. Profile: Joy Dutta. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Joy Dutta is presently working as an Assistant Professor in the School of Computer Engineering, Bhubaneswar, Orissa, India. He holds a BSc degree in Physics (Honours), followed by Post BSc BTech and MTech in Computer Science & Engineering from Calcutta University. He is a recipient of Government of India’s prestigious full-time Research Fellowship, viz., “Visvesvaraya PhD Fellowship” of Ministry of Electronics & Information Technology (MeitY) for pursuing his full-time research from the Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Jadavpur University and has received his PhD (Engg.) Degree in February 2022. Dr. Dutta has the exposure of working in both the industry as well as in academia. In the initial days, he has worked as a Guest Faculty in the Netaji Subhash Engineering College and afterwards, he has also worked in the Sister Nivedita University, under Techno India Group, Kolkata, WB, India. He has also worked in the IT industry as a Software Engineer at Egnaro Company, at High-tech city, Hyderabad, India on several cutting edge technologies. Along with these, he is an active researcher in the field of IoT and related applications for social good. He has rich experience in the domain of Cloud Computing, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Data Analytics and Smart City based applications for social good. During his PhD tenure, he has pursued his research under the guidance of Professor (Dr.) Sarbani Roy of Department of Computer Science & Engineering, Jadavpur University. He is a member of IEEE and till date published several research papers in different renowned international conferences, journals and also written multiple book chapters for the global research audience. Details: Email: joy.duttafcs@kiit.ac.in, Website: joydutta.in, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.co.in/citations?user=Mzs5Bx4AAAAJ&hl=en. Additional Info: Research Interests: IoT, Cloud Computing, Data Analytics, Machine Learning, Smart City. Awards & Honours: Visvesvaraya PhD Fellowship, MeitY, Government of India. Profile: Junali Jasmine Jena. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Junali Jasmine Jena has above 5 years of experience in teaching under-graduate and post-graduate students in the field of Computer Science and Information technology. She has graduated from Parala Maharaja Engg. College, Berhampur, Odisha (govt. funded institution) and did her Masters from VSSUT, Burla, Odisha(govt. funded university). She completed her Ph.D. in the area of Evolutionary Algorithms with 7 SCI publications. Profile: Jyotiprakash Mishra. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Jyotiprakash graduated from the prestigious BITS - Pilani with a degree in BE (Computer Science) in 2010. After serving as a Senior Member of Technical Staff with Oracle for 4 years, he went on to pursue his MS (Computer Science) from one of the world's topmost universities, the University of Wisconsin - Madison (USA) with a full scholarship. After graduating from there in 2016, he worked for Epic (the world's leading medical software company) in the US for 2 years as a Software Developer and later got promoted to a Software Development Manager. In 2020, he decided to leave the US to come back to India. Overall, he has more than 10 years of industry experience. He joined KIIT as an Assistant Professor (II) in September 2020. His research interests include Operating Systems, Computer Architecture, Embedded Systems, and Machine Learning. He teaches Operating Systems and Computer Architecture to undergraduate students here. He shares his lectures on his YouTube channel for the benefit of students and the Computer Science community overall. Details: Email: jyotiprakash.mishrafcs@kiit.ac.in, Website: www.jyotiprakash.org. Additional Info: Research Interests: Operating SystemsComputer ArchitectureInformation SecurityMachine Learning. Administrative Responsibility: Course Coordinator of Computer Organization. Awards & Honours: 1. Graduated with Distinction (GPA 3.9/4) from UW Madison for MS in CS.
2. Graduated with Distinction (GPA 9.5/10) from BITS Pilani for BE in CS.
3. Full scholarship during both BE and MS programs.
4. 4th rank in the State of Odisha in 12th CHSE Science Examinations
96% in ICSE 10th Examinations.
5. Internship at Bhabha Atomic Research Centre and Yahoo Research during BE.

Profile: Jyotiranjan Swain. Role: Assistant Professor (II). Bio: Dr. Jyotiranjan Swain  earned his Ph.D. in Computer Science and Engineering from the National Institute of Technology, Rourkela. He specializes in Digital Microfluidic Biochips (DMFB), focusing on intelligent droplet routing, machine learning, and swarm intelligence techniques for biomedical applications. His research aims to enhance the efficiency and reliability of DMFB-based point-of-care diagnostic systems. His long-term goal is to develop adaptive biochip systems for personalized medicine and real-time healthcare solutions. Details: Email: jyotiranjan.swainfcs@kiit.ac.in, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=co7g318AAAAJ&hl=en&oi=ao. Additional Info: Research Interests: Digital Microfluidic BiochipsHealthcare DevicesCyber Physical SystemsMachine Learning

Profile: Krishna Chakravarty. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: She is an accomplished Information Technology (IT) professional with extensive experience working in India, USA and UK in providing services for Fortune 500 clients as well as having a deep understanding of the needs of IT in the industry. She is Silver Medallist from IIT Mumbai and started her career in academics in 2017 after serving around 15 years in IT industry. She is currently doing PhD in software engineering , to explore the boundary where industry practice meets the academia.
She is currently teaching the C/C++ programming , Software Engineering, Object Oriented System Development, Enterprise Resource Planning, Management Information System.

Profile: Kumar Surjeet Chaudhury. Role: Assistant Professor (II). University, Balasore, Odisha in 2022. He has more than 19 years of teaching experience with number of publications in reputed & peer reviewed Journals. Additionally, he adds more than four years of industry expertise from his work as a Senior Development Consultant at INTEC BILLING. His main areas of interest in study include cloud computing and data analytics, with machine learning, deep learning and image processing as a persistent secondary interest. Profile: Minakhi Rout. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Dr. Minakhi Rout is an Associate Professor in the School of Computer Engineering at KIIT University. She has over 20+ years of experience in teaching and research across reputed institutions in Odisha and Hyderabad. She completed her B.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering from KIIT University in 2005, followed by an M.Tech from ITER, Siksha 'O' Anusandhan University in 2009. She later pursued her Ph.D. in Computational Finance at Siksha 'O' Anusandhan University and completed in 2015. Dr. Rout has published 80+ research papers in reputed journals and international conferences. she has an h-index of 17 and an i10-index of 23, indicating a strong research impact. Her research interests include Soft Computing, Evolutionary Computing, Data Mining, and Computational Finance. She has guided 6 Ph.D. Scholars, 15 M.Tech. Scholars and several B.Tech students in various research areas. Her contributions to machine learning and deep learning applications, particularly in financial forecasting and medical imaging, have been widely recognized. Profile: Monideepa Roy. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Dr. Monideepa Roy has been working as an Associate Professor at KIIT Deemed University, Bhubaneswar since the last 11 years. Her areas of interest include Remote Healthcare, Mobile Computing, Cognitive WSNs, Remote Sensing, Machine Learning, Recommender Systems, Sparse Approximations,and Artificial Neural Networks. At present she has seven research scholars working with her in the above areas and two more have successfully defended their theses under her guidance. She has several publications in reputed conferences and journals. She has been the Organizing Chair of the first two editions of the International Conference on Computational Intelligence and Networks CINE 2015 and 2016, ICMC 2019 and has organised several workshops and seminars She also has several book chapter publications as well as an edited book under Taylor and Francis. Profile: Murari Mandal. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: I am an Asst. Professor at the School of Computer Engineering, KIIT Bhubaneshwar. I lead the RespAI Lab where we focus on research in LLMs, VLMs, AI Safety, AI Regulation, Model Editing, Machine Unlearning. My research has been published in ICML, KDD, AAAI, ACM MM, CVPR. My pioneering works had significant impact in the field of machine unlearning with 700+ citations. Our works Fast Unlearning [TNNLS], Zero-shot Unlearning [TIFS], and Bad Teacher [AAAI] are among top 10 highly cited papers in the field of machine unlearning. I regularly serve as a Reviewer to NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, AAAI, CVPR, ICCV, and ECCV. Indexed in CSRankings. I am also part of the BrainX AI research community actively working on AI in Healthcare. Earlier, I was a PostDoc Fellow at National University of Singapore (NUS) where I worked with Prof. Mohan Kankanhalli. Long time back, I graduated in 2011 with a Bachelors in Computer Science from BITS, Pilani. Profile: Partha Pratim Sarangi. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Dr. Partha Pratim Sarangi is working as Assistant Professor (II) in the School of Computer Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University. He has obtained his MTech (Computer Science) from Utkal University and Ph. D. (Computer Science & Engineering) from KIIT University. Also, he has completed a 6 month certificate course in Machine Intelligence and Soft Computing from ISI Kolkata. Dr. Sarangi has 15 years of experience in teaching to UG and PG students and 9 years of research experience. He has contributed more than 20 papers in various journals and conferences of international repute. He is a life member of Indian Society for Technical Education (ISTE) and Soft Computing Research Society (SCRS). His research interest include Pattern Recognition, Machine Learning, Soft Computing, Biometrics, Spectral Image Analysis, and Medical Image Processing. Details: Email: pp.sarangifcs@kiit.ac.in, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=p_xONH4AAAAJ&hl=en. Additional Info: Research Interests: Pattern Recognition, Machine Learning, Soft Computing, Biometrics, Spectral Image Analysis, and Medical Image Processing. Memberships: ISTE & SCRS. Outreach Activity: Resource Person in ATAL FDP on Artificial Intelligence from 2.11.2020 to 6.11.2020

Profile: Partha Sarathi Paul. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: "Hello, my name is Partha Sarathi Paul. I have been a PhD Scholar in the Department of Computer Science & Engineering at the National Institute of Technology Durgapur, India since February 2014 and have completed my PhD finally on 2nd February 2021. After this I have worked as a Post-Doctoral Researcher in a Sponsored Research Project Position at Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur, India till the end of December 2021. I also have worked in a Sponsored Research Project Position at Indraprastha Institute of Information Technology Delhi in the capacity of a Research Assistant in between my thesis submission and its defense. I completed my Master of Technology in Computer Science [M. Tech. (CS)] at Indian Statistical Institute, India, in the year of 2003. I earned my Master’s degree in Pure Mathematics in the year 2000 and a Bachelor’s degree with Honors in Mathematics in 1998, both at the University of Calcutta, India. My areas of interest are in Mobile and Pervasive Networking Systems, Networking Systems and Their Applications, Disaster Management, and Human-Computer Interaction. My current research focuses on socio-mobile applications and mobile affective computing. I have made research publications in eminent, SCI-indexed, peer-reviewed journals, including the Journal of Network and Computer Applications (Impact Factor: 5.570), Ad Hoc Networks (Impact Factor: 3.643), and Scientometrics (Impact Factor: 2.867). I have also published papers in premier conferences and Workshops, including MobileHCI, PerCom (WiP), MobiCom CHANTS, COMSNETS, etc. I have also published a few book chapters with different national/international publishers. Before joining my PhD program in 2014, I was in the service of Teaching in Technical Institutions, had served three Institutions as Assistant Professor in Computer Science & Engineering for more than ten years. Details: Email: parthasarathi.paulfcs@kiit.ac.in, Website: sites.google.com. Additional Info: Research Interests: Networking Systems & Applications, Human-Computer Interaction, Mobile Affective Computing, Socio-Mobile Applications, Scholarly Network Analysis, etc.

Profile: Pradeep Kumar Mallick. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Dr. Pradeep Kumar Mallick is a Senior Associate Professor in the School of Computer Engineering and the Associate Dean (IPR) at KIIT Deemed to be University, Odisha, India. Since January 2021, he has also been serving as a collaborating Research Professor at Baekseok University, South Korea. In addition, he currently holds the position of Vice-Chair of the IEEE Computer Society, Bhubaneswar Section. Earlier, he served as Professor and Head of the Department of Computer Science and Engineering at Vignana Bharathi Institute of Technology, Hyderabad.Dr. Mallick obtained his Post-Doctoral Fellowship from Kongju National University, South Korea, his Ph.D. from Siksha ‘O’ Anusandhan University, his M.Tech. (CSE) from Biju Patnaik University of Technology (BPUT), and his MCA from Fakir Mohan University. His research interests include Data Mining, Image Processing, Soft Computing, and Machine Learning.He has authored more than 190 research papers, 20 edited books, and one textbook. He also holds 14 granted international patents and 17 published national patents and has successfully completed two international consultancy research projects. Dr. Mallick serves as an Editorial Board Member of the Korean Convergence Society for SMB and as a Guest Editor for reputed international journals published by Elsevier, Springer Nature, SAGE, and Inderscience. Details: Email: pradeep.mallickfcs@kiit.ac.in, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Vo6vDTUAAAAJ&hl=en. Additional Info:

Profile: Prasant Kumar Pattnaik. Role: Professor. Bio: Dr. Prasant Kumar Pattnaik, Ph.D (Computer Science), Fellow IETE, Senior Member IEEE is a Professor at the School of Computer Engineering, KIIT Deemed University, Bhubaneswar. He has more than a decade of teaching and research experience. Dr. Pattnaik has published numbers of Research Papers in peer-reviewed International Journals and Conferences. He also published many edited book volumes in Springer ,IGI Global and Wiley Publication and He has co-authored the popular Computer Science and Engineering text books ,“Fundamental of Mobile Computing”,PHI and “Cloud Computing Solutions: Architecture, Data Storage, Implementation and Security”, John Wiley & Sons Inc. His areas of interest include Mobile Computing, Cloud Computing, Cyber Security, Intelligent Systems and Brain Computer Interface. Details: Email: patnaikprasantfcs@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 7004711101, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.co.in/citations?user=b_iZVxMAAAAJ&hl=en. Additional Info:

Profile: Prasenjit Maiti. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Prasenjit Maiti is an Assistant Professor in the School of Computer Engineering, KIIT DU, Bhubaneswar, India. He received his B.Tech (Computer Science and Engineering) in 2008 from the Maulana Abul Kalam Azad University of Technology (Formerly known as West Bengal University of Technology ), and M.Tech ( Information Technology) in 2013 under Dr. Rajat Subhra Chakraborty from the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT), Kharagpur, West Bengal, India. Currently, he is pursuing a Ph.D. degree in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering at the National Institute of Technology (NIT), Rourkela, India, under Dr. Bibhudatta Sahoo and Professor Ashok Kumar Turuk. The prestigious research fellowship award, viz., “Visvesvaraya Ph.D. Fellowship,” was awarded for his full-time research under the Ministry of Electronics & Information Technology (MeitY), Government of India. His teaching experience spanned more than six years. His current research interests include Fog Computing, Cloud Computing. He has published his work in the various high-impact journal reputed conferences and received the best paper award for his work and two books in the domain of Fog Computing. Currently, he is a member of the Indian Society for Technical Education (ISTE) and the International Association of Engineers (IAENG). Details: Email: prasenjit.maitifcs@kiit.ac.in, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.co.in/citations?user=q0GCmdYAAAAJ&hl=en&oi=ao. Additional Info:

Profile: Pratyusa Mukherjee. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Pratyusa Mukherjee is currently working as an Assistant Professor in School of Computer Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University (KIIT), Bhubaneshwar, Odisha. She was awarded her Doctor of Philosophy from KIIT in 2022. She completed her M.Tech in Information Technology from Indian Institute of Engineering Science and Technology (IIEST), Shibpur. She stood fifth in entire Maharashtra, first in Vidarbha Region and first in Nagpur City in her CBSE X Board Examinations. Her research area includes Information Technology, Blockchain Technology and Soft Computing. Cryptography, Network Security, Cyber Security, Design and Analysis of Algorithms are subjects of her interest. Details: Email: pratyusa.mukherjeefcs@kiit.ac.in. Additional Info: Research Interests: 1. Information Security 2. Blockchain Technology. Administrative Responsibility: FIC In-charge Website & Social Media Management

Profile: Priyanka Panigrahi. Role: Assistant Professor (II). Bio: Priyanka Panigrahi has successfully defended her PhD titled “Security Verification of Compiler Optimizations: An Information Flow Perspective” in Computer Science and Engineering from IIT Guwahati in April 2024. Her research interests include compiler security, security vulnerability detection, program analysis, and security verification. She has won the Qualcomm Innovation Fellowship (QIF), India, 2022. She is a member of IEEE. Details: Email: priyanka.panigrahifcs@kiit.ac.in, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.de/citations?hl=en&user=s8rqhuYAAAAJ. Additional Info: Research Interests: compiler security, security vulnerability detection, program analysis, and security verification. Awards & Honours: Winner of Qualcomm Innovation Fellowship India 2022. Memberships: IEEE

Profile: Priyanka Roy. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Priyanka Roy is an Assistant Professor in School of Computer Engineering, Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology(KIIT) University, Bhubaneswar, India. She received her M.Tech degree in CSE from University of Calcutta. She is pursuing PhD in Indian Institute of Technology(Indian School of Mines) Dhanbad, India under the supervision of Dr. Soumen Bag. Her research domain of interest includes Handwritten document image analysis, Pattern Recognition and Machine Learning. In addition to the academic learning, she has more than three years experience of project titled ""Design and Implementation of Multiple Strategies to Identify Handwritten Forgery Activities in Legal Documents"", sponsored by SERB, Govt. of India. Early in her professional career, she taught CSE in Gargi Memorial Institute of Technology(GMIT), Kolkata, India for six months. Details: Email: priyanka.royfcs@kiit.ac.in, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=wdzqzsoAAAAJ&hl=en. Additional Info: Research Interests: Digital image processing, Handwritten document image processing, Pattern recognition, Machine learning. Projects: I worked in a project titled Design and Implementation of Multiple Strategies to Identify
Handwritten Forgery Activities in Legal Documents, funded by the DST, SERB, Govt. of India. Investigator name is Dr. Soumen Bag, status: Completed

Profile: Pushkar Kishore. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Mr. Pushkar Kishore is an esteemed faculty member at KIIT (Deemed to be) University, Bhubaneswar. He earned his B.Tech. degree in Information Technology from Muzaffarpur Institute of Technology, Bihar in 2014, and his MTech. degree in Software Engineering from National Institute of Technology, Rourkela, Odisha in 2017. His Ph.D. is ongoing at National Institute of Technology Rourkela, Odisha, India. He has made significant contributions to the field of computer science, with 9 research papers in core conferences and Q1 journals. Apart from that, he published 11 research papers and got 1 product patent granted by Government of India in 2021. He served as director for Startup named Drivomate Technologies Private Limited for around 4 years. He brings startup experience, thereby enriching the learning experience for his students. His research interests are Software Security, Malware Analysis, Vulnerability Analysis, Real-Time Operating System and IoT security. Currently, as an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Engineering, KIIT (Deemed to be) University, Mr. Pushkar continues to inspire and guide students and colleagues alike with his dedication to advancing knowledge and fostering innovation in the field of computer engineering. Details: Email: pushkar.kishorefcs@kiit.ac.in, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?hl=en&user=umd9Fh8AAAAJ&view_op=list_works&sortby=pubdate. Additional Info:

Profile: Raghunath Dey. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Raghunath Dey is currently working as an Assistant Professor in School of Computer Engineering Department, KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha. He has done M.E. in Information Technology from Jadavpur University, Kolkata, W.B. in the year 2012. Dr. Dey received his PhD award from IIIT Bhubaneswar, Odisha. He has more than fourteen years of teaching experience. He has published many research publications in peer-reviewed journals such as Multimedia Tools and Applications, ACM Transactions on Asian and Low-Resource Language Information Processing, etc. Dr. Dey also has done a patent under IP Australia in the year 2021. He has delivered presentations at many international conferences and technical institutions. His area of research lies in Pattern Recognition, Machine Learning, and Offline Handwritten Character Recognition. Profile: Rajdeep Chatterjee. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Rajdeep Chatterjee received his Bachelor of Engineering in Computer Science and Engineering from The University of Burdwan in 2008. He completed both his Master of Technology and Ph.D. in Computer Science and Engineering from KIIT Deemed to be University in 2011 and 2020, respectively. He received an MHRD (Now, Ministry of Education, Govt. of India) scholarship in his masters for possessing All India Rank 1410 in GATE-2008. He started his professional career as Project Linked Person at Machine Intelligence Unit, Indian Statistical Institute, Kolkata. He is currently working as an Associate Professor at the School of Computer Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, India. Besides, he is associated as an expert member in the Cognitive Systems and Cybernetics Research Lab., MIU, ISI Kolkata, India. He is also one of the founding members of the international conference series on Computational Intelligence & Networks (http://www.cineconf.org). He has published research articles in many reputed international conferences and journals. He is a regular reviewer of various reputed journals such as Medical & Biological Eng. & Computing (SCI-E, IF: 2.602), IEEE Transactions on Biomedical Engineering (SCI-E, IF: 4.538), IEEE Journal of Biomedical and Health Informatics (SCI-E, IF: 5.223), Computers in Biology and Medicine (SCI-E, IF: 4.589), IEEE Transactions on Emerging Topics in Computational Intelligence (Scopus, IF: 8.28), Evolutionary Intelligence (Scopus, DBLP), etc. His research areas include Brain-Computer Interface, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and Computer Vision. Details: Email: rajdeepfcs@kiit.ac.in, Website: sites.google.com, Scopus Id: 57189530647, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.co.in/citations?user=BozHYf4AAAAJ&hl=en. Additional Info:

Profile: Rakesh Kumar Rai. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Rakesh Rai is a dedicated researcher, educator, and data enthusiast with a strong technology, analytics, and computational neuroscience background. With a B.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering from NIT Nagaland, he began his professional journey as a Data Analyst at IGL, where he spent three years deriving valuable insights from complex datasets. He works as an Assistant Professor in the CSE Department at KIIT University, Bhubaneswar. Alongside his academic role, he is pursuing a PhD in Computer Science at MNNIT Allahabad. His research focuses on Human Cognitive Behavior and Brain State Analysis using EEG signals, exploring how different physiological conditions influence brain activity. Key Achievements & Skills:
✔ PhD Scholar (MNNIT Allahabad)
✔ Honored to be selected for a PhD in Computer Science at the esteemed IIT Dhanbad (2022)
✔ GATE Qualified
✔ AIEEE 2012 – AIR GEN 25083
✔ Programming Proficiency: C, C++, Python With expertise spanning data science, neuroscience, and computational modeling, he is passionate about bridging the gap between technology and human cognition. He is always open to collaborations, discussions, and opportunities in AI-driven neuroscience and brain-computer interface (BCI) research." Details: Email: rakesh.raifcs@kiit.ac.in. Additional Info: Research Interests: 1. Brain computer Interface 2. Human Computer Interaction 3. AI/ML. Administrative Responsibility: Course Coordinator for PMLDL and Foundation of Block Chain Technology. Awards & Honours: Sports Secretary of NIT Nagaland for the year 2013-2014.Publicity & Marketing Head of Techno-Cultural Fest of NIT Nagaland.Represented my college at Inter-NIT state level cricket tournament for two consecutive years.Cleared the cloud computing NPTEL exam with elite tag.Got selected for full time PhD program at IIT Dhanbad in CSE department.

Profile: Rinku Datta Rakshit. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Rinku Datta Rakshit, presently working as an Associate professor at the School of Computer Engineering, Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology, deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha. She completed her B.Tech (Information Technology) in 2005 from Jalpaiguri Government Engineering College, Jalpaiguri, West Bengal. She completed her M.Tech (Multimedia & Software Systems) in 2011 from National Institute of Technical Teachers’ Training & Research, Kolkata. She did her Ph.D (Computer Science and Engineering) in 2021 from National Institute of Technology Durgapur. She received Visvesvaraya fellowship for completion of her PhD under “Visvesvaraya PhD Scheme for Electronic & IT”, Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology, Government of India. She has more than 15 years of teaching experience. She is a Wipro Certified faculty. She worked as an organizing committee member, reviewer, and session chair in some international conferences. Her research area includes image processing, biometrics, and machine learning. Her publications include many SCI indexed journals, conferences and book chapters. Details: Email: rinku.rakshitfcs@kiit.ac.in. Additional Info: Research Interests: Image Processing, Biometrics, and Machine Learning. Awards & Honours: 1. Profile: Roshni Pradhan. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Roshni Pradhan is working as an Assistant Professor in the School of Computer Engineering, where she has been since August, 2015 . Her research and publications deals with Cloud Computing and Data Mining. Her current research spans both scheduling heuristics in IaaS cloud and Application of Data Mining techniques in Cloud Environment. In addition to this, she is working on Application of Machine Learning Techniques. Her work has appeared in Advanced Research on Cloud Computing Design and Applications and International Journal of Information Processing. Beside this she has published many book chapters, journals and conference papers in the area of cloud computing. She has published two patents in the area of real life application of  Internet of Things (IoT).  She is a Fellow of the IET, ACM and Indian National Science Congress. His field of interests are Educational Technology, Artificial Intelligence in Education, NLP and Data Science. He completed his PostDoc in the field of Educational Technologies and Artificial Intelligence between June 2022 to May 2024 from Ruhr University Bochum and CAIS Germany. Prior to that he finished his PhD from the Open University of The Netherlands in March 2022 in the field of Educational Technology and AI and his Masters in Computer Science from Delft University of Technology, Netherlands in August 2017. Before that he did his Bachelors in Information Technology from VSSUT Burla, India. Details: Email: sambit.praharajfcs@kiit.ac.in, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Yixrh9sAAAAJ&hl=en&authuser=1. Additional Info: Research Interests: Educational Technology and AI, Artificial Intelligence in Education, NLP, Data Science

Profile: Sampriti Soor. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Sampriti Soor received the B.Tech. degree in Information Technology from West Bengal University of Technology, Kolkata, and an M.E. degree in Software Engineering from Jadavpur University, Kolkata in 2011 and 2015 respectively. From 2012 to 2013, he worked as a System Engineer at Tata Consultancy Services. He joined the Systems Science and Informatics Unit at Indian Statistical Institute, Bangalore, as a Doctoral Fellow and he recieved PhD degree in Computer Science in 2022. His research interests are in the field of Mathematical Morphology, Image Processing, and Data Analysis. Details: Email: sampriti.soorfcs@kiit.ac.in. Additional Info: Research Interests: Image Processing, GIS,  Data Analysis. Memberships: IEEE Student Member

Profile: Santosh Kumar Pani. Role: Professor. Bio: Santosh Kumar Pani is currently working as Professor in the School of Computer Engineering. He has over two decades of experience in teaching, research and administration in KIIT Deemed to be University. He has taught various core courses in Computer Science to the students of Under Graduate and Post Graduate Programmes. He has over twenty research publications indexed in global reputed databases and guided several Ph.D. Scholars and M.Tech students in School of Computer Engineering. He has served in various key administrative positions such as Controller of Examinations of KIIT, Deemed to be University over a period of four years. He has been actively involved in the design of the examination process in SAP implementation of KIIT, Deemed to be University. Under his leadership, KIIT Deemed to be University successfully conducted the online examinations as one of the first institute in the country for all the courses during the CORONA Pandemic situation. His recent research interests include program slicing, data flow analysis, internet of things and cloud services. Details: Email: spanifcs@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 35786525000. Additional Info: Research Interests: Data flow analysis, Program Slicing, Internet of Things

Profile: Santosh Kumar Swain. Role: Professor. Bio: Santosh Kumar Swain , has completed MCA from Jorhat Engineering College, Dibrugarha University, ASSAM and M. Tech (CS) degree from Utkal University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. He has received his Ph. D. at the School of Computer Engineering at KIIT University, India. He is presently working as Professor, School of Computer Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha. His academic interests lie in Software Engineering, Web Engineering, Compiler Design, Human-Computer Interaction, Cloud Computing and Wireless Sensor Network. Dr. Swain is also author of three books on Computer Science i.e. Computer Fundamentals and C Programming ,  Design and Analysis of Algorithm and Theory of Computations and Applications. Two patents are there in his credit. He has published reseach papers in 50 reputed international journals, 15 international and the book chapters. conferences. He has successfully guided three Ph. D. scholars. Now he is guiding four Ph. D. scholars. He is a member of LMISTE and LMISC. Details: Email: sswainfcs@kiit.ac.in. Profile: Sarita Tripathy. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Sarita Tripathy is currently working as an Assistant Professor in School of Computer Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University, Odisha. Profile: Satyananda Champati Rai. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Dr. Satyananda Champati Rai is currently working as an Associate Professor in the School of Computer Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar. He completed his M. Tech. and Ph.D. degrees from the School of Mathematics, Statistics and Computer Science, Utkal University, Bhubaneswar in 2001, and 2012, respectively. He has more than 22 years of teaching and research experience. He has published more than 40 research articles in reputed Journals and Conferences. He has written two books and four book chapters. He is a member of ACM, IEEE and a life member of the Orissa Information Technology Society (OITS), ISTE, and the Indian Association for Medical Informatics (IAMI). He has served in several positions in different international conferences - NCEPES-2010, NCICT-2011, WICT-2012, IACT-2013, ICIT-2014, PIC-2016, ICMI-2016, PIC-2017, ICIT-2017, OCIT-2021, and CCPIS-2023. He has supervised 4 Ph.D. scholars, one has submitted the thesis, and three are pursuing; 28 Masters' Dissertations in different areas of - Mobile Ad hoc Networks, Wireless Sensor Networks, and Cloud Computing. His research interests include the application of AI/ML in IoT for general people. Details: Email: satya.raifcs@kiit.ac.in, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?hl=en&authuser=1&user=AB09IFIAAAAJ. Additional Info: Research Interests: Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing, Health Informatics, Internet of Things and Cloud Computing.
