Profile: Saurabh Bilgaiyan. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Dr. Saurabh Bilgaiyan holds a distinguished position as a faculty member in the School of Computer Engineering at KIIT, Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, India. With a strong passion for both teaching and research, he brings extensive expertise and academic experience to the university’s vibrant learning ecosystem. He earned his Ph.D. in Computer Science & Engineering from KIIT, Deemed to be University in 2018. He holds a Master of Technology (M.Tech) in Computer Science & Engineering from the same institution (2014) and a Bachelor of Engineering (B.E.) from BIRT, under Rajiv Gandhi Proudyogiki Vishwavidyalaya (RGPV), Bhopal (2012). Dr. Bilgaiyan is actively engaged in cutting-edge research and has published extensively in reputed peer-reviewed journals, edited volumes, and conference proceedings. His scholarly contributions have garnered significant recognition in the academic community. He is currently supervising M.Tech and Ph.D. scholars in emerging areas of computer science. He also serves as a reviewer for various prestigious international journals and conferences, further demonstrating his expertise and commitment to academic excellence. Details: Email: saurabh.bilgaiyanfcs@kiit.ac.in, Website: sites.google.com, Scopus Id: 56126787500, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.co.in/citations?user=ymBNFJ8AAAAJ&hl=en. Additional Info:

Profile: Saurabh Jha. Role: Assistant Professor (II). Bio: Dr Saurabh Jha has done his Ph.D. (Computer Science) from NIT Jamshedpur and has over 10 years of teaching and research experience. He has 5 patents published under his name with various SCI and Scopus indexed research papers, Book chapters, and Conference publications. His area of research interest is fuzzy logic, machine learning, and deep learning. Details: Email: saurabh.jhafcs@kiit.ac.in, Website: murarimandal.github.io, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=jNoaRVoAAAAJ&hl=en. Profile: Shaswati Patra. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: She completed her Bachelor's degree in Computer Science and Engineering from BPUT, Odisha. She has qualified both GATE and UGC-NET in Computer Science and Engineering. She obtained her Master's degree in Software Engineering from NIT Durgapur and earned her Ph.D. in Computer Science and Engineering from IIT Bhilai.
Her research interests include Parallel Algorithms, Distributed Algorithms, Approximation Algorithms, and Distributed Systems. She has been serving as an Assistant Professor at KIIT since 2015. Over the years, she has taught several under gradute courses such as Data Structures and Algorithms, Computer Organization and Architecture, Design and Analysis of Algorithms, Information Theory and Coding, Distributed Algorithms, and Distributed Operating Systems. At the postgraduate level, she has taught Advanced Data Structures and Algorithms. Details: Email: shaswati.patrafcs@kiit.ac.in. Additional Info: Research Interests: DATA STRUCTURE, ALGORITMS, COMPUTER ORGANIZATION AND ARCHITECTURE

Profile: Siddharth Swarup Rautaray. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Siddharth Swarup Rautaray is presently working as an Associate Professor at the School of Computer Engineering, Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology, Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar Odisha, India. He has teaching and research experience of more than 9+ years. He did his doctoral degree under MHRD scholarship from the Indian Institute of Information Technology, Allahabad, U.P., India. His research interest includes Big Data Analytics, Image Processing, Intelligent Systems, Human-Computer Interaction, and similar innovative areas. His research contribution includes 08+ co-edited proceedings/books which include ASIC Springer series, more than 105+ research publications in reputed conferences, book chapters, and journals indexed in Scopus/SCI/ESCI and with a citation index of more than 2800+. As faculty in charge (FIC) Quality Assurance Cell he has been involved in different National & International Accreditations. As an organizing chair, he has organized 05+ International conferences (ICCAN2017, ICCAN 2019, 16th ICDCIT 2020, FICTA 2016, FICTA 2017) and has been part of different core committees of other conferences and workshops. He has received “Best Researcher Award-2020” at 2nd International Research Awards on Science, Health and Engineering 2020, SHEN, International Research Awards, and “Young Scientist Award-2020” from VDGOOD Professional Association. He has been a member of different advisory boards and Ph.D. examiner to different Universities in India. He has delivered invited talks in different workshops and conferences. Details: Email: siddharthfcs@kiit.ac.in, Website: kiit.irins.org, Scopus Id: 37102632900, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.co.in/citations?hl=en&user=haIxWqEAAAAJ. Additional Info: Educational Qualification: Ph.D. Research Interests: Big Data Analytics, Image Processing, Intelligent Systems, Human-Computer Interaction, and similar innovative areas. Administrative Responsibility: FIC- Quality Assurance Cell. Awards & Honours: Best Researcher Award-2020” at 2nd International Research Awards on Science, Health and Engineering 2020, SHEN, International Research Awards.Young Scientist Award-2020” from VDGOOD Professional Association, India.. Profile: Soumya Ranjan Mishra. Role: Assistant Professor. Profile: Soumya Ranjan Nayak. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Soumya Ranjan Nayak is currently working as Senior Assistant Professor in the School of Computer Engineering, Kalinga Institute of Industrial technology (KIIT) Deemed to be University, Odisha. He received his Ph.D and M.Tech degree in Computer Science and Engineering under MHRD Govt. of India fellowship from CET, BPUT Rourkela, India; with a preceded degree of B. Tech and Diploma in Computer Science and Engineering. He has published more than 100 articles in peer-reviewed journals and conferences of international repute like Elsevier, Springer, World Scientific, IOS Press, Taylor & Francis, Hindawi, Inderscience, IGI Global, etc.. Apart from that, 16 Book Chapter, 6 Books and 7 Indian patents (4 patents granted) and two International patents (two patents granted) under his credit. His current research interests include medical image analysis and classification, machine learning, deep learning, pattern recognition, fractal graphics and computer vision. Dr. Nayak serves as an associate editor of Journal of Electronic Imaging (SPIE), Mathematical Problems in Engineering (Hindawi), Journal of Biomedical if Imaging (Hindawi), Applied Computational Intelligence and Soft Computing (Hindawi), and PLOS One. He is also serving as Guest editor for special issues of the journal like Springer Nature, Elsevier, and Taylor & Franchise. He has associated as reviewer of many peer-reviewed reputed journals such as Applied Mathematics and Computation, Journal of Applied Remote Sensing, Mathematical Problems in Engineering, International Journal of Light and Electron optics, Journal of Intelligent and Fuzzy Systems, Future Generation Computer Systems, Pattern Recognition Letters, etc. He has also served as Technical Program Committee Member of several conferences of international repute. Profile: Sourabh Debnath. Role: Assistant Professor (I). Bio: Mr. Sourabh Debnath is currently serving as an Assistant Professor (I) in the School of Computer Engineering at KIIT University. He completed his B.Tech from Government College of Engineering Kalahandi (GCEK), Bhawanipatna in 2016 and pursued his M.Tech from Veer Surendra Sai University of Technology (VSSUT), Burla and completed in 2018. He has academic experience as an Assistant Professor at GIETU Guntur for six months and at NIST University, Berhampur for one year. He joined his Ph.D. program at NIT Rourkela in January 2020 and has successfully submitted his Ph.D. thesis. His research interests include coverless steganography, cybersecurity, Image and Videoprocessing, Information hiding, and machine learning. Profile: Sovan Kumar Sahoo. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Sovan Kumar Sahoo is an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Engineering, KIIT Bhubaneshwar. He is pursuing Ph.D. from the Department of Computer Science & Engineering, IIT Patna. He has spent the last seven years conducting research in Natural Language Processing, Information Extraction, Knowledge Graphs, Question Answering, and Deep Learning. He was a member of the AI-NLP-ML lab at IIT Patna, where he worked on several sponsored research projects funded by private companies such as LG and Wipro, as well as government agencies such as MeiTY, Government of India, and MoE, Government of India, under the guidance of Prof. Pushpak Bhattacharyya and Dr. Asif Ekbal. He received his MTech from the Department of Information Technology, IIEST Shibpur, and his BTech from the College of Engineering and Management, Kolaghat. Previously, he worked as a Performance Test Engineer at Cognizant. He has served several journals, including Sādhanā, SN Computer Science, PLOS One, ACM TALLIP, Expert Systems With Applications, Neural Networks, Computer Speech & Language, and Conferences like ACL, ICON, and ICONIP, as a reviewer. He also served as a PC member at conferences such as ICONIP and ICON. Details: Email: sovan.sahoofcs@kiit.ac.in. Additional Info: Research Interests: Natural Language Processing, Information Extraction, Knowledge Graphs, Question Answering, ChatBot and Deep Learning. Administrative Responsibility: Reviewer at PLOS One, ACM TALLIP, Expert Systems With Applications, Neural Networks, Computer Speech and Language, ACL, ICONIP, ICON

Profile: Sricheta Parui. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Sricheta Parui recently submitted her Ph.D. thesis in Computer Science and Engineering at the esteemed Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur (IIT-KGP), where her groundbreaking research focused on harnessing Artificial Intelligence for Non-Invasive Brain Signals Processing and Psychophysiological Characteristics Assessment. Sricheta's academic journey is marked by excellence. She earned her Master's degree in Control System Engineering from Jadavpur University, Kolkata, in 2018, and her Bachelor's in Instrumentation and Control Engineering from Calcutta Institute of Engineering and Management (CIEM) in 2016, where she was honored with a Gold medal for achieving the university's top position. Sricheta's research interests are diverse, spanning Cognitive Science, Brain-Machine Interface, Emotional Intelligence, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and Artificial Intelligence. Her passion for cutting-edge research has been recognized with the UGC Post Graduate Indira Gandhi Single Girl Child Scholarship (2016-2018) during her master's studies. Sricheta's academic prowess has garnered numerous awards and fellowships, including the prestigious IEEE Computer Society Richard E. Merwin Student Fellowship '22, IEEE Lance Stafford Larson Student award '21, Google Student Scholarship '21, and Young Scientist Conference Awardee '20. Sricheta's research contributions are well documented through numerous papers published in renowned IEEE flagship conferences and journals. Her impactful work has earned her various prestigious Best Paper and Presentation awards, highlighting her commitment to advancing knowledge in her field. Sricheta has received various travel grants and fellowships to attend conferences where she has presented her work. These opportunities underscore her commitment to academic excellence and the dissemination of impactful research. Her commitment to excellence extends to various IEEE roles, earning her distinctions such as IEEE Brand Ambassador, IEEE STEM Champion 2022, IEEE Ethics Champion 2023, IEEE VOLT Graduate 2024, IEEE Xtreme 15.0 Ambassador, IEEE Day Ambassador, and IEEE CS GSC Outreach Ambassador. Actively contributing to the academic community, Sricheta serves as the Secretary of IEEE Student Branch Kharagpur Section and holds leadership roles as the Vice Chair of the IEEE Computer Society Student Branch Chapter at IIT Kharagpur. Additionally, she serves as the Vice Chair and Assistant Treasurer of IEEE Women in Engineering, IEEE Kharagpur Section. Her multifaceted involvement reflects a dedication to fostering excellence and diversity within the field. Details: Email: sricheta.paruifcs@kiit.ac.in, Website: srichetap.wixsite.com, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.co.in/citations?user=JPB-u80AAAAJ&hl=en. Additional Info:

Profile: Subhadip Pramanik. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Subhadip Pramanik is presently working as an Assistant Professor (II) at the School of Computer Engineering, Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (Deemed to be University), Bhubaneswar Odisha, India. He accomplished his Ph.D. in the field of Data Science & AI from the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Kharagpur, India in 2023. He received his M.Tech. in Computer Science & Data Processing from the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Kharagpur, India, in 2018. Prior to that he received his M.Sc. in Applied Mathematics and Computer Programming from Vidyasagar University, West Bengal, India in 2016. His research interests focus on Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Nature-Inspired Algorithms, Data-Driven Evolutionary Optimization, and Data Mining. Profile: Suchismita Rout. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: "Dr. Suchismita Rout currently working as an Associate Professor in School of Computer Engineering in KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, which is regarded as one of the leading International universities in the area of academic and research in India. She has always been a vibrant lady in the field of Research and Development. She obtained her PhD degree in the field of Computer Science and Engineering from School of Computer engineering, KIIT DU. Her Masters is in the field of Computer Science and Engineering from National Institute of Technology, Rourkela, Odisha.  During the period of her masters, she had experience of JRF for a DST sponsored project in NIT, Rourkela. Her research interests include Software Defined Networking, Mobile Ad Hoc Network, Wireless Sensor Network, Cloud Computing. She has authored highly cited articles in reputed International Journals, Conferences and book chapters. She has successfully organized many faculty developments programme, invited talks, student seminars and bridge courses. Along with that, she has delivered technical talks as a resource person in different organizations. She is a member of the Editorial board and Review Committee for International Conferences and Journals. She is a Fellow of ACEEE, ISTE, IEEE.
 She has engaged in academic activities for the last 18 years. She has been an active supporter of experimental learning for students and has conceptualized Integration of Industry Oriented courses into the curriculum. She is a WIPRO Certified Faculty for providing training in the field of JAVA and J2EEE from August 2020. She has earlier served in various positions in different premier institutes, namely Silicon Institute of Technology, Bhubaneswar and PCE, Rourkela. She has industry experience in Accenture, Bangalore. She has been associated with a broad spectrum of subjects in teaching and is equally proficient in contributing to society through her innovative research work. Her intellectual vigor along with the personal warmth makes her one of the most sought after teachers. She received the Best Teacher Award on the eve of Engineer’s Day 2022 in Odisha Technological Conclave organized by Ever Green Forum on 15th September 2022 at Jayadev Bhawan, Bhubaneswar. In addition to this, she is not only engaged in the teaching and research profession, but also in other fields to showcase her talent and give a platform to others to do the same. 
" Details: Email: suchismita.routfcs@kiit.ac.in, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=dVGIauwAAAAJ&hl=en. Additional Info: Research Interests: Software Defined Networking, Mobile Ad Hoc Network, Wireless Sensor Network, Cloud Computing.. Administrative Responsibility: FIC Students Affairs. 2. Best Teacher Award on the eve of Engineer’s Day 2022 in Odisha Technological Conclave organized by Ever Green Forum on 15th September 2022 at Jaydev Bhawan, Bhubaneswar.. Memberships: IEEE, ISTE, ACEEE

Profile: Suman Majumder. Role: Assistant Professor - II. Bio: Name & Profession: Dr. Suman Majumder – Researcher, Academic, and Technology Professional. Academic Background: Post-Doctorate at Nanyang Technological University (N.T.U), Singapore (focused on Cross-Blockchain and Quantum-Blockchain applications). Ph.D. in Computer Science Engineering from N.I.T Sikkim (Secure communication protocols for IoT and blockchain-based e-voting). M.Tech in Information Technology from Jadavpur University;  B.Tech in Computer Science Engineering from West Bengal University of Technology. Notable Accomplishments: Working as a "Visiting cum Collaborative Researcher" with the National University of Singapore (N.U.S), mainly in the domain of "Quantum Hardware". Received “Certificate of Achievement” from IBM India and PMI (Phillip Morris International, a Client of IBM) on 20.09.13 for outstanding team performance and collaboration. Worked on challenging live projects for several European Countries, like PMI (Philip Morris International) from 30.07.2012 to 01.10.2014, BIO RAD Industries from 30.04.2012 to 29.07.2012, and British American Tobacco (BAT) from 18.10.2011 to 29.04.2012. Delivered lectures on IoT Security during a one-week Cyber Security workshop organized by NIT Arunachal Pradesh, sponsored by ATAL Academy, Delhi & TEQIP-III (3rd–7th February 2020) and received a "Participation cum Appreciation Certificate" from N.I.T Arunachal Pradesh. Honoured and active as a Track Chair and Reviewer for international conferences ICNSBT 2025 and ISAI 2025. Presented a lecture on a complex topic in Quantum Computing (available on YouTube: https://youtu.be/sQ3RyiElOs0). Before joining KIIT, he was an Assistant Professor II at the Computer Science Engineering Department, Amity University. Authored numerous high-indexed SCI journals, research articles, book chapters, and international conference papers. Details: Email: suman.majumderfcs@kiit.ac.in. Additional Info:

Profile: Swagat Ranjan Sahoo. Role: Assistant Professor (II). Bio: Dr. Swagat Ranjan Sahoo is currently serving as an Assistant Professor (II) in the School of Computer Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University, Odisha. He completed his Ph.D. from IIT Guwahati in 2025, M.Tech from NIT Allahabad in 2012, and B.Tech from BPUT, Odisha in 2010. He has over six years of teaching experience and three years of industry experience. His favourite teaching subjects include Cloud Computing, Computer Networks, Operating Systems, Web Technology, and Real-Time Systems. His research interests span Vehicular Ad hoc Networks (VANETs), Cloud Computing, and Artificial Intelligence. Dr. Sahoo has published more than 10 research papers in reputed national and international conferences and journals. He has taken on several leadership roles as part of organizing committees for international conferences, workshops, and FDPs. He has also served as a TPC member and Session Chair for various international conferences, and worked as a reviewer for international journals and conferences. Profile: Tanik Saikh. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Tanik Saikh is an Assistant Professor in Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT) university, Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. Prior to joining KIIT, he was a postdoctoral researcher at L3S Research Center, Leibniz University, Hannover, Germany. He did his Ph.D. in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering, at IIT Patna. He was fortunate to be advised by Dr. Asif Ekbal and Prof. Pushpak Bhattacharyya. Generally, his research interest lies in the domain of Natural Language Processing (NLP), Machine Learning (ML) and Deep Learning (DL), particularly in applying Natural Language Inference (NLI)/ Textual Entailment (TE) in Fake News Detection, Question Answering, and Novelty Detection. Currently, he is working on multi-modal (combining text with image) fake news detection in the news domain, multi-modal question answering, i.e., reasoning over multiple modalities (text, images, table) to extract the best possible answer to a complex question. Prior to joining IIT Patna, he was involved as Research Engineer at Jadavpur University. He has more than ten years of working experience in the different areas of NLP, Text Analytics, and Machine Learning. He worked in several national level consortia based projects funded by DeitY, Govt. of India, in Computer Science and Engineering Department, Jadavpur University, and also continued research work in Textual Entailment, Question Answering, Machine Learning, Eye Tracking, etc. During his stay at Jadavpur University he did an one year certification course on Introduction to Linguistics. He did his masters (M.Tech) and bachelor (B.Tech) from Indian Institute of Engineering Science and Technology Shibpur, and Government College of Engineering and Leather Technology, West Bengal University of Technology, West Bengal, India. He did hid schooling from his native place located at Birbhum district in West Bengal. He also worked as a lecturer in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering department, Aliah University, Kolkata, India for more than a year. 
Google Scholar Citation which is the benchmark for Computer Science and Engineering shows 206 career citations to my papers. My h-index: 8 and i-10 index: 6. Details: Email: tanik.saikhfcs@kiit.ac.in. Additional Info:

Profile: Mainak Biswas 2. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Dr Mainak Biswas, PhD, computer scientist with specialization in application of machine learning and deep learning in biomedical domain. His research is inspired from providing an effective solution for computer aided diagnosis for diverse diseases. His PhD specialization was in application of advanced machine learning and deep learning in complex tissue characterization and segmentation from ultrasound images of liver and carotid arteries. His other interests are development of advanced machine learning architectures and early warning systems for risk estimation of both symptomatic and asymptomatic patients at high risk of CVDs. He also has keen interest in development of new metrics for Machine Learning algorithms based on statistical mechanics. He has published and presented more than 30 papers in the area of characterization and segmentation of ultrasound images through machine and deep learning platforms. His H-index is 16, and he has more than 1700 citations on his research. One of his review paper “The Present and Future of Deep Learning in Radiology” has more than 300 citations. Dr. Mainak Biswas completed B.Tech from Government College of Engineering and Ceramic Technology under West Bengal University of Technology, Kolkata, M.Tech from Jadavpur University and PhD from National Institute of Technology Goa, INDIA. Currently, he is serving as Associate Professor at Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology. Details: Email: mainak.biswasfcs@kiit.ac.in, Website: sites.google.com. Additional Info: Educational Qualification: Coordinator, MICVU. Research Interests: Machine Learning and Deep Learning

Profile: Meghna G Raj. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Dr. Meghana G Raj is a distinguished academician with a robust educational background and extensive teaching and research experience in the field of Computer Science and Engineering. She earned her  Master’s degree from the prestigious National Institute of Technology Karnataka, Surathkal, India and completed her Ph.D. in Computer Science and Engineering at KiiT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneshwar, specializing in cutting-edge research areas. With over nine years of teaching experience, Dr. Meghana has guided and inspired undergraduate students in a wide array of subjects, including the Internet of Things (IoT), Database Management Systems, and Algorithm Design and Analysis and Operating Systems. Her teaching approach blends academic rigor with practical insights, equipping students with a comprehensive understanding of foundational and emerging technologies. Before transitioning to academia, Dr. Meghana gained valuable industry experience during her tenure at IBM India, Bangalore, where she worked for two years. Her professional journey has given her a unique perspective, enabling her to bridge the gap between academic theory and industry practices. Dr. Meghana’s research interests lie in cloud-based security, algorithm design, and the Internet of Things, reflecting her passion for addressing real-world challenges through innovative solutions. She has actively contributed to the advancement of knowledge in these areas, demonstrating her commitment to academic excellence and impactful research. A dedicated educator and researcher, Dr. Meghana G Raj continues to inspire her students and peers alike, fostering a culture of learning, innovation, and collaboration. Details: Email: meghana.rajfcs@kiit.ac.in. Additional Info: Research Interests: IoT Routing and security and cloud computing. Profile: Hrudaya Kumar Tripathy. Role: Professor & Dean, Research. Bio: Dr. HRUDAYA KUMAR TRIPATHY is a Professor of the School of Computer Engineering, KIIT, Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, India. He has completed a Doctorate in Computer Science from Berhampur University, Master in Computer Science and Engineering from the Indian Institute of Technology, Guwahati and a Post Doctoral Fellowship from the Ministry of Higher Education, Malaysia. Dr. Tripathy has 24 years of teaching experience with post-doctorate research experience in the field of Artificial Intelligence, Soft Computing, Machine Learning, Speech Processing, Mobile Robotics, and Data Analytics. He had been a visiting faculty for a couple of years in Asia Pacific University, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia and the Universiti of Utara Malaysia, Sintok, Malaysia. Dr. Tripathy was awarded a Young IT Professional Award in 2013 on a regional level by the Computer Society of India (CSI). Awarded as best visiting faculty by UUM, Malaysia in the year 2016, listed as the world’s top 2% scientists in the year 2023 by Stanford. He is a senior member of the IEEE Society, a life member of CSI & has membership in other professional bodies such as IET, IACSIT, and IAENG. Dr. Tripathy is the editor of 11 books under the publication houses of Springer, Elsevier, Wiley, and IGI Global. He has published more than 150 research publications in different national/international journals and conferences. Profile: Suresh Chandra Satapathy. Role: Director Doctoral Research & Publications.. Bio: Dr Suresh Chandra Satapathy is a Ph.D in Computer Science Engineering, currently working as Professor of School of Computer Engg and Dean- Research at KIIT (Deemed to be University), Bhubaneshwar, Odisha, India. He held the position of the National Chairman  (Educational and Research) of Computer Society of India and is also  a senior Member of IEEE. He has been instrumental in organizing more than 60 International Conferences in India as Organizing Chair and edited more than 80  Book Volumes from Springer LNCS, AISC, LNEE and SIST Series as Corresponding Editor. He is quite active in research in the areas of Swarm Intelligence, Machine Learning, Data Mining and Cognitive Sciences. He has developed two new optimization algorithms known as Social Group Optimization (SGO) published in Springer Journal and SELO( Social Evolution and Learning Algorithm)  published in Elsevier. He has delivered number of Keynote addresses and Tutorials in his areas of expertise in various events in India and abroad. He has more than 150  publications in reputed journals and conf proceedings. Dr. Suresh is in Editorial board of IGI Global, Inderscience, Growing Science journals and also Guest Editor for Arabian Journal of Science and Engg published by Springer. He is the Editor-in-Chief of IJIDSS from Inderscience and Associate Editor of KES Journal from IOS press.He is a visiting professor to number of reputed Universities like University of Leicester , London, NTU, Singapore, Duy Tan University, Vietnam, etc. He was awarded Leadership in Academia Award in India  by ASSOCHEM for the year 2017. Profile: Dr. Banishree Misra. Role: Associate Professor I. Bio: Dr. Banishree Misra is currently serving as an Associate Professor-I at Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT), Deemed to be University, where she has been a faculty member since 2008. She earned her Master’s degree in Power Electronics and Drives in 2007 and her Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering in 2018, both from KIIT. Dr. Misra has published over 35 research papers in reputed journals and conferences, including those by Elsevier, Springer, and IEEE. She is an active member of several professional societies, including IEEE, the Institution of Engineers (India) [IE(I)], the Indian Society of Lighting Engineers (ISLE), the Indian Society for Technical Education (ISTE), and the Indian Science Congress Association (ISCA). Her research interests include power electronic converters, power quality improvement, design and analysis of active and passive filters, adaptive filter design, and grid synchronization techniques.. Profile: Chinmoy Kumar Panigrahi. Role: Professor and Director, School of Electrical Engineering, Director, Co-Branded Program. Bio: Prof. Chinmoy Kumar Panigrahi is currently the Professor and Director of the School of Electrical Engineering at KIIT DU. His research focuses on Soft Computing Techniques, Power Systems, Renewable Energy, Battery Management Systems, Deregulation, and Smart Grids. He has supervised 30 PhD scholars and 72 M.Tech scholars, with four ongoing PhD candidates under his joint guidance. Prof. Panigrahi has published 182 research articles in referred journals and presented 148 papers at reputed conferences. He previously served as Reader and HOD at BIT Mesra (2006–2009) and HOD at BIET Bhadrak (1991–2006). Over his 34-year academic career, he has received multiple accolades, including the Top 3 Ph.D. Supervisor at KIIT in 2022 and Outstanding Scientist Award (2020). He is a senior IEEE member and holds fellowships with various prestigious organizations.. Profile: Amlan Datta. Role: Professor. Bio: Amlan Datta has completed his B. Tech in Electronics and Electrical Communication. M. Tech in Microwave and Radar Engineering and Ph. D in Electronics from IIT Kharagpur in the year 1987, 1989 and 1992, respectively. During his Ph. D work, he published 6 papers in leading journal viz., IEEE Microwave Theory and Technique, IEE Proceeding Part H, etc. After completion of his Ph. D work he has worked in DRDO sponsored project and as Scientist in Defense Electronics Applications Laboratory for 5 years. He has worked in Reliance Communication for 12 years and rolled out and maintained GSM and CDMA network last as Wireless Lead, Kolkata. Tech students and more than 100 B. Tech students during this period. He published 30 Scopus indexed papers. Details: Email: amlanfet@kiit.ac.in, Website: sites.google.com, Scopus Id: 56136383500. Profile: Ayaskanta Mishra. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Ayaskanta Mishra is pursuing Teaching and Research since 2011. Prior to his teaching career he was working as Engineering at SIEMENS Communications & Enterprise Networks India part of SIEMENS AG. He is currently active in research Communication Engineering & Next-Generation Networks. His area of interest includes Network & protocols optimization, Cyber-Physical Systems (CPS), Internet of Things (IoT), AR/VR, UI/UX, Sensor data analytics, WSN, Network Security, Internet technologies, optimization techniques using AI and Machine learning. He has numerous indexed Journals and international/national conference proceedings to his credits. He is having rich experience on different network tools NS-2, QualNet, CISCO Packet Tracer, protocol analyzers and embedded development platforms like Arduino, Raspberry Pi, Intel Galileo, XBEE Zigbee motes for developing of IoT application prototypes for Smart Cities, Healthcare, Supply Chain Management, Environment and Agriculture. He has undergone various industry training and associations with Wipro Mission 10X professional trainer program, D-Link Certified Network Trainer, Intel FiCE certified trainer for IoT, Ericsson Trainer in Media & Applications. He is associated with Training Programs from Cypress Semiconductors and Microchip in the domain of Embedded Systems and IoT. Prof. Mishra is giving training and consultancy service to budding engineers and corporate on Computer Networks & IoT. He has received his Bachelor in Engineering degree with Distinction from SATHYABAMA Deemed to be University (Chennai) in the year 2007 and Masters in Technology from IIIT in year 2011. He is currently pursuing Ph.D in Communication Networks and IoT. He is professional society member IET (UK) since 2017 and a life member ISCA. Details: Email: ayaskanta.mishrafet@kiit.ac.in, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=u42VXtYAAAAJ&hl=en. Additional Info: Educational Qualification: Ph.D (Cont), M.Tech, B.E. Research Interests: Internet of Things (IoT), M2M, Cyber-Physical Systems, Computer Networks, Cognitive Radio, Wireless Sensor Networks, Next Generation Networks, Artificial. Projects: Industrial Training on IoT and Consultancy Services to budding engineers & corporates. Administrative Responsibility: •Faculty In-charge Quality Assurance Cell (Electronics)

•Faculty In-charge Lab: Wireless Communication & Networking Lab 

•Course Coordinator: Data Communication & Networking, Internet of Things (IoT), Communication & Network Security. Memberships: IET (UK), ISCA. Outreach Activity: https://sites.google.com/site/profamishrasnetworkingacademy/

Profile: Deep Mukherjee. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Deep Mukherjee began his career in education as an Assistant Professor under School of Electronics Engineering  in Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology(KIIT) Deemed to be University in 2012. He has six years of experience in teaching and two years of experience in industry. He teaches Industrial Automation & Control, Fiber Optics Instrumentation, Instrumentation- I & II, Biomedical Instrumentation, Process Control, Control System, Electrical & Electronics Measurement, Analog Electronics and Digital Electronics. He holds a bachelor’s degree (B.E) in Applied Electronics & Instrumentation Engineering from Burdwan University and a master’s degree (M.TECH) in Instrumentation & Control Engineering from Calcutta University. He is a member of The Institution of Engineering & Technology(MIET) UK and recently  has been also playing role as reviewer in a Scopus indexed journal. His research interest includes development of fractional order controllers for nonlinear process, nonlinear controller, optimization techniques. He has been also presenter at conferences on his research article. He is involved under departmental committee member for accreditation process. He organized two days workshop on Soft Computing Techniques in Engineering Applications. He organized two days workshop on Process Instrumentation Technologies in collaboration with IET kolkata local network. He played a role as publicity chair in an International Conference CINE. He conducted one day seminar on Sensor & Sensing Technologies. He Played role as an organizing committee member also in 6th WCASET. Recently he also organized one day workshop on Process Dynamics Control & Applications in association with IET Kolkata network. He has been guiding B.TECH level projects and under his guidance a group of students won best project in State level during Engineering Students Innovation Challenge(ESIC). Profile: Jyoti Ranjan Panda. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Jyoti Ranjan PANDA received his B.Tech degree in Electrical Engineering from the College of Engineering and Technology, Bhubaneswar in 1999, M. E. degree in Communication Engineering from BITS, Pilani, and Rajasthan in 2001. He completed his Ph.D from Indian Institute of Technology, Guwahati in October 2012. Prior to that he was senior research fellow (SRF) in a BRNS, DAE funded project “Development of Preforms from High Power Fiber Lasers” in Department of Physics and Meteorology, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur (May 2002 to March 2004), faculty in Durgapur Institute of Advanced Technology (DIATM), Durgapur, West Bengal, National Institute of Science and Technology (NIST), Berhampur, Odisha. He was serving as an Assistant Professor from June 2012 to November 2012 and from November 2012 to till now he is serving as an Associate Professor in School of Electronics Engineering, Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (Deemed to be University), Bhubaneswar, Odisha. His research interest is in microwave Engineering, planar antennas for wireless communication. Now he is started working in the field of adaptive and array signal processing. Profile: Manas Ranjan Tripathy. Role: Assistant Professor II. Bio: Dr. Manas Ranjan Tripathy has more than 16 years of experience in teaching and research. He started his academic career as a lecturer in the Department of Instrumentation and Electronics Engineering, OUTR, Bhubaneswar (Formerly known as CET, Bhubaneswar) in the year 2008. Later, he joined SOA University, Bhubaneswar in 2010. He earned his PhD from the Indian Institute of Technology, Banaras Hindu University, Varanasi in 2020. Before joining KIIT University, he worked as an Assistant Professor there at SRM University, AP. 
Dr Manas has authored and co-authored 40 research articles in various peer-reviewed journals and conference proceedings including 3 papers in IEEE Transactions and one Nature Indexed journal. He was invited by many institutions to deliver talks related to the VLSI domain. Dr. Manas has also received best paper awards at IEEE Conferences. He also served as a reviewer in many international journals and conferences. Dr. Manas Ranjan Tripathy, Assistant Professor-II in the School of Electronics Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University has participated in many INUP programs held at IISc, Bangalore related to the fabrication and characterization of nanoscale devices. Profile: Nirmal K. Rout. Role: Professor. Bio: Prof. Rout has twenty six years of experience in academic and research area in different national repute institutions. He has won the Best Faculty Award of the KIIT University on January 26, 2016. He is also certificated Mission10X Learning Approach Practitioners from Wipro Ltd. He has received the B.E. from UCE (presently known as VSSUT), Burla, M. Tech. from the Utkal University, Bhubaneswar, and Ph.D. from KIIT University, Bhubaneswar in 1991, 2001 and 2014 respectively. From 1991 to 1993, he was a Lecturer with the Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering, GIET, Bhubaneswar. From 1993 to 2002, he was a Lecturer with the Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering, OEC, Bhubaneswar. He also served as a Faculty Member of ICFAITech, Hyderabad from 2002 to 2007. He is currently working as a Professor with the School of Electronics Engineering, KIIT University, Bhubaneswar. He has published a number of research papers in various refereed international journals and conferences. His current research interest includes active noise control, adaptive signal processing, image processing, soft computing and evolutionary computing. Profile: Pravin Kumar Samanta. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Prof. Pravin Kumar Samanta has been working as an Assistant Professor since mid of 2017, in School of Electronics Engineering Department at Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT), Deemed to be University in Bhubaneswar. He did his B.Sc Honors in Physics with a first class degree from Rama Krishna Mission Residential College at Narendrapur, Kolkata (affiliated to Calcutta University). At graduate level he was awarded Scholarship for Higher Education (SHE) under the prestigious program, Innovation in Science Pursuit for Inspired Research (INSPIRE) conducted by the DST, Govt. of India. He holds B.Tech degree in Radio Physics and Electronics from the Institute of Radio Physics and Electronics under Calcutta University and pursued his M.Tech with specialization in VLSI Design from Calcutta University. He has two years research experience in VLSI domain under Special Manpower Development Project, 2016-17 (SMDP C2SD Project, by DeitY, Government of India). He has more than five years of teaching & research experiences. Currently he is perusing his Ph.D. in KIIT Deemed to be University in the area of Biomedical Image Processing. His research areas are mainly focused on Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Biomedical Signal & Image Processing and FPGA Design. Besides Technological knowledge, he has a deep thrust for research in Science and Spirituality, Cosmology, Vedic wisdom and Indian Culture. Profile: Rasmita Lenka. Role: Assistant Professor (II). Bio: Dr. Rasmita Lenka has over 18 years of experience in technical education. She began her career as a teaching professional and has gained extensive expertise in Analog & Digital Communication, Optical Communication, and Industry 4.0. Over the years, she has also been an active contributor to various departmental activities and served as a Programme Officer in NSS, reflecting her commitment to academic as well as social responsibilities. She earned her B.Tech in 2004, followed by an M.Tech from VSSUT, Burla, and a Ph.D. from KIIT Deemed University in the field of Image Processing. Her research interests include Image Processing, Signal Processing,Biomedical Engineering and Communication, where she continues to contribute through her scholarly work. Her teaching methodology emphasizes a numerical and concept-oriented approach, which has been widely appreciated and valued by her students for its clarity and effectiveness. Profile: Shruti. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Since 2019, Shruti has held the position of Assistant Professor in the School of Electronics Engineering at Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology, a deemed university located in Bhubaneshwar. She earned her Bachelor of Technology degree, specializing in Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering, from the same institution in 2015. Prior to her academic tenure, she gained 8 months of experience as a software trainee at Aricent. Continuing her academic journey, she pursued and completed her M.Tech in Electronics and Communication Engineering at IIT Bhubaneswar, 2019 where her focus was on research in wireless communication.In 2024, Shruti successfully defended her PhD thesis at Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology. Titled “Design of Metamaterial Based Terahertz Absorber For Refractive Index Sensing,” her doctoral work underscores her proficiency in the field. Her research interests encompass wireless communication, THz technology, and metamaterial absorbers. With a publication record exceeding 10 contributions in reputable international journals and conferences, she has made notable contributions to advancing knowledge in her areas of expertise. Profile: Srinivas Ramavath. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Mr. Srinivas Ramavath received the B.Tech degree in Electronics and Communications Engineering from the JB Institute of Engineering and Technology (JBIET) is approved by All India Council for Technical Education and affiliated with Jawaharlal Nehru Technological University, Hyderabad, India, in 2009 and M.Tech degree in Wireless Communication Engineering from the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT), Guwahati, in 2012. From 2009 to 20010, he worked as a Software Engineer with the MNC, Hyderabad. He joined the Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT), Bhubaneswar as a faculty member in 2012. He has authored or co-authored over 6 international conference papers in the areas of his research interests. Profile: Subhrakanta Behera. Role: Associate Professor - I. Bio: Dr. Subhrakanta Behera was born in Odisha, India. He received the B.Sc. Degree from Utkal University in 1995, the M.Sc. Degree from Berhampur University in 1997, the M. Tech. Degree from Cochin University of Science and Technology, Kochi, Kerala, in 2004, and the Ph.D. Degree from Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore-12, India, in 2011, under the guidance of Prof. K. J. Vinoy. He spent a year as a Postdoctoral Research Fellow at the GE Global Research Centre, Bangalore. He is currently an Associate Professor - I in the School of Electronics Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, India. His research interest is in the field of computational electromagnetic, RF and microwave engineering, Microwave antenna, Nano Fabrication and RF MEMS. He is the author or coauthor of 15 papers and articles published in international conferences and scientific journals. Details: Email: skbeherafet@kiit.ac.in. Profile: Subir Kumar Maity. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Subir Kr. Maity has more than twelve years of academic experience. He has completed Ph.D. from the Institute of Radio Physics and Electronics, University of Calcutta, in the area of Nano-scale MOS transistors with III-V compound semiconductors as channel material.  He has completed his M.Tech in specialization of VLSI Design and Microelectronics Technology from Jadavpur University, Kolkata, West Bengal. He is also the winner of the gold medal for securing 1st position in the M.Tech VLSI specialization. His search interests are compact modeling of sub-micron MOSFET, MOS transistors with high mobility channel material, quantum well MOSFET, Negative Capacitance FETs, Artificial Neural network based compact model development, etc. Details: Email: skmaityfet@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 57052324700, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=7BuZx6wAAAAJ&hl=en. Additional Info: Research Interests: VLSI Design & Microelectronics, Nano Scale MOSFET. Administrative Responsibility: FIC Exam co-ordinator

Profile: Sudhakar Sahu. Role: Professor. Bio: Sudhakar Sahu is presently working as Professor, School of Electronics Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. He received ME degree in Electronics & Telecommunication Engineering from Indian Institute of Engineering Science & Technology (IIEST) Shibpur, West Bengal & PhD (Engineering) degree in Electronics & Telecommunication Engineering from Jadavpur University, Kolkata. He is the author and co-author of 60 articles in International Journals & Conference Proceedings. He has supervised 4 doctoral theses. He has successfully completed two Govt. Of India funded projects: one is AICTE, New Delhi and another BRNS-DAE, Mumbai. His research interests and activities include Dielectric Resonator based MIMO Antenna for Cognitive Radios, UWB Antenna, Microstrip Filters, Metamaterial/Metasurface based microwave components & application of Soft Computing Techniques in Engineering. He is a Senior Member of IEEE AP/MTT Society, Fellow IE (India), Member IET (UK) & Life Member ISTE (New Delhi). Details: Email: ssahufet@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 25823542300. Additional Info: Research Interests: RF & Microwave Engineering

Profile: Sudhansu Sekhar Singh. Role: Professor. Bio: Dr. Sudhansu Sekhar Singh has received a PhD in Engineering (Wireless Communication) from Jadavpur University, Kolkata, India and a M.E. in Electronic System and Communication Engineering from R.E.C (presently NIT) Rourkela, India. He is working as a Professor in School of Electronics Engineering, KIIT University, Bhubaneswar, India. He has more than 18 years of teaching experience and 8 years of other professional experience. More than 75(seventy five) publications in International journals and reputed international conference proceedings are to his credit. Also he has guided more than twenty five PG thesis and Three doctoral thesis. He has also examined several doctoral dissertations. His broad research area includes but not certainly limited to wireless and mobile communication, multicarrier CDMA, MIMO-OFDM,Wireless Sensor Networks. Details: Email: ssinghfet@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 52264726500. Additional Info: Educational Qualification: Ph.D. in Engineering ( Wireless and mobile Communication domain) from Jadavpur University, Kolkata 
M.E. in Electronic System and Communication Engineering from R.E.C (presently NIT) Rourkela. Research Interests: Wireless and Mobile communication, Multicarrier CDMA, MIMO-OFDM, Wireless, 
Sensor Networks, and Cognitive Radio Networks.. Administrative Responsibility: Program Head -Electronics & Instrumentation Engineering,  Electronics, and Control System Engineering. Memberships: Life Member ISCA, Life Member ISTE,AMIE

Profile: Sukanta Kumar Sabut. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Sukant Sabut received the B.E. and M. Tech. degrees in Electronics Engineering from the VT University of Karnataka in 2005 and the Ph. D. degree in Medical Science and Technology from IIT Kharagpur, India, in 2011. From 1997 to 2007, he was a rehabilitation engineer in JSS Medical College and Hospital, Mysore. From 2013 to 2017, he was an Associate Professor of the Electronics Engineering Department, ITER, SOA University, Odisha. Presently working as a Associate Professor in School of Electronics Engineering,KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. Dr. Sabut is a member of IEEE, IET, IFESS, Rehabilitation Council of India, Biomedical Engineering Society of India, and the Institution of Engineers (India). He is the author of 82 articles in journals and conferences. He has over 20 years of
experience in both teaching and research. He has guided 05 Ph.D and many M.Tech students. His research interests include biomedical signal and image analysis, Machine learning and neural and rehabilitation engineering. Edited Book: Sabut S.K. ,  Ray A.K. ,  Pati B. ,  Acharya U.R. Proc. of International Conference on Communication, Circuits, and Systems: IC3S 2020: Lecture Notes in Electrical Engineering , 2021, 728. Profile: Suman Roy. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: I am working as an Assistant Professor in the School of Electronics Engineering at Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT) deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar since July 2018.  I am a Ph.D. Scholar (presently in part-time category) in the Department of Electronics and Electrical Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati. My research interest includes Feedback Shift Register (FSR) sequences, Pseudo-random Number Generators (PRNGs), MIMO-LFSR. 
I completed my B.Tech. in Instrumentation and Control Engineering from the Calcutta Institute of Engineering and Management in 2010. Then, I finished my M.E. in Nuclear Engineering from Jadavpur University, Kolkata in 2012. I worked at National Institute of Science and Technology, Odisha for six months (July 2012-Dec2012) as an Assistant Professor in Electronics and Instrumentation Engineering Department. After that, I joined the Ph.D. programme of IIT Guwahati in December 2012. Details: Email: suman.royfet@kiit.ac.in, Website: roysuman05.wixsite.com. Additional Info: Educational Qualification: Ph.D. (Persuing), M.E., B.Tech.. Research Interests: Cryptography, Control systems,Pseudorandom number generation using stream ciphers. Administrative Responsibility: Project FIC (EEE),Course Co-ordinator PMI

Profile: Sunil Kumar Mishra. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Sunil Kumar Mishra received the Ph.D. degree in Electrical Engineering from Motilal Nehru National Institute of Technology Allahabad, India. He is working as an Assistant Professor with the School of Electronics Engineering, Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology, Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. He previously worked as Assistant Professor with the Department of Electrical and Electronics Engineering, Ajay Kumar Garg Engineering College, Ghaziabad, India. His research interests include Control Systems, Ocean Wave Energy, Nonlinear Controller Design. Details: Email: sunil.mishrafet@kiit.ac.in, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=thqgwmQAAAAJ&hl=en. Additional Info: Research Interests: Control and Instrumentation,Ocean Wave Energy, Nonlinear Controller Design

Profile: Suprava Patnaik. Role: Professor. Bio: Suprava Patnaik received B.Sc Engg and M.Sc Engg degrees from NIT, Rourkela and awarded with PhD from E & ECE Dept., IIT, Kharagpur. She has nearly 100 publications in SCI & Scopus indexed journals and conferences to her credit. She has 30 years of teaching and research experience. She has served as faculty at NIT, Rourkela, SVNIT, Surat and XIE, Mumbai. She also worked as guest lecturer and bigdata research associate in University of Western Australia, Perth, during 2015-2017. She has successfully guided 9-PhD scholars leading to award of degrees. Details: Email: suprava.patnaikfet@kiit.ac.in. Additional Info: Educational Qualification: PhD. Research Interests: Machine Learning, Computer Vision, Audio Processing, Biomedical Signal Processing,. Memberships: IEEE ,ISTE ,IETE,IES

Profile: Susanta Kumar Badi. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: S. K. Badi, received his B.Tech from EAST College under BPUT in E & TC branch, M.Tech in  RF,Microwave & Photonics (Electrical Engg.) from IIT, Kanpur, in 2011 and 2013 respectively. He is continuing  Ph.D. in KIIT DU, from the year 2018. He is currently serving as Assistant Professor in SOEE, KIIT  DU, Bhubaneswar. His research interests include Multiband Microwave Filters using Inverse Scattering Approach,Metamateriala based MIMO Antenna for 5G and future wireless communications,THz antenna, Metamaterial absorbers in THz application, UWB-MIMO Antenna, Reconfigurable Antenna,Fractal Antenna.He is a  member of  IET, ISC. Profile: Swati Swayamsiddha. Role: Assistant Professor. Profile: Udai P Singh. Role: Sr Professor. Bio: Udai P Singh has nearly 25 years of experience in teaching and research. After completing his Ph D from Banaras Hindu University, Varanasi (1993), he joined Global Solar Energy (India) Ltd, Gurgaon to work on the process development and production of CdTe based thin film solar cells. During that period he also got the training at First Solar Inc. USA. In 2000 he joined the Institute of Energy Conversion, University of Delaware, USA as Limited Time Researcher and worked on the processes development of flexible CIGS based thin film solar cells. He joined KIIT in December 2002 as a faulty and currently he is Sr.  Prof in the School. During his stay at KIIT he has been invited as Visiting Consultant to Industrial Technological Research Institute (ITRI), Hsinchu, Taiwan in 2008 and 2009. Dr Singh has developed a good research facility in the area of thin film PV from several research funding form DST, DRDO, MNRE etc .
Dr. Udai P Singh, Sr. Professor in the School of Electronics Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University has participated and completed the Leadership Academician Program sponsored by MHRD, Govt of India from 23rd Sept to 5th October 2019 at Banaras Hindu University (BHU), Varanasi and from 7th Oct. to 12th October 2019 at Nanyang Technological University (NTU), Singapore. In all,  25 participants were selected from all over India to participate in this program Details: Email: singhup@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 57190872502, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.co.in/citations?user=JCKQqpoAAAAJ&hl=en. Profile: Vikas Kumar Jha. Role: Assistant Professor. His area of research primarily focuses on Interdisciplinary application of Signal Processing, Embedded system and Charcoal Electronics. Dr. Jha has over six years of teaching/research experience. Profile: Wriddhi Bhowmik. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: He has 5 years teaching experiences. He did his ME and PhD thesis in the field of RF & Microwave Engineering. His research area was Butler matrix array, SIW, EBG, Microstrip patch antenna and other passive devices. He worked as Assistant Professor at Raj KUmar Goel Institute of Technology, Ghaziabad UP for 2 years as well as at Haldia Institute of Technology, Haldi, WB for 3 years. Joined KIIT, Deemed to be University on June 2018. He taught UG subjects like, Analog Communication, Digital Communication, Control System, Signal & System and Wireless Communication. Heknows to operate different EM simulation softwares like SONNET, ADS, HFSS as well as measurement instruments like VNA, Spectrum Analyzer. He also knows the chemical pholithography process of PCB fabrication. Upon completion of PhD, he is continuously working on his research career and also written some project proposals to the organizations like Department of Science & Technology, Govt. of West Bengal (WBDST) and  Department of Science & Technology, Govt. of India (Young Scientists Scheme) for funding, so that can set up a well equipped laboratory and work independently. His impeccable outlook of learning, problem solving capability and his tireless effort during Master's and PhD thesis work as well as in teaching put a significant contribution in his professional development and these are admirable. Profile: Manoj Kumar Parida 2. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Manoj Kumar Parida has been pursuing his doctoral degree from Indira Gandhi Centre for Atomic Research, Department of Atomic Energy, (HBNI-BARC Mumbai), India. In his research he has worked on Monte Carlo Simulations to optimize the geometrical parameters for Semiconductor Neutron detector in order to obtain the maximum efficiency of thermal neutrons. He has extensively worked on micro fabrications of cantilever using Photo Lithography tool. Along with alpha spectroscopy experienced on Si PIN diode, he has experienced of handling and performing the challenging neutron detection experiments. He has also performed electrical characterization of the Si PIN diode before and after neutron irradiation.
His area of research primarily focuses Interdisciplinary application of detector design and Charcoal Electronics. Manoj Kumar Parida has over five years of teaching/research experience. Currently he is also working on the project “Charcoal Based Low-Cost Smart Sensor for Agriculture Application”. Details: Email: manoj.paridafet@kiit.ac.in. Additional Info: Educational Qualification: PhD,Btech. Research Interests: GEANT4 simulation for obtaining the optimized geometry for neutron detector. Alpha Spectroscopy experiments using Si PIN diode

Profile: Dr Sushanta Kumar Mohapatra. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: He received his B.E. from Utkal University, M.E. in Communication Control and Networking from MITS, Gwalior, in 1994 and 2003 respectively. He obtained Ph.D. from National Institute of Technology, Rourkela, in the year 2016. Currently he is working as Assistant Professor, in School of Electronics Engineering, Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology, Bhubaneswar from 20th June 2016. He have more than 19 years of teaching experience. He had a teaching and administrative experience as an Assistance Professor and Head of the Department of ETC from Mar. 2001 to Jun. 2011 at A.B.I.T., Cuttack. Explore, share and learn interesting research opportunities on Nano-electronics devices, Sensors for Communication and RF Transceivers with application towards IoT in which my contributions will make a difference to the quality of life of real people.His research interests include Modeling and Simulation of Nanoscale Devices and its application in IoT. Energy efficient Wireless Sensor Networking, Adhoc Networks, Cellular Communications, Metamaterial absorbers in THz application, UWB-MIMO Antenna, Reconfigurable Antenna, Performance enhancement for high frequency applications. He has extensively contributed as author and co-author in several national and international journals and conferences of repute. He has been a part of committee member of various international conferences, Editorial Board Member and Reviewer of many international journals. Profile: Dr Mano Ranjan Kumar. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Mano Ranjan Kumar is Ph.D. from National Institute of Technology, Raipur and presently working as Assistant Professor at School of Electronics Engineering, Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT), Bhubaneshwar, India. He had pursued M.E. and B.E. from Birla Institute of Technology Mesra, Ranchi and Bhilai Institute of Technology, Durg respectively. His research interest includes ultracapacitor modeling and characterizations, fractional-order system modeling & control and optimization techniques. Details: Email: mano.kumarfet@kiit.ac.in. Additional Info:

Profile: Abinash Tripathy. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Dr. Abinash Tripathy is working as Associate Professor in the School of Computer Application, KIIT Institute of Industrial Technology, Bhubaneswar.  He has completed his Ph.D. from National Institute of Technology, Rourkela in 2017, M.Tech. from department of Computer Science and Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University in 2009. He has an experience of 12 years in industry / teaching at UG and PG level. He has worked as faculty in Raghu Engineering College, Visakhapatnam, NIST, Berhampur and MITS, Rayagada. He has published research articles  in Expert system with Application, Elsevier, Knowledge and Information System, Springer, Multimedia Tools and Application, Springer and Complex and Intelligent Systems, Springer etc. Details: Email: abinash.fca@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 57203049514. Profile: Debasmita Pradhan. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Dr. Debasmita Pradhan has 18 years of teaching experience and ten years of research experience in Computer Science and Engineering. Her  portfolio includes teaching core computer science subjects such as Data structures, algorithms, and  advanced computer science subjects such as Soft Computing, Machine Learning, Parallel Distributed Systems, Big Data analysis, Hadoop, Map Reduce, etc. She has expertize in the programming languages like  C, C++, JAVA, MATLAB, and Python and supervises them in developing models using machine learning and Python to solve real-life problems.
Her research expertise is in Machine Learning and Systems Biology, which aligns well with state-of-the-art research and professional service activities for the betterment of society at large. She completed her Ph.D. in Computer Science and Engineering from the School of Computer Engineering in 2021.  She also received the prestigious ""Research Foundation Day Award"" from Biju Pattanaik University of Technology in 2020 for her outstanding research publication. Apart from teaching and research, she is actively involved in several administrative responsibilities and student-related activities. She monitors the technical projects done by the students in their 3rd and 4th years of Btech and ensures their quality. As mentor of students she stays connected with the students and guide them for their professional, physical, and emotional well-being. Students love to be in touch with her during their difficult times and have confidence in her to share their problems and to take effective guidance.
She is also a member of IEEE and an active member of the IEEE Bhubaneswar sub-section. She is Vice-Chair, of Students Activities, IEEE, Bhubaneswar Sub-section, and Secretary, Women in Engineering(WIE), IEEE, Bhubaneswar Sub-section. She actively participates in organizing different Technical and Socio-Technical events under the banner of WIE, IEEE ,Bhubaneswar sub-section. Details: Email: debasmita.fca@kiit.ac.in. Additional Info: Research Interests: Machine Learning and Systems Biology

Profile: Hemant Kumar Apat. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Hemant Kumar Apat is an academic and researcher in the field of Cloud and Fog Computing, Internet of Things (IoT), Blockchain-assisted Security, and Optimization Algorithms. He earned his Ph.D. in Computer Science and Engineering from the National Institute of Technology (NIT) Rourkela, where his doctoral research focused on developing performance enhancement strategies for fog–cloud computing environments. His work proposed innovative task placement and optimization techniques aimed at minimizing latency, energy consumption, and cost while ensuring secure and scalable service delivery in IoT-based systems. He is currently serving as an Assistant Professor at the School of Computer Applications, KIIT Deemed-to-be University, Bhubaneswar, where he teaches core computer science subjects including Cloud Computing, Data Structures, Design and Analysis of Algorithms, Optimization Theory, and Data Mining. He obtained his M.Tech. from Maulana Azad National Institute of Technology (MANIT), Bhopal, in 2018, where he explored graph-theoretic approaches in bioinformatics. Dr. Apat’s research outcomes include several SCI-indexed publications, international conference papers, book chapters, and multiple patent filings. His current research continues to focus on optimizing distributed computing architectures and integrating emerging technologies for sustainable and intelligent IoT-driven applications. Details: Email: hemant.fca@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 57209340614. Additional Info: Research Interests: Fog Computing, Internet of Things, Cloud Computing

Profile: Jayant Kumar Rout. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Jayant Kumar Rout is working as an Assistant Professor in the School of Computer Application, KIIT-DU Bhubaneswar. He is a distinguished academician with a robust educational background and a wealth of experience in the field of teaching and research. He graduated with a Bachelor's degree in Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering from KIIT, Bhubaneswar, in 2003, and his M.Tech. from the Dept. of Electrical and Electronics Engineering, IIT Guwahati, in 2011. He completed his Ph.D. from the Dept. of Electronics and Communication Engineering, NIT, Patna, in 2023. With an impressive 19 years of teaching experience at UG and PG levels, Dr. Jayant has demonstrated his expertise in the classroom and beyond. His research focuses on cutting-edge areas such as Speech Signal Processing, Keyword Spotting, Automatic Speech Recognition, and Machine Learning. His contributions to these fields are evidenced by his research publications in esteemed conferences and journals, including IET Signal Processing; Speech Signal Processing, Elsevier; Circuits, Systems, and Signal Processing Springer, etc. Throughout his career, Dr. Jayant has been committed to advancing the frontiers of knowledge and nurturing the next generation of scholars. His dedication to excellence in both teaching and research has earned him widespread recognition and respect within the academic community. Details: Email: jayantrout.fca@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 57209653304. Additional Info: Educational Qualification: Ph.D.. Research Interests: Speech Signal Processing, Keyword Spotting, Automatic Speech Recognition.

Profile: Jnyana Ranjan Mohanty. Role: Registrar. Bio: Dr. Jnyana Ranjan Mohanty received his Ph.D. degree in Computer Science from Utkal University, Bhubaneswar in the year 2008. He has more than 25 years of teaching experience (UG & PG levels). He joined KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar in July 1997 as a Lecturer, and presently he is a  Professor. He has served KIIT  in different  administrative capacities too (as Associate Dean & Controller of Examinations). Presently, he is the Registrar of KIIT Deemed to be University. Prior to joining KIIT, he served  as a Lecturer at Institute of Business Administration and Training, Bhubaneswar. He is actively engaged in research work and has a number of Ph.D. scholars under his guidance. He has authored books and has to his credit innumerable publications in reputed International Scopus/ SCI indexed journals and in International Conference proceedings. He has also edited books published by Springer and  IJCA Volumes. He has conducted several conferences and workshops as the organising chair/ program chair. His research interests include Queuing Theory, Computational Intelligence, and Cloud Computing. Details: Email: jmohantyfca@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 55627877886, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.co.in/citations?user=DHvFWE0AAAAJ&hl=en. Additional Info: Educational Qualification: Ph.D. in Computer Science. Research Interests: Queuing Theory, Computational Intelligence, and Cloud Computing. Administrative Responsibility: Registrar. Awards & Honours: Best Faculty Award in 2010. Memberships: Life Member of ISTE and ISCA. Outreach Activity: Art of Giving

Profile: NILKANTA DAS. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: "Dr. Nilkanta Das is an Assistant Professor (I) at the School of Computer Application, Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT) University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. He achieved his Ph.D. in Mathematics from the National Institute of Technology (NIT) Rourkela, supported by a prestigious Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR) fellowship from the Government of India. His doctoral thesis, titled ""Numerous Novel Analytical Techniques for Solving Nonlinear Partial Differential Equations Arising in Physical Systems,"" reflects his significant contributions to the field. Dr. Das completed his M.Sc. in Mathematics in 2017 and his B.Sc. in Mathematics (Major) in 2015. He also achieved his 10th and 12th standard education from the West Bengal State Boards in 2010 and 2012, respectively. He has successfully qualified in several competitive exams, including the CSIR UGC NET JRF, GATE, and Assam SLET. With five years of rigorous research experience, Dr. Das is a dedicated researcher with a strong focus on advancing Applied Mathematics, Fractional Calculus, Mathematical Physics, Nonlinear Dynamics, and Mathematical Photonics. He has published nine research papers in prestigious SCI-indexed international journals and presented a conference paper at an IEEE conference." Profile: Rabindra Kumar Barik. Role: Associate Professor. Profile: Sumit Kumar Tetarave. Role: Assistant Professor II. Bio: Dr. Sumit Kumar Tetarave received his Ph.D. degree in Computer Science and Engineering from IIT Patna, in 2020. After Ph.D., he joined a one-year post-doctoral position with the Department of Computer Science at the University of Texas at San Antonio (UTSA), USA. He had worked in collaboration with the University Health System (the 3rd largest public health system in Texas) on steps to improve patient outcomes using data analytics and artificial intelligence models. Due to Dr. Tetarave’s research dedication, UTSA provided him with a POI-collaborator status to continue his work from India until August 2023. His research interests include P2P network security and Artificial Intelligence. Details: Email: sumitkumar.fca@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 54788482600. Additional Info: Research Interests: Security issues in peer-to-peer overlay networks and machine learning algorithms.

Profile: Utpal Chandra De. Role: Assistant  Professor. Bio: Dr. Utpal Chandra De graduated with a Ph. D. in Computer Science & Engineering from Sri Sri University (SSU). He has worked in industry/teaching at the UG and PG levels for over 25 years. He was a Head Learning and Development at ISDAC (ATC of C-DAC), Bhubaneswar. He began working at KIIT University on July 09, 2009, and has since advanced from Assistant Professor-I to Assistant Professor-II. He also oversees SCA's Labs and is actively involved in academic mentoring, lesson planning, and curriculum development. In addition to his many other responsibilities at KIIT University, he also develops educational content and plans structured lessons. He also helps students with their research and academic mentoring. He has a number of papers to his name in prestigious conferences and journals that are listed in Scopus. Details: Email: utpal@kiit.ac.in, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?hl=en&user=7rMPNtUAAAAJ. Additional Info: Educational Qualification: M. Tech. (CSE), Ph.D.. Profile: Veena Goswami. Role: Director General, School of Computer Applications. Bio: Veena Goswami is currently a Professor in the School of Computer Applications,
Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology, Bhubaneswar, India. She received her Ph.D degree from Sambalpur University, India, in the year 1994 and then worked as post-doctoral fellow at Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur for two years. Her research interests include continuous-  and discrete-time queues. She has published research articles in INFORMS Journal of computing, Computers and Operations Research, Applied Mathematical Modelling, Performance Evaluation, Computers and Mathematics with Applications, Computers and Industrial Engineering, Applied Mathematics and Computation, Methodology and Computing in Applied Probability,  etc. Details: Email: veena@kiit.ac.in. Profile: Soumyendu Shankar Ray. Role: Director. Bio: Soumyendu Shankar Ray has applied the design approaches he has taught for three decades to two generations of students, in his practice – adventurous juxtaposing of the conventional and the cutting edge, and the conservative and the avant-garde. His work is striking in the exciting departures within disciplined geometries, and radical reinterpretations of the traditional aesthetic in contemporary materials. As former Dean of the Faculty of Architecture, Biju Patnaik University of Technology, Odisha, and now the founding Director of the School of Architecture and Planning, KIIT University he has brought the professional and the academic together at Vastukar, the firm he founded in 1985. Nurtured through the decades when architecture was little-known in the state, Vastukar is now one of the largest and most respected firms in the region for Architecture, Planning and Urban Design. His research interest led to the fruition of 'Vastukar Foundation', a research based non-profit organization on sustainable built environment and conservation studies. He is the author of the book ‘Odisha-an architectural odyssey’, a comprehensive timeline perspective of architectural evolution of the region. Details: Email: soumyendu.ray@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 56501598500. Additional Info: Educational Qualification: Ph.D.. Administrative Responsibility: Director

Profile: Sovan Saha. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Sovan Saha is an Architect and Urban Designer with more than ten years of experience, including industry and academics. He completed his under graduation Bachelor of Architecture (B.Arch) from Jadavpur University, Kolkata in 2011. He holds a postgraduate degree in Urban Design from School of Planning and Architecture (SPA), New Delhi. Sovan has worked as urban design consultant in multiple urban level projects. He was engaged in various architectural and public space design projects while working with renowned architectural organizations and one developer company based in Kolkata. He is skilled in Creative Concept Design, Placemaking and Project Planning & Execution. Sovan has been active in the field of academics and continuing his research work focused on urban affairs since 2019 onwards. He was associated with Jadavpur University Kolkata as a guest faculty, with India Institute of Engineering Science and Technology (IIEST), Shibpur as an Assistant Professor (on contract) and with Amity University Kolkata as an Assistant Professor (Grade-I). Presently he is a regular faculty in KIIT (Deemed to be University), Bhubaneswar and working as an Assistant Professor (Grade-II) at the KIIT School of Architecture and Planning. Besides he is pursuing his Doctoral Research Work at National Institute of Technology (NIT), Rourkela. Details: Email: sovan.sahafar@kiit.ac.in. Additional Info: Educational Qualification: B.Arch , M.Ud , PhD (Pursuing). Research Interests: Urban Design , MSME Cluster Development. Memberships: Registered Member of Council of Architecture (CoA) and Institute of Urban Designers India (IUDI)

Profile: Suryendu Dasgupta. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Suryendu Dasgupta is an architect and urban designer working in the field of urban heritage management. His research focuses specifically on exploring and developing heritage conservation approaches as a collaborative effort, with the participation of the community and responding to their aspirations and expectations. His PhD research led to the development of a comprehensive heritage management approach for colonial hill stations in India, within the context of Darjeeling. The outcome of the research promoted equilibrium between urban development, built heritage protection and expectations of the local community, thus aligning with the UNESCO Heritage Urban Landscape approach. He was also a DAAD Research Scholar, involved in a collaborative project between IIT Roorkee and RWTH Aachen, for developing an "Indo-German Centre for Experimental Architecture and Material Culture". He has also worked as a Project Fellow in IIT Roorkee in the project "Campus Accessibility and Inclusion of Diversity" that aims towards making the campus accessible to all its stakeholders at multiple and diverse levels of functions, spanning academics and administration, guided by the principles of Universal Design and Accessibility. Details: Email: suryendu.dasguptafar@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 57217291259. Additional Info: Educational Qualification: B.Arch., M.Arch., PhD. Research Interests: Urban Heritage Management. Administrative Responsibility: Course Coordinator 4th Year B.Arch, M. Arch. (Urban Design) Coordinator, Coordinator Timetable, Tutor Mentor 4th Year B.Arch.. Awards & Honours: DAAD Scholarship 2021, MHRD Fellowship 2014-21. Memberships: CoA Lifetime Member

Profile: Abhijit Sutradhar. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Abhijit Sutradhar commenced his career as a lecturer in Mathematics in the year 2010 at Rajiv Gandhi University of Knowledge Technologies (IIIT Nuvid), Andhra Pradesh. He has earned a bright academic career throughout first class along with more than six years of experience from Triveni Devi Bhalotia Degree College in West Bengal as an Assistant Professor, IIT Bhubaneswar as a Visiting Assistant Professor, and Siksha ‘O’ Anusandhan as an Assistant Professor. He pursued his B.Sc. in Mathematics Honours from the University of Burdwan and his M.Sc. and Ph.D. in Mathematics from IIT Kharagpur. He has been teaching different UG (B. Tech. & B.Sc.) and PG (M.Sc. & Ph.D.) courses like Engineering Mathematics-I & II, Differential Equations, Transform Calculus, Linear Algebra, Real Analysis, Numerical Analysis, Fluid Dynamics, Numerical Methods for ODE & PDE, C Programming and Data Structure, Python Programming, Data Science using Python, Graph Theory, Advanced Discrete Mathematics. His research publications reach more than 130 citations with H-index 6 in reputable journals such as Microvascular Research, Journal of Magnetism and Magnetic Materials, Journal of Fluid Engineering, Journal of Nanofluids, Transport in Porous Media, Journal of Heat Transfer, etc. Dr. Sutradhar has also organized International Conferences and a short-term training programme and has chaired sessions at international conferences. His research areas include Biofluid Dynamics, Magnetic Drug Targeting, and Nanofluidics in Porous Media. He guided eight M.Sc. students, and one research scholar has been pursuing his research works. He qualified JAM 2008, CSIR-NET (June) 2009, and GATE 2010. Among his achievements, he was awarded the First Class First in B.Sc. Mathematics Honours from the University of Burdwan in 2008. Details: Email: abhijit.sutradharfma@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 55651076400. Additional Info: Awards & Honours: Received Dharani Dhar Roy Medal for becoming the First Class First from the University of Burdwan in B.Sc. Mathematics (Hons.) in the session 2005-08
