Profile: Alok Kumar Panda. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Panda completed his doctorate in Biophysical Chemistry and Biochemistry from Indian Institute of Technology Bhubaneswar. He did his postdoctoral studies in the field of lens crystallins from SUNY Albany USA. He is currently engaged both in teaching and research. The research work in his lab is mainly focused on the following aspects:
1. Exploring the role of mutations, stress and posttranslational modifications on the structure, dynamics, and function of small heat shock proteins and lens crystallins which plays a vital role in diseases such as tuberculosis and cataract. 
2. Isolation, characterization, and profiling of the bioactivities of natural products from different sources.
3. Exploring the role and interactions of ayurvedic medicines/products with biomolecules to understand and enhance the use of ayurvedic medicine as therapeutics. Profile: Amalesh Kumar Manna. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Amalesh Kumar Manna has 2 years of experience in teaching undergraduate courses in Engineering Mathematics and 2 years 6 months of experience in postdoctoral research work. He got the UGC-Dr. D. S. Kothari Post-Doctoral Fellowship (DSKPDF) award in 2019. He worked as a UGC-Dr. D. S. Kothari Postdoctoral Fellow in the Department of Mathematics at the University of Burdwan, West Bengal, India. He earned his Ph.D. degree in Mathematics from Vidyasagar University, West Bengal, India. He received his M.Sc. degree in Applied Mathematics with “Operations Research” specialization from Vidyasagar University, West Bengal. He has published forty-five research papers in SCI/SCIE/ SCOPUS journals. His broad research area of interest lies in the fields of inventory control, supply chain management, computational optimization in crisp and interval environments and metaheuristic algorithms. He is currently working on inventory control and supply chain management in crisp, fuzzy, stochastic and interval environments. Details: Email: amalesh.mannafma@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 7005076127. Profile: Amulya Kumar Mahto. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Amulya Kumar Mahto has completed his PhD in Statistics from Indian Institute of Technology Patna, India in April, 2021. Prior to his PhD, he did his MTech (Mathematics and Computing) from Indian Institute of Technology Patna, India in 2015 and MSc (Mathematics and Computing) from Indian Institute of Technology (Indian School of Mines) Dhanbad, India in 2012. His research interests include Statistical Inferences and Data Science. He has been an excellent researcher who has published 10 journal articles of international repute. Besides his research, he has almost two years of teaching experience, which include teaching of Probability and Statistics, Statistical Inferences, R programming, Python programming, Graph Theory, Mathematics I &II etc. He has also attended and presented in many national and international workshop and conferences. Profile: Anita Pati. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Dr. Anita Pati obtained her Masters Degree in Chemistry from Sambalpur University followed by M.Phil and Ph.D in Organic Synthesis from Sambalpur University under the supervision of Prof. R. K. Behera. After working as a Lecturer in Chemistry in NIST, Berhampur for some period she joined the research group of Dr. Santosh J. Gharpure and Dr. D. K. Chand, Indian Institute of Technology Madras (IITM), Chennai as a research associate to gain relevant experience in the area of application oriented organic synthesis and supramolecular chemistry. Dr. Pati also got an opportunity to work with Prof. P. S. Mukherjee, Indian Institute of Science (IISc), Bangalore with Science Academies’ summer research fellowship and added some more stars to her experience in the field of supramolecular chemistry. She joined the KIIT Family in 2013 and at present working as an Associate Professor in the Department of Chemistry, School of Applied Sciences. She has been actively engaged in teaching, research and administration at KIIT University. She is having more than 9 years of teaching experience and 16 years of research experience (including M.Phil and Ph.D). She has got the recognition from various Government Funding agencies to work on different projects and also published research papers in reputed journals. She is also a member of selected professional bodies and serves as an editorial board member for some reputed journals. Her research interest mainly focuses on Application oriented synthetic organic chemistry and supramolecular chemistry. Profile: Arijit Patra. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Arijit Patra  is currently working as an Assistant Professor in the Department of Mathematics, School of Applied Sciences, Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT) Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar since August' 2022. Prior to joining the KIIT University, he was a Guest Faculty at Tezpur University, Tezpur, Assam. Dr. Patra completed his Ph.D. from Rajiv Gandhi Institute of Petroleum Technology, Amethi, Uttar pradesh. He completed his M.Sc. in Mathematics from Sidho Kanho Birsha University, West Bengal and graduated from Burdwan University, West Bengal with Mathematics Honors. His research interest is in Reliability Theory, specifically in the field of Stochastic Ordering and Ageing. Apart from this he is actively involved with his research work. He has published SCI indexed research articles in various international journals of repute. Details: Email: arijit.patrafma@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 57217514123. Profile: Arun Kumar Gupta. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Arun Kumar Gupta is currently an Assistant Professor at the Department of Mathematics, in the School of Applied Sciences at KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. Dr. A. K. Gupta completed his Ph. D. in Mathematics in the year 2017 from National Institute of Technology Rourkela, Odisha, India. He received his M. Sc. degree in Mathematics in 2011. He has more than five years of teaching experience at undergraduate and post-graduate level. He also has about Eight years of research experience in various fields of Applied Mathematics. His interest areas include numerical analysis, fractional calculus, partial differential equations, mathematical modelling, and wavelet transform methods. He authored a book entitled, “Wavelet Methods for solving Partial Differential Equations and Fractional Differential Equations” published by the CRC Press of the Taylor & Francis group. He has presented papers at various national and international conferences and has published several research articles in various international journal with high repute. He is currently supervising Ph. D. Scholars working on Partial and Fractional Differential Equations, Numerical Analysis and Wavelet transform methods. Profile: Bapuji Sahoo. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Bapuji Sahoo is currently employed as an Assistant Professor at the Department of Mathematics in the School of Applied Sciences at KIIT Deemed to be University, located in Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. He holds a Ph.D. in Mathematics, which he obtained in the year 2022 from the Indian Institute of Technology Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. Dr. Sahoo obtained his M.Sc. degree in Mathematics back in 2014 from the Indian Institute of Technology Bombay, Mumbai, India. 
He taught for two years at IGIT Sarang, Odisha, and VIT-AP University, India. Furthermore, he has about six years of extensive research experience in several areas of Applied Mathematics. Dr. Sahoo's research primarily on ‘Computational Fluid Dynamics’ with a special focus on the development of higher-order compact Schemes (HOCS) and their applications in rotating fluid flow. Profile: Bidhubhusan Sahu. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Sahu earned his M.Sc. (Physics) degree from Ravenshaw University, Cuttack. Subsequently, he completed M.Phil. from Utkal University, and  obtained his Ph.D. degree in Nuclear Physics from North  Orissa University, Baripada in 2011 under the guidance of Esteemed Professor Dr. Basudeb Sahu.  Before joining KIIT in 2012, he was a post-doctoral researcher at Institute of Physics, Bhubaneswar, India from 2010 to 2012. He was awarded a DST (SERB) funded fast track project in 2014 and successfully completed in 2019. One of his student awarded Ph.D degree. Currently he is supervising two research scholars for their doctoral thesis. Dr. Sahu’s research area deals with the study of theoretical nucleus-nucleus potential, scattering and fusion phenomena in heavy ion collisions. Currently, he is working on nuclear structures and decay modes of heavy and super-heavy elements using relativistic mean-field (RMF) formalism. He has keen interest to search the possible shell/sub-shell closure in super-heavy nuclei adjacent by decay chains of alpha and other radioactive decay particles using different formulae including the Viola-Seaberg, analytical formula of Royer, universal curve formula, and universal decay law etc. Details: Email: bbsahufpy@kiit.ac.in, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?hl=en&user=jt-0lR0AAAAJ. Additional Info: Educational Qualification: Ph.D. Projects: JRF, DST Project (SR/S2/HEP-18/2004), India 2006-08
SRF, DST Project (SR/S2/HEP-18/2004), India 2008-10. Administrative Responsibility: Dy Superintendent KP-VII. Memberships: OPS, ICS. Outreach Activity: Education for All

Profile: Debdulal Ghosh. Role: Assistant Professor. Profile: Dibyaranjan Rout. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Dibyaranjan Rout obtained his PhD degree in Physics from IIT, Madras and subsequently joined postdoctoral position in the Department of Materials Science and Engineering, KAIST, Korea. He also served as a Research Assistant Professor in the same institute for 2 years. To his credit, he has published more than 50 papers in peer reviewed journals, handled 2 Govt. funded projects (DST, NALCO) and filed 2 patents. Under his supervision, 3 PhDs and 10 master thesis are awarded. He is having  collaboration with some premium institutes (IITs, RRCAT, IISc, IMMT, DIAT, BARC) in India.
Dr. Rout's research interest encompasses the structure-process-property relationships exhibited by functional/smart materials particularly lead-free Piezoelectric /multiferroic / high-Tc relaxor materials. He is keen to design and develop such novel and eco-friendly materials in the form of bulk ceramics, nanoparticles, nanostructures, thick films, fibers, and nanocomposites using ease and cost-effective processes (solid state, reaction, soft chemical, spray pyrolysis, electrospinning) with adequate figures of merit suitable for industrial applications (specially  actuators, MLCC, energy storage/harvesting, dye degradation). Profile: Gopal K. Pradhan. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Gopal K. Pradhan obtained his Master Degree in Physics from Utkal University, Bhubaneswar followed by his PhD in experimental condensed matter physics from the Jawaharlal Nehru Centre for Advanced Scientific Research (JNCASR), Bangalore. Following his PhD, he worked as a postdoctoral researcher at the University of Texas, Austin, USA and at the Pierre and Marie Curie University, Paris, France. He also worked as a visiting researcher at Lulea University of Technology, Sweden and as a research associate at the Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore. Prior to joining KIIT University, he was a visiting scientist at Institute of Physics, Bhubaneswar. His broad research interest has been to understand thermal, elastic, structural and bonding properties of materials, structure-property relationship and microscopic mechanism of thermodynamically driven phase transitions using Raman and Brillouin scattering and synchrotron x-ray diffraction (XRD). Particularly, use of high pressure in condensed matter systems has been an integral part of his research activity with an active interest in the physics and chemistry of planetary interior. In particular, he is interested in understanding various condensed matter phenomena under high pressure that provides important fundamental insights on designing functional and exotic materials. He also uses his knowledge of high-pressure science in understanding the melting processes of the deep Earth, such as at the core-mantle boundary conditions. He has a sound background in high pressure methods including laser heating in ultra-high pressure conditions, Raman and Brillouin scattering, synchrotron x-ray diffraction. He has been an active user of major synchrotron based x-ray sources such as ESRF (France), ELETTRA (Italy) & APS (USA) to address some of the pressing issues in condensed matter physics and planetary interiors. Beyond his academic and research interests, Dr. Pradhan co-founded the Social Startup “Villamart” that is working to enhance and strengthen the lives of rural people particularly farmers to build strong, prosperous agricultural communities. It was adjudged as one of the top 10 social enterprises of India at the Tata Social Enterprise Challenge (TSEC 2017) conducted by IIM Calcutta. He co-founded "Bhubaneswar Area Scientific Events (BASE)", an integrated online calendar page that displays various scientific events happening in the greater Bhubaneswar area. The calendar aims to foster better academic coordination & interaction, visibility & dissemination of information to interested people. In 2007, he along with his MSc classmates co-founded "Vanivihar Physics Alumni Fund" at the Department of Physics, Utkal University, Bhubaneswar. This fund provides financial support to the poor and needy students during their financial hardship.  Besides his scientific interest, he enjoys Indian classical music, travel, cooking and Odia poetry. Profile: Jagnyaseni Tripathy. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Tripathy has ~10 years of experience in teaching and Research.  Prior to joining KIIT in 2012, she had the opportunity to teach at University of Cincinnati and Michigan State University as a teaching assistant. Dr. Tripathy hails from the state of Odisha, India and has earned her PhD in Physics from Michigan State University working under the supervision of Prof. Warren F. Beck in the Dept. of Chemistry and Prof. Lisa J. Lapidus Dept. of Physics. She had then worked with Prof. Robert M. Dickson at /georgia Inst. of Technology, USA as a post-doctoral researcher, following which she joined KIIT as an assistant professor. Her broad area of interest lies in the field of biophysical research. Duly inspired by her training in multidisciplinary research involving Physics, Chemistry and Biology, she is keen on exploring the dynamics of disease related proteins using various Laser spectroscopic probes. She is currently working on developing nanoclusters  for  pathological detection and therapeutic in collaboration with Dickson research group at Georgia Tech, USA. Details: Email: jtripathyfpy@kiit.ac.in, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?hl=en&authuser=2&user=D0Al_ToAAAAJ. Additional Info: Educational Qualification: PhD. Awards & Honours: Dissertation Award from MSU 2009, JRF 2002, GATE 2002. Memberships: ISC

Profile: Jashashree Ray. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Jashashree Ray obtained her Master degree from  National Institute of Technology, Rourkela followed by her Ph.D degree in Experimental Condensed Matter Physics. She worked as a research associate at S. N. Bose National Centre for Basic Sciences, Kolkata and then awarded National Post Doctoral Fellowship of SERB, India. Prior to joining KIIT University, she was an Assistant Professor (TEQIP - III) at Government College of Engineering, Keonjhar.  Her research interest includes magnetic materials, dielectric and ferroelectric materials, multiferroics, magnetoelectrics, superconductors, low temperature physics, thin films, thin film tranistor (TFT) devices etc. Details: Email: jashashree.rayfpy@kiit.ac.in, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.co.in/citations?user=QgH3FgwAAAAJ&hl=en. Additional Info: Educational Qualification: Ph.D. Research Interests: Experimental Condensed Matter Physics. Profile: Kartikeswar Mahalik. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Kartikeswar Mahalik is currently working as an Assistant Professor at the Department of Mathematics, in the School of Applied Sciences at KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. Dr. K. Mahalik completed his Ph. D. in Mathematics in the year 2023 from Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur, India. He received his M. Sc. degree in Mathematics in the year 2016 from Indian Institute of Technology Madras, India. He received his B. Sc. degree from Institute of Mathematics and Application Bhubaneswar, Odisha. He works in the field of applied functional
analysis, specifically in functional inequalities, fixed point theory, nonlinear analysis, well-posedness theory of various nonlinear inequalities, and the area closely connected to it. Details: Email: kartikeswar.mahalikfma@kiit.ac.in. Additional Info: Awards & Honours: 1. Received National Board for Higher Mathematics (NBHM) Undergraduate Fellowship (2011-2014).

2. Qualified CSIR-UGC National Eligibility Test (NET-JRF) with CSIR Research Fellowship
(2017).
3. Qualified Graduate Aptitude Test in Engineering (GATE) (2018).. Memberships: 1. Life Member of Indian Mathematical Society (IMS) since 30th March 2020.
2. Life Member of Odisha Mathematical Society (OMS) since 2nd March 2023.

Profile: Krushna Gopal Mishra. Role: PROFESSOR. Bio: Krushna Gopal Mishra after the Post graduation in Chemistry in 1981, obtained his Ph. D Degree from Utkal University, Vanivihar, and Bhubaneswar. Dr. Mishra is presently serving as Professor of Chemistry in School of Applied Sciences, KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar. In addition to teaching & Research, Dr. Mishra has discharged various important administrative responsibilities of the University. Prof. Mishra has wide exposure in Research and Development during his tenure at RRL (presently known as IIMT-sister wing of CSIR) and at present in KIIT University, Bhubaneswar. He has published more than 40 publications in different national and International journals of repute and has three Patents to his credit. During his early research career he was trained in different countries namely Perth, Melbourne etc in connection with to his research work. His research interest pertains to the broad area of Electrochemistry and in specific to Corrosion, Electrodeposition, Electroless deposion, Electro leaching and electrokinetics.. Profile: Lalatendu Biswal. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr Lalatendu Biswal began his career in education as a lecturer in Physics in August 1993 in Karanjia College, Karanjia, Mayurbhanj, Odisha and has taught Physics (Hons) and Pass and in +2 classes for 15 years. Then he worked as Asst Prof in Physics in Rajdhani Engineering College, Mancheswar for two years. He joined to faculty position in Department of Physics, School of Applied Sciences, KIIT Deemed to be University in July 2010, and currecting serving in position of Asst Prof -II. He holds his PhD degree from Sambalpur University. He was a senate member to North Odisha University from year 2002 to 2005. He has authored a number of published research papers and actively engaged in current research on Theoretical and Experimental Condensed Matter Physics. He is currently guiding two research Scholars. Details: Email: lbiswalfpy@kiit.ac.in. Additional Info: Research Interests: Theoretical and Experimental Condensed Matter Physics

Profile: Madhusmita Sahoo. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Dr. Madhusmita Sahoo is currently working as Associate professor (I) in the Department of Mathematics, School of Applied Sciences, KIIT Deemed to be University and she joined the University in July 2010. Currently she is the Course coordinator of MATH-I (MA 1003) and an internal member of BOS. She has a research project under DAE, Govt. of India. She is a very dedicated and sincere teacher. She started her journey as a Lecturer in Mathematics in College of Engineering Bhubaneswar, Bhubaneswar in 2006. She has 16 years of Teaching Experience including 11 years of Research experience. She has a research project under NBHM, DAE, Govt. of India. She has expertise in the field of Operator Theory and Fractional Differential calculus. Dr. Sahoo completed her Ph. D. degree in the area of “Positive operators on Bergman spaces and their norm estimates” from Utkal University, M.Phil from Sambalpur University and M.Sc. from Utkal University. Prior to that she obtained her B.sc degree in Mathematics from S. V. M. College Jagatsinghpur. She has published her research wok in many national and international journal of repute. She has presented papers and participated in many International and national seminar/conferences to her credit. Dr. Sahoo is a life member of OMS. ISCA and ISTE. She was deputy superintendent of ladies hostel in the year 2012. She involves herself in various outreach programs like Art of Giving, Kanya Kiran, Plantation and Swachha Bharat Abhiyan etc. Details: Email: msahoofma@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 24401901600, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=bsCkONIAAAAJ&hl=en. Additional Info: Educational Qualification: M. Sc., M. Phil., Ph. D.. Research Interests: Functional Analysis, Complex Analysis, Algebra. Projects: Research project on “Positive Operators on Reproducing Kernel Hilbert                                                                                             Spaces and their Berazin Transform” is approved by NBHM, Govt. of India, DAE in 2016.. Administrative Responsibility: Course Coordinator (MATH-I), Internal BOS member.. Memberships: ISCA, OMS. Outreach Activity: Kanya Kiran, Art of Giving

Profile: Manas Ranjan Mohapatra. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Manas Ranjan Mohapatra was a postdoc fellow at Shantou University, China from 2018-2020. He has completed his PhD in Mathematics from the Discipline of Mathematics, Indian Institute of Technology Indore in May 2017. His thesis entitled "Geometric properties of the Cassinian metric" is written under the supervision of Dr. Swadesh Kumar Sahoo, Associate Professor, IIT Indore. He completed his master's degree from Department of Mathematics, Utkal University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha and bachelor's degree in science from Nayagarh College, Nayagarh, Odisha. His research interests include hyperbolic-type metrics and quasiconformal mappings. Details: Email: manas.mohapatrafma@kiit.ac.in, Website: sites.google.com, Scopus Id: 57192577018, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=UfQegucAAAAJ&hl=en&oi=ao. Profile: Mitali Madhumita Acharya. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Mitali Madhumita Acharya is currently working as an Assistant Professor-II in the department of Mathematics  at KIIT deemed to be University. She  has 10 years of teaching experience and 14  years of research experience. She received his PhD degree in Numerical Functional Analysis from Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur, India. Before joining as a JRF in IIT Kharagpur for PhD programme, she received her M.Phil. and M.Sc. degrees in Mathematics from Berhampur University and Ravenshaw (Autonomous) College (Utkal University), respectively. So far,s he has published a good number of research papers in various international journals and conferences. She has guided three research scholars for their Ph.D. degree.  Her areas of research are Numerical Functional Analysis, Operations Research. Profile: Mrutyunjay Das. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Dr. Mrutyunjay Das began his career as a lecturer in mathematics in the year 1999, in KIIT, Bhubaneswar. He has got a bright academic career with throughout career first class. He has got his M.Sc. and M. Phil. in Mathematics from Utkal University, Vani Vihar and Ph. D. degree from KIIT University. He has been teaching different UG(B. Tech.) and PG(MSc/M.Tech./PhD) courses like Eng. Math, Differential, Integral and Transform Calculus,  Algebra, Numerical Analysis, Probability and Statistics, Numerical Methods for ODE/PDE, Analysis of Differential Equations, Probability & Stochastic Process, Quantitative Methods, Advanced Numerical Methods and Computational Fluid Dynamics etc. He has published research articles in reputed National and International journals with high impact factors. His publications reach more than 400 citations with H-index 11. Dr. Das, has also organized International Conferences and workshops and has chaired sessions in international conferences. His research areas include theoretical/numerical investigations of the Newtonian/non-Newtonian fluid flow models. Under his guidance, one research scholar has been awarded a Ph.D. degree and another four are pursuing their research works. Dr. Das has collaborated with the professors of International and National repute for various research works. He is a reviewer of many reputed National/International journals such as Pramana, Propulsion and Power Research, Alexandria Engineering Journal, Journal of the Brazilian Society of Mechanical Sciences and Engineering, Heat Transfer-Wiley, Waves in Random and Complex Media, Fluid Mechanics and Research-Begell House etc. He has a lifetime membership at ISTE, ISTAM, Indian Science Congress and Orissa Mathematical Society. In addition to this he is an excellent mentor for guiding newly joined faculties as well as students. He has been acting as the Superintendent of Boys hostel since last 20 years. In addition to teaching and mentoring, he is managing some administrative responsibility. Presently, he is acting as the FIC of Quality Assurance Cell of the School of Applied Sciences. Details: Email: mdasfma@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 55330639900, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=WY8_tAYAAAAJ&hl=en. Additional Info: Educational Qualification: Ph. D.. Research Interests: Computational Fluid Dynamics. Administrative Responsibility: Senior Superintendent Boys Hostel. Memberships: Life member of Orissa Mathematical Society (OMS).
ISTAM, ISTE, OMS, ISCA. Outreach Activity: Kanya KiranArt of GivingPlantation

Profile: Narmada Behera. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Narmada Behera is currently working as an Asst. Profile: Nikita Mahapatra. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Nikita Mahapatra pursued her doctoral degree from Utkal University, Bhubaneswar in Zoology where she studied the effects of vitamin A on regenerating tails of various tadpoles. Soon after her post-graduation, she joined as a JRF in a DST funded project of Prof. Pravati Mahapatra of Utkal University. During her research tenure, she presented her work at numerous conferences. She is currently employed as Assistant Professor (I) - Biological Sciences in School of Applied Sciences, KIIT, Deemed to be University. Details: Email: nikita.mahapatrafbs@kiit.ac.in. Additional Info: Research Interests: Tail regeneration

Profile: Prasanta Kumar Das. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Dr. Prasanta Kumar Das is working as a Associate Professor of Mathematics at KIIT Deemed to be University in Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. He obtained his undergraduate degree in Mathematics (1994) from M. P, C. College (Affiliated under Utkal University, Odisha) in India. He obtained his Postgraduate degree in Mathematics (2002) from Khallikote Autonomous College (KAC) (Affiliated under Berhampur University, Odisha) in India. Dr. Das got merit certificate by getting first class first position in Mathematics at KAC.  Dr. Das received his Ph.D. in Mathematics from the Natitional Institute of Technology, Odisha (India) in 2006 under the supervision of the Professor Akrur Behera. After completion of Ph.D., he was appointed to the Department of Mathematics at Seemanta Engineering College (SEC), Jharpokharia (Odisha) in 2006 as a Lecturer and promoted to Senior Lecturer. He joined the KIIT-DU in 2011 as an Associate Professor and promoted to Associate Professor in 2018. The researh work of Dr. Das are variational inequalities, complementarity problems, fixed point theorems on set theory, differential equations, and numerical methods. Dr. Das has made over 57 publication of International repute and 06 peer reviewed papers. Dr. Das has supervised 08 Ph.D. scholars and 01 M.Sc. student.  Current research work of Dr. Das are based on following areas: 
1. Variational Inequality Problems using Fractional Calculus 
2. Variational Inequality Problems using Summability Theory
3. Numerical Approach to study Variational Inequality Problems
4. Fuzzy Variational Inequality Problems
5. Variational Inequality Problems in various spaces Details: Email: pkdasfma@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 55451770500. Additional Info: Educational Qualification: Ph. D. in Mathematics, MCA. Administrative Responsibility: Course Coordinator of Probability and Statistics (MA21001). Outreach Activity: 1. Art of Giving
2. Plantation

Profile: Priyadarshini Parida. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Priyadarshini has completed her Ph.D. from National Institute of Technology Rourkela, with the INSPIRE Fellowship Award from the Department of Science and Technology (Govt. of India). She has also done her Master in Science (Physics) from National Institute of Technology Rourkela. Following her Ph.D., she joined the Indian Institute of Technology Madras, India as an Institute Post Doctoral Fellow and worked from 2016 to 2018. Her research interest is on the Condensed Matter Theory and Computational Physics using Density Functional Theory. She is carrying out the research work on the complex oxides, transition metal-metal layers, and chalcopyrite semiconductors. She has joined the KIIT University as an Assistant Professor in the School of Applied Sciences (Physics) on January 1, 2019. Projects: UGC Start-up Research Grant in 2021, title: ""Exploring the novel quantum states at the interface of spin-orbit coupled active and inactive double perovskites. Profile: Rajashree Mishra. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Rajashree Mishra, currently working as Assistant Professor in Department of Mathematics, School of Applied Sciences, KIIT University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha.  Prior to that she was working as Assistant Professor in Mathematics in VITAM College of Engineering, Vishakhapatnam, Andhrapradesh. She received her Ph. D Degree from KIIT University in 2014 and completed M. Sc Degree in Mathematics in the year 1999 from Utkal University, Bhubaneswar. Her areas of research interest are Evolutionary Computing which specifically includes (Genetic Algorithm and Bacterial Foraging Optimization), Fuzzy probabilistic Programming and Multi-objective non linear optimization. She is having publications in reputed journals. She has presented research papers and participated in many National and International Conference of repute. She is also the Reviewer to many International Conferences. She  has also guided one research scholar and 3 are ongoing. Details: Email: rmishrafma@kiit.ac.in. Profile: Rakesh Mohan Das. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Rakesh Mohan Das joined KIIT in 2022 and is currently working as Assistant Professor (II) in the Department of Physics, School of Applied Sciences. His current research interest lies in quantum optics, quantum computing and quantum information, atomic, molecular, and optical physics, and observational astronomy. He earned his five years integrated MSc. degree in Physics from IIT Kanpur, after cracking the IIT-JEE 2006. Following this, he served as an IT consultant at Polaris Software Labs, Chennai for a year. In 2012, he ventured to Japan to pursue a Ph.D. at the Institute of Advanced Energy, Kyoto University, supported by the Monbukagakusho fellowship program. During his doctoral studies, he focused on atomic, molecular, and optical physics, collaborating with J-PARC, one of the world's largest proton accelerator facilities. He was also involved with small business firms based in Osaka in app development for two years. In 2019, he completed his PhD and returned to India. He was a short-term visiting fellow at NISER, Bhubaneswar after which he joined Utkal University as a postdoctoral researcher funded by RUSA, Govt. of India. He has about five years of teaching experience and three years of corporate industrial exposure. Details: Email: rakesh.dasfpy@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 56979789500, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.co.in/citations?user=-hSx3_oAAAAJ&hl=en. Additional Info: Educational Qualification: Ph.D in Photon Energy Science, Institute of Advanced Energy, Kyoto University, Japan, 
Five years Integrated MSc. in Physics, Indian Institute of Technology, Kanpur. Administrative Responsibility: Faculty Coordinator, Social Media Cell, School of Applied Sciences, 
Faculty Coordinator, SPIC MACAY, KIIT Student Activity Center

Profile: Rojalin Sahu. Role: Professor. Bio: Dr. Rojalin Sahu is currently working as an Professor in the department of Chemistry at KIIT deemed to be University. She has 11 years of teaching experience and 15 years of research experience. She has completed her M.Sc. and M.Phil. (Utkal University), PhD (IIT Guwahati). She is the recipient of DST young scientist travel award to present a paper at Technical University, Dresden, Germany and CONICET International Post-Doctoral fellowship. Most notably, she has been qualified Radiological Safety Officer (RSO) by BARC, Mumbai. She has been the lead Investigator of a number of externally funded projects (DST, DBT, ICMR, UGC-DAE-CSR, Ministry of Mines and BRNS). She has successfully conducted many national and international conferences as convener. She is also a NABL trained officer for Chemical Testing Laboratories. Her basic areas of research are synthesis and characterization of new Coordination Compounds and their catalytic and biomedical applications; Metal Organic Frameworks and Covalent Organic Frameworks for different application such as drug delivery, catalysis, NLO, wastewater treatment, etc. Details: Email: rsahufch@kiit.ac.in, Website: sites.google.com, Scopus Id: 57188994370, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.co.in/citations?user=w5mu96sAAAAJ&hl=en. Profile: Sarbari Acharya. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Sarbari Acharya, has been part of the prestigious KIIT-DU since 2018. She is working as Assistant Professor in School of Applied Sciences.  She has completed her Ph.D. from Institute of Life Sciences, Bhubaneswar in 2017.  Her area of research includes nanotechnology and drug delivery for cancer therapy. Besides academics she is actively engaged in research in the filed of cancer therapy. She basically works in formulating different nanoparticles and studying their efficacy and mode of action in wide spectrum of cancer.  She has 11 peer reviewed journals and 3 book chapters to her name.Recently she is studying the effect of these formulations in targeting the tumor microenviroment and cancer stem cells which are some of the major reasons for cancer aggressiveness and relapse.She has recently received a project grant from UGC-FRPS for a project entitled “Comparative therapeutic efficacy of different phyto-nanotherapeutics in overcoming drug resistance in breast cancer cells Details: Email: sarbari.acharyafbs@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 36190380700, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=hZ1uR6UAAAAJ&hl=en. Profile: Saumya Ranjan Jena. Role: Associate Professor(II). Profile: Soumen Dhara. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Soumen Dhara received his Ph. D in Physics in 2012 from Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati, India. Following his Ph. D, he moved to Japan with prestigious 'JSPS postdoctoral fellowship' from the Govt. of Japan and worked as a postdoctoral researcher at Kobe University, Osaka. After this tenure, Dr. Dhara continued his research as a senior Postdoctoral fellow at different renowned universities, S. N. Bose National Centre for Basic Sciences, India; Cambridge University; Cardiff University, United Kingdom; and Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore. He has more than 15 years of teaching and research experience, and published more than 38 research articles including 1 review article in high-profile international journals (SCOPUS and SCI indexed) and 4 book chapters to his credit. He also served as an Editor in 2 peer-reviewed book projects (international). His research trust areas of interest are semiconductor nanostructures (nanowires, thinfilms, heterostructures), optoelectronics, solid state lighting and light sensors, spectroscopy of nanomaterials including ultrafast laser spectroscopy, thin-film transistors (TFTs) etc. He has been awarded two major research projects one from JSPS, Govt. of Japan and another one from SERB, Govt. of India. Details: Email: soumen.dharafph@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 57201620718, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=t7IHkmsAAAAJ&hl=en. Additional Info:

Profile: Soumen Giri. Role: Assistant Professor II. Bio: Dr. Soumen Giri is an Assistant Professor (Grade II) at KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha. He obtained his Ph.D. from the prestigious Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Kharagpur in 2014. Following his doctoral studies, Dr. Giri conducted postdoctoral research at the Okinawa Institute of Science and Technology, Japan, from 2015 to 2017. Dr. Giri has a strong publication record, with over 32 peer-reviewed journal articles and a book chapter to his credit. He has published several high impact factor journals such as Advanced Functional Materials (IF:19.2), Journal of Materials Chemistry A (10.7), ACS Sustainable Chemistry and Engineering (IF: 7.1), Nanoscale (IF: 5.8) etc. He also secured starting research grant (SRG) of 29.3 Lakhs from SERB, Govt. of India.  His research spans several cutting-edge areas in energy storage and synthesis technologies, including: Micro-Batteries: Development of micro-batteries for portable electronic applications.
Supercapacitors: Fabrication of supercapacitors and their applications in high-altitude regions.
Electrode Materials: Discovery of novel electrode materials for advanced energy storage technologies.
Electro-Organic Synthesis: Innovations in electro-organic synthesis for applications in pharmaceuticals and energy storage.
Dr. Giri's contributions to science and technology have been recognized internationally, with his recent selection as a Brain-Pool Fellow by the Government of Korea for 2024, an honor that underscores his impact in the field of advanced materials and energy technologies. Profile: Soumyaranjan Mohapatra. Role: Assistant Professor. Profile: Srikanta Behera. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Srikanta Behera is currently working as an Assistant Professor at the Department of Mathematics, in the School of Applied Sciences at KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. Dr. S. Behera completed his Ph. D. in Mathematics in the year 2022 from National Institute of Technology Rourkela, Odisha, India. He received his M. Sc. degree in Mathematics in 2015. He has two years of teaching experience at undergraduate level. He also has about six years of research experience in various fields of Applied Mathematics. His interest areas include numerical analysis, differential equations (ODEs and PDEs), integral and integro-differential equations, wavelet transforms. His broad area of research is wavelets based numerical techniques for solving integral and integro-differential equations. Details: Email: srikanta.beherafma@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 57052365900. Profile: Srikumar Acharya. Role: Associate  Professor. Bio: Dr. Srikumar Acharya is currently working as an Associate Professor-I in the department of Mathematics  at KIIT deemed to be University. He  has 11 years of teaching experience and 15  years of research experience. He received his PhD degree in Operations Research from Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur India. His PhD thesis was on ‘Multi-choice programming problems and its applications’. Before joining as a JRF in IIT Kharagpur for PhD programme, he received his M.Phil. and M.Sc. degrees in Mathematics from Berhampur University and Ravenshaw (Autonomous) College (Utkal University), respectively. So far, he has published a good number of research papers in various international journals and conferences. He has successfully conducted some national and international conferences.  He has been serving as a reviewer for many international journals such as: IJSS, IJOCTA, IJMOR, EJOR etc. His areas of research are fuzzy programming, linear programming, mixed integer programming, multi-choice programming,  nonlinear programming, stochastic programming and transportation problem. Profile: Subhadarshan Sahoo. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Subhadarshan Sahoo is currently an assistant professor in the Department of Mathematics, Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT), Bhubaneswar, India. He has more than seven years experience in research and teaching. Dr. Sahoo completed his Ph.D. in 2018 from National Institute of Technology, Rourkela, India. He has published many peer reviewed research papers in numerous fields and various international SCI journals of repute, like Applied Mathematics and Computation, Communication in Nonlinear Science and Numerical Simulation, Nonlinear Dynamics, Transaction ASME Journal of Applied Mechanics, Journal of Computational and Nonlinear Dynamics, Computers and Mathematics with Applications, Journal of Computational and Applied Mathematics, Mathematical Methods in the Applied Sciences, Computers & Fluids, and Communications in Theoretical Physics, etc. For a detailed citation overview, the reader may be referred to Scopus. To date, he has more than 39 research papers published in journals of international repute, including more than 37 SCI journal papers. His current research interest includes the analytical methods, Numerical methods, Lie symmetry analysis for the solution of partial and fractional differential equations. Profile: Supriya Roy. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Supriya Roy recieved his doctorate in Physics in 2014 from Department of Physics, IIT Guwahati.Then, he joined as an Assistant Professor in Department of Physics, School of Applied Sciences, KIIT, Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar. Here, he teaches Engineering Physics to B. Tech. students as well as M. Sc. course. He got Post Doctoral experience in the Institute of Physics, Academia Sinica, Taipei, Taiwan during 2016-2020. Presently he joins back to KIIT and continuing his service. His field of research covers a vast area such as biophysics, soft matter and ionic diffusion in solid state electrolyte materials. He uses computational simulation techniques, such as molecular dynamics, monte carlo etc. to pursue his research. Details: Email: supriya.royfpy@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 56308768500, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=yLfugPYAAAAJ&hl=en. Profile: Sutanu Mangal. Role: Assistant Registrar & Associate Professor. Bio: Dr. Sutanu Mangal completed his Ph.D. from the prestigious Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur in 2011. During his doctoral studies, he was awarded a European Union Fellowship by the Ministry of University, Government of Italy, to support his research on semiconductor device fabrication for photovoltaic applications. His Ph.D. work involved the successful deposition of III-V semiconductor layers such as InGaP, GaAs, and InP using Metal-Organic Chemical Vapor Deposition (MOCVD). After completing his Ph.D., Dr. Mangal joined KIIT University in 2011 as a faculty member in the School of Applied Sciences. He later pursued postdoctoral research at Academia Sinica in Taipei, Taiwan, where he specialized in low-energy single- electron microscopy for imaging 2D materials. At KIIT, Dr. Mangal’s primary research focuses on semiconductor thin film deposition and device fabrication, with applications in photovoltaics and sensors. His research group is currently making significant strides in perovskite solar cell technology, achieving remarkable scientific advancements in the field. In addition to his academic and research pursuits, Dr. Mangal plays an active role in academic administration. He currently serves as Assistant Registrar of KIIT University and is a member of both the Academic Council and the Executive Council. Details: Email: sutanufpy@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 57196977238. Additional Info: Educational Qualification: M.Sc., Ph.D. Research Interests: Semiconductor Science and Technology, Semiconductor based device fabrication,
Thin films deposition, Semiconductor based photovoltaics and sensors. Administrative Responsibility: Assistant Controller of Examination (2021-2023)Assistant Registrar (QA)Member of Academic Council, KIITMember of Executive Council, KIIT. Awards & Honours: CSIR NET (2007)European Union Fellowship (2009). Memberships: Life Member of Indian Science CongressIEEE Member

Profile: Swetapadma Praharaj. Role: Assistant professor. Bio: Swetapadma Praharaj obtained her M.Tech degree in Metallurgical and Materials Engineering from NIT, Roukela and was awarded with Institute silver medal for her performance. Thereafter, she completed her PhD in Physics, KIIT-DU, during which she developed her expertise on the development of lead free piezoceramics and improvement of their figures of merit. She has keen interest to develop high strain and temperature stable high Tc ceramics (applicable in actuators, sensors and capacitors) by compositional engineering. She is proficient in evaluating the performance based figures of merit of materials in terms of S-E, P-E, Dielectric and impedance spectroscopy. To her credit, she has published her work in many peer reviewed journals. Profile: Tapas Ranjan Sahoo. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Dr. Tapas Ranjan Sahoo, is doctorate in Chemical Sciences by I.I.T. Kanpur, India and postdoctoral fellow at University of Amsterdam, Netherlands and Politecnico di Torino, Italy. He has obtained his M.Sc. degree from Utkal University, Bhubaneswar. Currently, working as an Associate Professor (II) in Department of Chemistry, School of Applied Sciences, KIIT University, Bhubaneswar. He has over 11 years of experience in teaching and administration at KIIT University. During this period, he has guided 4 PhD students and 6 MSc projects. Qualified GATE in Chemistry (2004) with 98.55 Percentile and All India Rank: 48, Dr. Sahoo has also been selected for Professor Dayanidhi Patnaik memorial award for best research paper (2017), by OCS and as Visiting Professor to IIM Indore. Dr. Sahoo's research group mainly focuses on synthesis of Metal Oxide, Mixed Oxide and Rare Earth Metal Oxide nanoparticles and its adsorption and photo catalytic activities for waste water treatment as well as dielectric, magnetic and biological applications. Profile: Utkal Keshari Dutta. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Utkal Keshari Dutta is currently working as Assistant Professor at the Department of  Mathematics, School of Applied Sciences, KIIT deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, India. He has completed his M.Sc in Mathematics from Pondicherry University, Puducherry, India in 2015, and M.Phil in Mathematics from VSSUT, Burla, India in 2016. He received his Ph.D from Sambalpur University, Sambalpur, India in 2021. His research interest is in Number Theory, specifically in the field of Analytic Number Theory, Recurrence Sequences, Diophantine Equations, Multiple Zeta Functions, Arithmetic Functions etc. He has published 14 SCI/SCOPUS indexed research papers in various mainstream journals. Profile: Venkateswara Rao. Role: Assistant Professor II. Bio: Dr. V. Rao Mundlapati is a Senior Assistant Professor in the Department of Chemistry at KIIT Deemed to be University. He obtained his PhD from the National Institute of Science Education and Research (NISER), Bhubaneswar, in 2018. With a diverse research background, Dr. Mundlapati has expertise in several areas including Density Functional Theory (DFT) calculations, conformational studies of peptide foldamers, non-covalent interactions, laser spectroscopy, astrochemistry, and environmental chemistry. 
Dr. Mundlapati brings over six years of postdoctoral experience, having worked in prestigious research institutions across Europe. At CEA, CNRS, and the University of Paris-Saclay, France, he conducted laser spectroscopic studies of sulfur-containing peptides. He further contributed to the field of astrochemistry by studying the spectroscopic properties of Polycyclic Aromatic Hydrocarbon (PAH) cations and their derivatives under astrophysical conditions at the Institut de Recherche en Astrophysique et Planétologie (IRAP), CNRS, and CNES in Toulouse, France. Additionally, he has collaborated on environmental chemistry research at Université de Lille, CNRS, PhLAM - Laboratoire de Physique des Lasers, Atomes et Molécules, Lille, France. 
At present, Dr. Mundlapati is actively involved in both teaching and research. His current research focuses on the role of non-covalent interactions in stabilizing biomolecules and materials, computational studies using DFT, and spectroscopic investigations of astrochemical environments. He is also dedicated to advancing knowledge in environmental chemistry, with an emphasis on understanding molecular interactions and their implications in both natural and synthetic systems. Profile: Vijil Kumar. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Vijil Kumar is currently working as an Assistant Professor at the Department of Mathematics, in the School of Applied Sciences at KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. Dr. Vijil Kumar has completed his Ph. D. in Mathematics and Computing in the year 2022 from Indian Institute of Technology (ISM) Dhanbad, Jharkhand, India. He received his Master’s degree in Mathematics from Gurukula Kangri Vishwavidyalaya, Haridwar, in 2015. He has 1 year of teaching experience at U.G. and P.G. level. He also has about six years of research experience in various fields of Applied Mathematics. His research interest areas include Numerical Analysis, Differential Equations (ODEs), Astrodynamics, Orbital Dynamics, Space Trajectory Optimization and Machine Learning. His broad area of research is space trajectory optimization based numerical and optimization techniques for solving ordinary differential equations. Profile: Vishal Pradhan. Role: Assistant Professor. Profile: Dr Mrs Chandana Mohanty. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. (Mrs.) Chandana Mohanty has 5 years of post graduate teaching experience in Biotechnology and Life Science and more than 8 years of post-Ph.D. extensive research experience. Her areas of research interests are Nano medicinal approach for cancer therapy and Tissue engineering. Dr. Mohanty completed her Ph.D. in Zoology from Berhampur University, Odisha and for her outstanding academic performance in MSc degree in Zoology, She got Dr.P.k. Baliarsingh best Student Award. She got Best teacher award in fish biotechnology vicinity at Fishery science department Utkal University for contribution as a teacher and student project activities accelerator. She has availed post doctoral research fellowship from DST, consequently awarded Fast Track Young Scientist Award (Early Career Research Award) by Science & Engineering Research Board (SERB)-DST, New Delhi and Women’s Scientist Research Grant by DST-Government of India in the field of Life Sciences. She has been successfully completed two research projects as principal investigator, funded by DST, SERB and one sanctioned from UGC (FRPS). She received two international travel grant to present her research work at Magaliesburg, South Africa and Qubec city Canada. She is also a member of selected professional bodies and serves as editorial board member and reviewer for reputed journals. Profile: Dr. Ananya Mitra. Role: Assistant Professor- II. Bio: Dr. Ananya Mitra is an Assistant Professor in Economics with a PhD in Analytical and Applied Economics from Utkal University. Dr. Mitra serves as the course coordinator for various programs, including the Minor in Financial Economics (using Data Analytics) and Minor in Sustainable Development, Open Elective for B.Tech, M.Sc and M.Tech students. Her research interests lie in the intersection of economics and data analytics, and she is dedicated to advancing the understanding of economic principles in technical and interdisciplinary contexts.. Profile: Bidu Bhusan Dash. Role: Assistant Professor. Profile: Rajeev Kumar Panda. Role: Dean. Bio: Dr. Rajeev Kumar Panda has over 20 years of expertise in Teaching & Industry in the area of TV Production/Direction, Electronic Cinematography, Broadcast Journalism & Film Studies. He is a Trainer with the GNI (Google News Initiative) India Training Network, as well as a Trainer with BBC Young Reporter India, which was launched by BBC News in association with Internews and Dataleads. His voyage to the field of mass communication travelled via physics and film school. His background in the practice of films has allowed him to blend his artistic and educational interests by connecting storytelling, critique, and the artistic process to academic skill development. He began teaching in 2001 after graduating from the prestigious Biju Pattnaik Film and TV Institute of Odisha. He has done his PhD from Assam University, Silchar. His PhD Thesis was on Indian Cinema. His publications include several topics on journalism, new media, radio and film studies. In most of his studies, the purpose is to discover how technology influences society and also the film portrayals and perspectives affecting society. He has presented a number of papers at national and international conferences. He has also chaired and co-chaired different sessions at conferences. He had conducted over 50 workshops in universities and colleges throughout India, including the prestigious Delhi University, Kolkata University, GGSIP University, and Rajasthan University, to name a few. Soaring high is his nature. He is the former head of Film and TV at Apeejay Institute of Mass Communication, New Delhi.. Details: . Profile: Vikram Kumar. Role: Senior faculty associate. Email: vikram.kumarfft@kiit.ac.in. Phone: Not available. Info: Biography: Mr. Vikram Kumar has done graduate (B. Profile: Monalisa Das. Role: Faculty Associate. Email: monalisa.das@kiit.ac.in. Phone: Not available. Info: Biography: Ms. Monalisa Das is continuing her Ph.D. degree in UUC. She completed her Diploma in Garment Technology from Women’s Polytechnic, Dhenakanal.  She pursued her B.Design degree in National Institute of Fashion Design, Bhubaneswar, affiliated with Utkal university of culture and received the University’s Gold Medal in, thereby achieving obtained a first-class bachelor’s degree in fashion design. She then pursued her master’s degree in textile design at Utkal University of Culture and received the University’s Gold Medal for graduating with first class and best academic degree in the university. She has more than 15 years of experience in the industrial and teaching sector. She worked as a merchandiser from product development to production in the various export house and handled with different U.S and European buyer such as A&F, Gap, Old Navy, American Eagle Out fitters Inc, (AEO), Land’s End, Target, Bonton, Kohl’s, Catherine Stores, Walmart, J.jill, Cold Water Creek and Club Monaco, etc. Additionally, she has academic experience at BIFT (Bhubaneswar Institute of Fashion Technology), ITT (Institute of Textile Technology) and Apparel Training and Design Center (ATDC), Ministry of Textiles, Cuttack. Thereafter, she worked as Professional Designer (Handicrafts), O/o Development Commissioner (Handicrafts)M & SEC, Bhubaneswar; she worked there to help artisans to create new Designs in various craft. Profile: Dr. Gourab Chatterjee. Role: Senior Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Gourab Chatterjee is Assistant Professor at the School of Liberal Studies, KIIT. With over 10 years of teaching and research experience, he holds a PhD from Jadavpur University. His expertise includes African and Indian Literatures, Literary Theory, and Cultural Studies. He has published extensively in national and international journals and edited volumes. A certified Swahili language user and translator, he also holds IPR for a rural handicrafts business model. He has presented at major international conferences and currently serves as Coordinator of the Centre for Cultural Studies and Comparative Literature and Faculty-in-Charge of International Relations. He is a life member of CLAI and an active member of ICLA.. Details: Email: gourab.chatterjeesol@kiit.ac.in, Scopus: https://www.scopus.com/authid/detail.uri?authorId=57453983600, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=O2ogzOoAAAAJ&hl=en, ORCID: https://orcid.org/0000-0002-5799-9666. Resource Person in the Faculty Development Programme on Rethinking Pedagogy through Indian Knowledge Systems and Innovations organized by Christ University, Pune, 2025 Professional Membership: Comparative Literature Association of India (CLAI), International Comparative Literature Association (ICLA) Projects & Consultancies: Project Operator in the Project Bichitra, funded by Ministry of Culture, Government of India, undertaken by the School of Cultural Texts and Records, Jadavpur University, Kolkata, West Bengal, India. Patents and Innovations: Intellectual Property Rights on “Rural Handicrafts Business Model” in the field of Literary/ Dramatic Work Business Model of Rural Handicrafts in Context of Pattachitra i.e. Scroll Painting, co-authored by Dr. Nilanjan Roy, Ms. Debanjali Roy, Dr. Soumya Sankar Ghosh, Mr. Debarshi Ghosh, Mr. Aliv Banerjee, Dr. Tanmoy Putatunda, Dr. Gourab Chatterjee, and Dr. Anurima Hazra. Profile: Dr. Arpita Goswami. Role: Senior Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Arpita Goswami is an assistant professor in the School of Liberal Studies, KIIT deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha. Dr. Goswami obtained her PhD. from Tripura university in 2018. She cracked the National Eligibility Test (NET UGC) and the North East State Level Eligibility Test in English. She was awarded an ICSSR doctoral fellowship in 2013. She has presented research papers at numerous national and international conferences, seminars, and workshops and has published ten research papers in Scopus-indexed and other peer-reviewed journals. Her research interests include linguistics, English Language Teaching, folklore, feminism, and gender studies.. Profile: Dr. Arpita Nayak. Role: Assistant Professor I. Bio: Dr. Arpita Nayak is currently serving as an Assistant Professor, offering courses in management. She completed her Ph.D. in management from the KIIT School of Management. Her MBA and strong interest in Human Resource Management (HRM) led her to pursue further studies in HRM. Her passion for talent management inspired her doctoral research on “A Comparative Study on Talent Management in Private and Public Manufacturing Industries in Odisha.” Dr. Nayak has presented research papers at both national and international conferences and has published articles in SCOPUS-listed journals. Over the years, she has taught a variety of subjects, including Human Resource Management, Principles of Management, Business Studies Management, Tribal Entrepreneurship, and Organizational Behaviour. In addition to her academic career, she also has several years of corporate work experience.. Profile: Dr. Bignya Patnaik. Role: Senior Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Bignya Patnaik is an Assistant Professor teaching management courses. She holds a Ph.D. in Management from NALSAR University of Law and a master’s in Economics, with additional qualifications in Human Resource Management and Training & Development. Her research focuses on diversity and equality management in higher education. She has presented at national and international conferences and published in SCOPUS-listed journals. With experience in both teaching and administration, she has taught subjects such as HRM, Organizational Behaviour, Business Ethics, CSR, Leadership, Emotional Intelligence, and Diversity & Inclusion.. Profile: Dr. Chaitali Choudhury. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Chaitali Choudhury is an Assistant Professor of English in the Department of Humanities, School of Liberal Studies, KIIT-DU. She completed her graduation and post-graduation from the University of Kalyani, West Bengal, and received her Ph.D. from National Institute of Technology Rourkela, Odisha. Her doctoral research focuses on ascetic ideals in Indian nationalist thought. Her research interests also include life writings, cultural studies, gender and religion.. Profile: Dr. Chetna Sinha. Role: Senior Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Chetna Sinha is presently working as Assistant Professor (II) in the Department of Humanities, KIIT School of Liberal Studies, in the KIIT University, Bhubaneshwar. She has an experience of over sixteen years in teaching and training in English Language, Literature, Communication & Soft Skills at various levels. She is a Ph.D. in English with Masters in ELT & Linguistics. She has also done her MBA in HRM. She is a certified Soft Skills & Body Language Trainer from IIT, Roorkee through NPTEL. She is also a certified trainer on Enhancing Soft Skills and Personality from IIT Kanpur. She has conducted many workshops and training programs for the entry and middle level executives. Her areas of interest include Soft Skills and Behavioral Training.. Profile: Khushboo Kuddus. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Dr. Khushboo  is an Associate Professor in the Department of Humanities at the School of Liberal Studies, KIIT DU, Bhubaneswar. With over 11 years of academic experience, she has imparted knowledge across UG, PG, and PhD programs at esteemed institutions, including Amity University and the Central University of Jharkhand, Ranchi. She holds a PhD in English and a Master’s degree in English with a specialization in ELT and Linguistics. Further enhancing her pedagogical expertise, she obtained her PGCTE and PGDTE from EFL University, Hyderabad. Her research interests encompass ELT, CALL, ICALL, TELT, Applied Linguistics, Phonetics, and Phonology. Notably, her research in ICALL reflects her interdisciplinary approach to language learning and teaching. Dr. Khushboo has successfully supervised PhD research in CALL, TELT, and ELT. She has presented papers at numerous national and international conferences and has published several papers, proceedings, and book chapters of  repute in the fields of  CALL and ICALL. She has also delivered talks as an  Invited Speaker at  prestigious colleges and universities and has chaired sessions in several national and international conferences.. Profile: Seema Kumari Ladsaria. Role: Associate Dean. Bio: Dr. Seema Kumari Ladsaria is an Associate Professor in the Department of Humanities, School of Liberal Studies, KIIT University. She holds a Ph.D. from IIT ISM Dhanbad on “Imaging and Semiology: A Study of Roland Barthes’s Literary Theory.” Her research interests include Semiotic Studies, Medicine and Literature, Graphic Fiction, and Energy Humanities. A Fellow of the Royal Asiatic Society, London, she has published widely in reputed international journals and supervised Ph.D. research on diverse interdisciplinary topics. She received an ICSSR project on cognitive distortion during the COVID-19 era (2021) and a conference grant on Indigenous Languages (2019). Dr. Ladsaria’s research explores literature, films, and media through multidisciplinary and eco-humanistic perspectives, emphasizing climate change, vulnerability, and the evolving intersections of text and context.. Profile: Dr. Shipra Gupta. Role: Senior Assistant Professor. Bio: Shipra Gupta is an Assistant Professor of English in KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, India. She has been teaching undergraduate and postgraduate level students since 2014. Before joining KIIT she worked as a Post-Doctoral Fellow, Centre of Excellence for Translation and Life writing at Rama Devi Women’s University, Bhubaneswar which was funded by the World Bank under the OHEPEE program. Dr. Gupta completed her Masters and M.Phil. in English Literature with a specialization in American Literature and Film Studies from Utkal University, Bhubaneswar. She obtained her Ph.D. Degree from KIIT Deemed to be University and her focus area was film remakes across cultures. She has presented papers on film studies/criticism in national and international conferences. Her research articles have been published in journals and as chapters in edited books that are indexed under Scopus, Springer and UGC. Her research interests include Media Studies, Culture Studies, various forms of Life writing and Trans-cultural Adaptations.. Profile: Shraddha Dhal. Role: Faculty Associate. Bio: Dr. Shraddha Dhal has a demonstrated history of working in the Education management industry, skilled in Research, Communication, Teaching, and Interpersonal Skills. She has presented papers at conferences, published articles and papers in journals of National & International repute, and translated a major portion Lachhama, the iconic historical fiction of the great Odia writer Vyasa Kavi Fakir Mohan Senapati. Her research interests focus on the Post-colonial Fiction, Diaspora Studies, Cultural Studies, Minority Community and Identity Crisis with a specific emphasis on the Parsi community, an ethno-religious minority in India.. Profile: Dr. Subarna Bhattacharya. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Subarna Bhattacharya is an Assistant Professor of English in the School of Liberal Studies, KIIT University. She holds her BA and MA from Jadavpur University and a Ph.D. from the University of Calcutta. With over eight years of teaching experience, she specializes in travel writing, cultural studies, gender studies, women’s writing, and colonial historiography. She has published widely in national and international journals and completed a RUSA-funded project on 19th-century women’s travel writings in colonial India. Dr. Bhattacharya is part of the international research project Intercultural Perspectives on Information Literacy and Metaliteracy with universities in Germany, the U.S., Bosnia, and India. Passionate about teaching, she designs and teaches English and Soft Skills courses and has co-edited textbooks on literature and communication.. Profile: Dr. Sudeshna Datta Chaudhuri. Role: Senior Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. S. D. Chaudhuri received her doctoral degree in English literature from Jadavpur University in 2013. She qualified for UGC-NET in 2007. From 2008 to 2017, Dr. Chaudhuri has worked in Lady Brabourne College, Kolkata; Institute for Civil Service Aspirants (ICSA), Kolkata; and the School of Cultural Texts & Records (SCTR), Jadavpur University, Kolkata. In SCTR, Dr. Chaudhuri has worked on India-UK Academic & Educational Network Programme under UGC-UPE-I scheme, and Music Digitisation Project in the SCTR Archive of Hindustani Classical Music under UGC-UPE-II. She has taught in the Digital Humanities & Cultural Informatics course run by the SCTR. She is trained in Hindustani Classical Music (vocal), with a Sangeet Prabhakar from Prayag Sangeet Samiti, Allahabad. She is proficient in English, Bangla, and Hindi, and has been a regular book reviewer for The Telegraph, Kolkata. Dr. Chaudhuri considers resource-creation through research, translation, and digitization, a crucial part of current academia.. Profile: Dr. Swati Samantaray. Role: Professor. Bio: Dr. Swati Samantaray, Professor in the Department of Humanities, School of Liberal Studies, KIIT University, has been a dedicated educator since 1997. She holds a Ph.D. in English from Utkal University and brings over 27 years of teaching experience in English Literature and Professional Communication. Honoured with the Best Faculty Award in 2012 by KIIT & KISS Founder Dr. A. Samanta, Dr. Samantaray has authored and edited several notable works, including The Mystic Flights of Tagore , Mysticism: A Literary Quest for Ultimate Reality , and Folklore: A Key to Cultural Understanding . Her research spans mysticism, feminism, ecocriticism, film and cultural studies, and digital humanities. A mentor and motivator, she blends academic excellence with social commitment, inspiring students toward holistic growth and humanistic values.. Profile: Dr. Tanmoy Putatunda. Role: Assistant Professor I. Bio: Tanmoy Putatunda is an Assistant Professor of English at the School of Liberal Studies, KIIT University, India. He has received his doctorate degree from the Department of English, Visva-Bharati, Santiniketan, India. He has a cumulative teaching experience of eight years. Prior to joining KIIT University, he served as the Head of the Department of English Language and Literature, Adamas University, Kolkata, India. He completed his bachelor’s and master’s degrees in English Literature with first class from Visva-Bharati, Santiniketan. He was awarded University Grants Commission Junior Research Fellowship (JRF) in 2013. His research interests include Urban Studies, Representation of City in Literature, Indian Literature in English, Culture Studies, Postmodern and Postcolonial Literature.. Profile: Dr. Trina Bose. Role: Assistant Professor I. Bio: Dr. Trina Bose earned her Ph.D. in English (Eco-fiction) from the Indian Institute of Technology Bhubaneswar in 2023, with a specialisation in Environmental Humanities and a research focus on the intersections of literature, ecology, and climate discourse. She completed certificate courses on anthropogenic climate change at the University of Exeter and Harvard University in 2020. Holding an M.A. in English Literature from Banaras Hindu University and a B.A. (Hons.) in English from the University of Burdwan, Dr. Bose presented papers and chaired sessions at national and international conferences. Her publications include book chapters and articles in UGC-sponsored, peer-reviewed, Web of Science-indexed, and Scopus-indexed journals.. Profile: Dr. Nisha Tiwari. Role: Assistant Professor  (French). Bio: Dr. Nisha Tiwari is an Assistant Professor of French at the Department of Language & Literature, School of Liberal Studies, KIIT-Deemed to be University, where she also serves as the Academic and IQAC Coordinator. Prior to this, she spent over three years as an Assistant Professor and Language Coordinator at Amity University, Haryana, where she played a key role in curriculum development, particularly in alignment with the NEP 2023 guidelines. A dedicated scholar, Dr. Tiwari holds a Ph.D. in French from Jawaharlal Nehru University, where her research explored the visual representation of Indian women in 19th-century French literature. Her M.Phil., also from JNU, examined the portrayal of Indian women in French comics. Dr. Tiwari has presented several research papers at international seminars and symposiums and published in peer-reviewed journals on subjects ranging from the psychoanalysis of French travellers and indologists to the depiction of women in African and Indian contexts within French media. Fluent in French, English, Hindi, Romanian, and Urdu, she is known for her innovative approaches to language pedagogy, creating an inclusive and dynamic learning environment. Her commitment to fostering cross-cultural dialogue is evident in her work both in academia and the broader community, using language as a bridge to connect diverse cultures. Contact: Phone: Not available, Email: nisha.tiwarifls@kiit.ac.in. Profile: Dr. Anand Kumar Soni. Role: Assistant Professor  (French). Bio: Assistant Professor (French) Dr. Anand Kumar Soni is an Assistant Professor at the Department of Language & Literature, School of Liberal Studies, KIIT-Deemed to be University, specializing in French cinema and translation. He earned his Ph.D. from Banaras Hindu University(BHU) and has a strong academic background, having previously served as an Assistant Professor at Amity University Patna for three years. Dr. Soni has actively participated in several national and international workshops and conferences, contributing to the academic discourse in his field. His research work is well-recognized, with multiple papers published in UGC CARE-listed journals. Passionate about language, culture, and cinema, he continues to inspire students through his teaching and scholarly contributions. Contact: Phone: Not available, Email: anand.soniksol@kiit.ac.in. Profile: Dr. Sukanto Mazumder. Role: Assistant Professor  (Japanese). Bio: Assistant Professor (Japanese) Dr. Sukanto Mazumder is an Assistant Professor of Japanese at the Department of Language & Literature, School of Liberal Studies, KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, India. He is a dedicated academician who was awarded a Ph.D. in Japanese literature from Visva-Bharati, Santiniketan. He holds his M.A. degree in Japanese from the University of Delhi. His research primarily explores the works of famous Japanese writer Kenji Miyazawa, with published papers in international journals and conference proceedings. Prestigious training programs, including the JENESYS initiative in Japan, enrich his academic journey. He completed the “The Japanese Language Teachers” training course conducted by the Ministry of External Affairs of India and the Embassy of Japan in India with the support of The Japan Foundation, from September 12, 2018, to September 16, 2018, at Santiniketan, West Bengal. At present, he is engaged in research on pre-modern Japanese literature. Contact: Phone: Not available, Email: sukanto.mazumder@kiit.ac.in. Profile: Ms. Teeju Bhagat. Role: Assistant Professor  ( Spanish ). Bio: Assistant Professor ( Spanish ) Ms. Teeju Bhagat is an Assistant Professor of Spanish in the Department of Language & Literature, School of Liberal Studies, KIIT Deemed to be University, India. She is pursuing her PhD from Centre of Spanish, Portuguese, Italian and Latin American Studies (CSPILAS), Jawaharlal Nehru University, specializing in Hispanic Philology and Literature. She holds a Master of Philosophy (M.Phil.) degree in Spanish Language and Literature, complemented by a Master of Arts and Bachelors of Arts degree in Spanish from the same university. She has done C1 level from Instituto Cervantes, New Delhi. She qualified UGC (NET-JRF) in December, 2018. Ms. Bhagat has been selected to participate in a teacher training course for Spanish as a foreign language at the Centro Internacional del Español of the Universidad de Salamanca (CIEUSAL), Spain in September, 2024. She received Prof. Susnigdha Dey Conference Grant (2022) to present her paper in an international conference.  She worked as a University Teaching Assistant at Jawaharlal Nehru University for two years, where she taught Spanish Language and Literature and also Portuguese certificate course. Moreover, she was empanelled as an Academic Counsellor for Masters of Spanish Language at Indira Gandhi National Open University (IGNOU), and Guest faculty in DSEU (Delhi Skill and Entrepreneurship University). She has book chapters and research articles published in reputed international book publications and in several peer-reviewed international journals. She has also presented several papers in international conferences on Hispanic and Lusophone studies. Her areas of research interest include Comparative Literature, Gender Studies, Decolonial Studies, Popular Culture, Folklore Studies, Migration Studies, Linguistics and Cinema Studies . She is proficient in Hindi, English, Spanish, and Portuguese languages. Contact: Phone: Not available, Email: teeju.bhagatksol@kiit.ac.in. Profile: Mr. Vishant Vikash Sinha. Role: Assistant Professor  (German ). Bio: Assistant Professor ( German ) Mr. Vishant Vikash Sinha is an Assistant Professor of German in the Department of Languages and Literature, School of Liberal Studies, KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, India. He is pursuing a PhD in German Studies at Jawaharlal Nehru University, New Delhi specializing in the intersection of verbal and visual narratives, particularly in Heinrich von Kleist’s works. Vishant also holds an M.Phil., M.A., and B.A. in German Studies from the same institution, where he gained valuable experience as a Teaching Assistant. With a strong academic foundation and industry-oriented approach, Vishant has successfully integrated his research into practical applications. His expertise extends to teaching and curriculum development, where he emphasizes industry-relevant skills in German language, literature and cultural studies. At KIIT, he designs and delivers courses that prepare students to learn the language from scratch and engage with the global literary and cultural industries, focusing on contemporary German-speaking regions and their cultural histories. Vishant’s research and academic contributions explore critical themes such as Migration in graphic novels, Intertextuality, Intermediality and Intersection of Mythology & Literature. He has been awarded the Junior Research Fellowship (JRF), Senior Research Fellowship (SRF) and has qualified the National Eligibility Test (NET) for Assistant Professorship, conducted by UGC, Government of India. Contact: Phone: Not available, Email: vishant.sinhaksol@kiit.ac.in. Profile: Ms. Melanie Waser. Role: German Language Teacher & Executive- International Relations Office. Bio: German Language Teacher & Executive- International Relations Office Ms. Melanie Waser is associated with the Department of Language & Literature, School of Liberal Studies, KIIT Deemed to be University as a German Language Teacher. She is also having the additional responsibility as an Executive of the University’s International Relations Office (IRO). Ms. Waser was born and raised in central Switzerland and completed her Master’s degree in Molecular Life Sciences with focus on biochemistry and chemical biology in 2018 at University of Bern, Switzerland. Following this, she pursued a career in Regulatory Affairs, managing the documentary requirements of medicines for marketing authorisation as well as life cycle management with focus on the Swiss market. Ms. Waser was responsible for the due diligence/regulatory approval of medical drugs and devices that were to be launched in the Swiss Market. Some of her major pharma clients were Bayer, Takeda, Astra Zeneca etc. In 2021, Ms. Waser moved to India with her husband exploring the various languages and cultures of a country very different from Europe. Contact: Phone: Not available, Email: melanie.waser@kiit.ac.in.
