Profile: Dr. Anish Pandey. Role: ASSISTANT PROFESSOR-II. Bio: Dr. Anish Pandey earned his Ph.D. in Robotics and Control (Mechanical Engineering – Design) from NIT Rourkela in 2016. His research focuses on bio-inspired optimization, fuzzy logic, neural networks, and evolutionary algorithms for robot motion and orientation control. With over eight years of post-Ph.D. teaching and research experience, he serves as Assistant Professor II (Level-11) at the School of Mechanical Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University. Dr. Pandey has published 36 papers (21 SCI/SCIE and 15 Scopus/WoS), holds 17 granted and 33 filed patents, and has over 2,500 Google Scholar citations. He teaches Machine Design, Mechatronics, FEM, and AI-based manufacturing. His ongoing projects include autonomous cleaning, articulated, and humanoid robots, alongside a sponsored project from TIH IIT Guwahati and various consultancy assignments.. Profile: Dr. Bharat Chandra Routara. Role: Senior Professor. Bio: Dr. Bharat Chandra Routara is a Senior Professor at the School of Mechanical Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University, where he also serves as Chairman of the Central Library Committee. He earned his Ph.D. in Production Engineering from Jadavpur University in 2008. With over 30 years of teaching experience, he has guided seven Ph.D. scholars (five ongoing) and seventeen M.Tech students. His research focuses on non-traditional machining, cryogenic cooling, surface characterization, and optimization of machinability parameters. He holds an international patent and is a Fellow of The Institution of Engineers (India) and a life member of ISTE, IIIE, and The Institution of Engineering and Technology (IET).. Profile: Dr. Sudhanshu Dubey. Role: Assistant Professor I. Bio: Dr. Sudhanshu Dubey, is an Assistant Professor in the School of Mechanical Engineering at Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT), India. He earned his Ph.D. in Mechanical Engineering from IIT Bombay, MTech. from IIT Guwahati, and B.E. from GEC Bilaspur. His doctoral research pioneered the development of Optimal Laminated Additive Manufacturing (OptiLAM), integrating advanced laser-based techniques with multi-axis automation. Dr. Dubey’s research spans Additive Manufacturing, CNC Technology, Robotics & Automation, and Laser–Material Interaction, with contributions including patents, international publications, and conference presentations. A recipient of multiple academic and research awards, Dr. Dubey continues to drive innovation in manufacturing automation.. Profile: Dr. Jitendra Kumar Patel. Role: Assistant Professor II. Bio: Dr. Jitendra Kumar Patel obtained his Bachelor of Engineering degree in Mechanical Engineering from Chhatrapati Shivaji Institute of Technology Durg, Chhattisgarh in 2010 and completed his Master of Technology from Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati in 2012. After obtaining his master’s degree, he continued his research and studies at IIT Guwahati by joining the Ph.D. program in the Department of Mechanical Engineering. He successfully defended his Ph.D. thesis, titled, “A generic and robust numerical framework for multi-phase flows using Volume-of-Fluid/Immersed boundary methods” in 2018. His broad area of research includes computational fluid dynamics, multi-phase flows, fluid-structure interactions, and miscible fluids interaction. Currently, he focuses on the analysis, development, and fabrication of micro-mixers in microfluidics applications involving two miscible fluids interactions. In 2017, he joined the Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology, Deemed to be university Bhubaneswar as an Assistant Professor in the School of Mechanical Engineering.. Profile: Dr. Kunja Bihari Sahu. Role: Professor. Bio: Prof. (Dr.) Kunja Bihari Sahu completed his Ph. D. (Mechanical Engineering) from Jadavpur University, M. Tech. (Thermal Engineering) and B. Tech. (Mechanical Engineering) from University College of Engineering, Burla (presently VSSUT, Burla). He has an experience of more than 33 years in teaching. His major areas of interest include Combustion, Heat Transfer, and applications of Computational Fluid Dynamics in Enclosure problems. He has guided 3 Ph. D. scholars and 17 Master’s dissertation and published more than 30 research articles in peer reviewed international journals, international and national conference proceedings. He is currently a Professor at School of Mechanical Engineering in KIIT Deemed to be University. He has also taken up the position of Dean (UG Programmes) of KIIT Deemed to be University. He occupied important positions like University Academic Council member; Chairman, Board of Studies (BoS) of School of Mechanical Engineering. Prior to this, he served as the Director (Academics) of Spintronic Technology and Advanced Research, Bhubaneswar. Dr. Sahu is a Life Member of Indian Society for Technical Education (ISTE), Indian Society for Heat and Mass Transfer (ISHMT), and Indian Science Congress Association (ISCA). He is also a Fellow of Institution of Engineers (India).. Profile: Dr. Nilotpala Bej. Role: Assistant Professor II. Bio: Dr. Nilotpala Bej is an Assistant Professor in the School of Mechanical Engineering at KIIT, Bhubaneswar. She holds a B.Tech in Mechanical Engineering from UCE Burla, an M.Tech in Thermal Engineering from NIT Rourkela, and a Ph.D. from IIT Kharagpur (2015). Her research work focuses on computational fluid dynamics (CFD), including gas liquefaction at cryogenic temperatures, vortex tube gas separation, and winglet aerodynamics. Skilled in ANSYS FLUENT, OriginPro, and Tecplot, she currently guides two Ph.D. scholars, with one receiving a doctorate in 2025. She also serves as Faculty-in-Charge (International Students), CAE Lab, and Tutor-Mentor Committee. A lifetime member of ISTE and ISCA, she is treasurer of ISHRAE Bhubaneswar. She has organized ICAMPD 2019, ATAL FDP 2024, and VAANI 2025.. Profile: Dr. Nitin Sharma. Role: Associate Professor-II. Bio: Dr. Nitin Sharma is an Associate Professor (II), Associate Dean, and Program Head of B.Tech. Mechanical Engineering at the School of Mechanical Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar. He holds a B.Tech. from IIITDM Jabalpur, an M.E. in Mechanical and Control Engineering from the Tokyo Institute of Technology (Japan) under the MEXT Fellowship, and a Ph.D. from KIIT (2018). With over 60 SCI-indexed papers and 17 Scopus publications (H-index 23, i10-index 44), his research focuses on vibroacoustics, metamaterials, aeroelastic flutter, and composite modeling. He has guided two Ph.D. scholars and led a DST-SERB (TARE) project on acoustic metamaterials. A recipient of KIIT’s Top 5 Researcher Award (2021–22) and the Best Technical Paper Award (2018), he continues to excel in interdisciplinary mechanical research.. Profile: Dr. Prakash Ghose. Role: Associate Professor I. Bio: Dr. Prakash Ghose is a faculty member in the School of Mechanical Engineering, KIIT University. After completing his B.Tech, he worked as a Project Engineer at Predominant Engineers Pvt. Ltd., Gurgaon. He later obtained his Master’s degree in Heat Power Engineering from VSSUT, Burla, and subsequently joined KIIT University as a faculty member. Dr. Ghose earned his Ph.D. from Jadavpur University, Kolkata, specializing in combustion, where he worked on a gas turbine combustor project sponsored by GTRE, Bengaluru. His research interests include thermal sciences, combustion modeling, devolatilization kinetics, and CFD-based energy simulations. He also supervises several Ph.D. scholars, focusing on experimental and numerical research in combustion and energy systems.. Profile: Dr. Ramanuj Kumar. Role: Associate Professor I. Bio: Dr. Ramanuj Kumar has over 12 years of teaching experience. Profile: Dr. Sanjib Jaypuria. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Sanjib Jaypuria earned his Ph.D. in Electron and Laser Beam Welding, along with modelling and optimization utilizing Machine Learning methodologies, from the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT), Kharagpur, India, in 2021. Prior to this, he completed his M.Tech from IIT Delhi and B.Tech in Mechanical Engineering from NIT Rourkela. Dr. Jaypuria gained industry experience at L&T and Tata Motors after completing his B.Tech. His primary research interests revolve around employing machine learning for modelling and soft computing for optimization in manufacturing processes, and 3D Printing. Additionally, he delves into mechanical and metallurgical characterization, robotics, and their various applications. Profile: Dr. Shanta Chakrabarty. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Shanta Chakrabarty has been an Assistant Professor at KIIT University since July 2018. She earned her B.Tech in Mechanical Engineering from CET Bhubaneswar in 2009 and completed her Ph.D. in Metallurgical Engineering and Material Science at IIT Bombay in 2015. Her research spans crystallographic orientation effects, deformation mechanics, and material behaviour modelling. As a Senior Scientist at SANDVIK ASIA, Pune (2015–2018), she worked on microstructure-property driven projects, weldability enhancement, and magnetocaloric material development. She is skilled in materials characterization (FESEM, EBSD, TKD, TMS, NANOINDENTER, DSC, TEM etc) and computational tools (COMSOL, MATLAB, PAM-STAMP and DD Simulation).Her expertise includes thermo-mechanical behaviour of material, microstructural engineering, and advanced metal-forming. With numerous publications, she has guided 2 Ph.D. and 2 M.Tech students by 2024. Dr. Chakrabarty specializes in materials innovation and mechanical behavior of Material at micro and nano scales..
